Almost all our partners are from countries that are struggling financially and our students also get an opportunity to experience and learn how your daily life functioning in the workplace and in society in terms of economy and what it can lead to daily . The students will experience during their stay will be a lesson that they should be able to bring forward in their industries / disciplines and especially to share with their peers at home. This mobility project involving two secondary schools with Restaurant and Food Processing majors , they also have many hotels and restaurants as their partners and they are willing to give our students a good education. 10 organizations that lays the ground for corporate deployment , residence , language courses and cultural elements , which have long experience in taking care of VET graduates in many disciplines . They can offer us good training places within which the RFP International restaurants and hotels are partners, this emphasizes the importance of having the anguish that we mention in the project title . When it comes HC subjects so our partners have many good partners in home care , retirement homes , hospitals , home for handicapped children and adults, home for orphans and internships in primary and secondary schools where children and youth workers can have their practice in terms of being able to help students who are struggling academically and socially. Proper nutrition with a good and varied foodhold is also an important issue for HC students. SS students will also be able to get good training places in top clubs and we hope it will be a good start for further work with this group of students. Our students may have opportunities to acquire lessons which could help to give them greater knowledge in many areas of their education. Accompanying persons will go 1-2 people to one of the project partners with the students ( who are not all over 18 years) , partly to ensure their well-being and monitor their professional activities and development, but also to have their own experiences on how we can improve the quality of oversight and support duties in the workplace and the business deployment . The organizer of this project proposal is Strinda high school in South Trøndelag County , Encyclopedia Vgs is responsible for the contractual tasks, allocation of funds and reporting. The project consists of 3-4 weeks of student internship of 66 VET graduates and 14 instructors to 8 countries .Strinda high school will give some of the candidates 10 hours of language lessons also some cultural lessons from the city / country candidates to it. Each recipient organization will also provide a 3-4 day with an introduction to the language, culture and profession professional life in the host country and then a 2.5 - weeks of work - student internship in a company related to the goals of the candidate's training program. Host organizations will provide food, accommodation, cultural and social initiatives for the visitors at very reasonable prices. The most important thing about this project is that students should be able to have the opportunity to learn a little about how other countries are practicing their professions and how training takes place in the companies we get the opportunity to practice in , language and culture will also have an important place in the project . Encyclopedia Vgs hope that the students who get the opportunity to be able to get a different view of their practical training , taking the small experiences that can be used in their own teaching and possibly work in the future .

The IES Faro Maspaloma  is a public official education center belonging to the Ministry of Education founded Canary , located in the main tourist area of Gran Canaria. In the quality objectives of the Centre, this year we intend to expand training opportunities for our students improve their learning offer within Europe , through the convening of + Erasmus Programme . As an educational center with a quality management system and the pursuit of continuous improvement in European excellence , we feel a responsibility to our students to broaden their employment prospects . Promote the mobility of students / as in Europe promoting the rapprochement of cultures and breaking both social and linguistic borders , expanding their opportunities for training and employment, to increase the volume of cooperation with three different countries. Canary , as a place of visit for many Europeans ( Germans, Italians and English mostly) needs to foster the learning of different languages , as the service professions , which in this project makes reference requires it to improve quality of training of our students . Furthermore, Canarias has become a second home for many Europeans, where they spend long periods . This population is the subject of attention of our future professionals. Project participants are 32 young people aged between 16 and 35 years and 2 teachers, residents in the main tourist district of Gran Canaria and areas of influence. 2 teacher of Professional Family Personal Image : Its function is to Leverage training Hairdressing and Beauty , 2 Professor of Family Hospitality Professional : Technical specialists in Kitchen and Restaurant and Bar, Its function is to promote the training professional Kitchen and Restaurant and Bar , 1 teacher of German : whose function is to know the education system , labor and their interrelations , business, labor relations and regulations as well as the usefulness and importance of legislation on the prevention of risks
Students currently enrolled in the first year of their training cycle . In the development phase of the project will be found attending the last course where it will conduct its business practices . Fundamental to our alumni / ae undertake part of their training in workplaces in companies from Germany, Italy and the UK and elsewhere in firms Canaries, with this we contribute to improvements in the system of vocational training in Canary considering its globality and looking to achieve high levels of quality and innovation to form a highly qualified human resources to respond to changing labor market needs . Therefore, it is important that our alumni / ae dominating some European languages for further implementation , obtaining an improvement in service quality and satisfaction of our visitors.
This project will allow us to establish the appropriate channels for future stays / improvement exchanges in Europe with students and faculty to continue to update their own knowledge. We hope to acquire new knowledge to develop new strategies relationship between school and NOW , and to promote self-employment in these times of economic crisis. Likewise, we establish mechanisms for collaboration with other schools and European companies using virtual platforms that facilitate the exchange of best teaching practices in the future.
АНГЛИЙСКАТА КУЛИНАРНА КУЛТУРА ЗА РАЗВИТИЕ НА ПРЕДПРИЕМАЧЕСКИТЕ УМЕНИЯ В АЛТЕРНАТИВНИЯ ТУРИЗЪМ / English culinary culture for developing entrepreneurial skills in alternative tourism

The project " English culinary culture for developing entrepreneurial skills in alternative tourism"  aims to enrich and improve the acquired skills of 20 students , professional field "Restaurant "and four representatives of the school / teaching and non-teaching staff / from  Vocational School "Aleko Konstantinov" Mezdra,  to learn new professional vocabulary, to explore and utilize established European practices and innovation technology in the modern cuisine and restaurants.
By manufacturing practice in competitive terms , students will go beyond the traditional training , you will gain an understanding of the real work environment complying with European standards. The project beneficiaries are children from poor families , minority living in economically poor region . Students have professional experience in theoretical classes , practical training in a school kitchen in PG and practical in a real production environment - operating restaurants and eateries in Mezdra and surroundings. Priorities of the economic development of the Municipality village was tourism , which puts to professional education in the area required for the preparation of highly qualified specialists in the field of hotel and restaurant services , prepared by European standards . The project will enable the beneficiaries to enhance their foreign language skills , gain confidence in their abilities to learn and transfer new educational initiatives in the field of vocational education .
The implementation of the project will proceed in two phases:
Phase 1: Preparation of beneficiaries - will be held prior linguistic, pedagogical and cultural preparation , career-oriented , personal progress , intercultural and language skills of the students and the pedagogical and non-teaching staff.
Phase 2 : Mobility
1.Practice for students abroad - 14 days . Period was considered so as to allow full implementation and upgrade the knowledge and skills acquired during the theoretical training. Activities on the preparation and implementation of the project will be distributed according to preliminary cooperation agreement .
2 . Organization of training courses for the staff  - 14 days . Period is consistent with the teaching time and capabilities of the team to not have to replace absent teachers. By all participants in the project activities will be required feedback and report on the activities.
The content of the training program for mobility of students is consistent with program planning practice and state educational requirements for acquiring tertiary qualification. It meets the needs of participants who were examined by the pre- survey.
The content of the training course for teachers meet the needs of staff training and development of personal skills and Competences acquisition under development strategy " Europe 2020 " .
The project will update and improve professional knowledge and skills that will motivate beneficiaries to be more efficient of the labor market . Familiarization with new content , techniques and methods of work will be in favor of the developement of alternative tourism in the area.
Expected results from the mobility of students and teachers are:
- Gained practical experience in the profession "Restaurant " 20 people in initial vocational training ;
- Knowledge and experience in the profession "Restaurant " ;
- Acquired knowledge and skills in key competencies .
- Improved employment opportunities for young disadvantaged people in the restaurant and rural tourism.
- Creation of lasting relationships between the partners on the purpose of exchanging ideas , programs and future mobility .
- Raise the profile of vocational school " Al.Konstantinov " through quality vocational training .

The project "Nurses  to  Europe" is prepared for the students of Secondary Nursing School in Hranice, branch nursing, finished by the chool leaving exam.  The presenter of this project as well as the sending organization is the Secondary Nursing School in Hranice. The students acquire at  school wide theoretical knowledge and they have lessons of practical training at school laboratories, caring institutions and hospitals. Suitable extention of above mentioned education will be  the educational stay abroad where students could see new methods and get update information in their branch and also obtain higher level of language competences.
The partners for this project  are two institutions.  Language Solution, Portsmouth, England, educational institution whose main role is to find the working positions in the local health and nursing institutions. Last year our students spent in Portsmouth 2 weeks working in caring institutions. This year we found a new partner, Future Focus Ltd., Floriana, Malta because we want to extent the possibility of  work abroad for our students. The  mobilities  will be organized in the form of 3 week educational stays of 14 students and 1 teacher. Educational stays are planned to be organized in November 2014 and May 2015. The students of the third and fourth year will take part in them. In the above mentioned years students have regular practical training twice a week in different departements in the hospital in Hranice and in Přerov and the educational stay abroad will be effective addition to this practical training as well as theoretical education in the main subjects - Nursing, Psychology and Communication, First aid. Students from Hranice and from Přerov will participate in the  project.

The main goals of the project are:
1) to improve special education of the students - especially their practical training
2) to extent students´ knowledge in the field of their studies 
3) to show students different ways of nursing abroad
4) to extent students´knowledge and skills and introduce new methods
5) to support effective way of learning foreign language through the stay abroad
6) to help understand culture, traditions, education in a foreign country as well as the organization and conditions of the labour market in the EU countries.
The expected results of the project are:
1) to improve special nursing education of our students especially their practical training
2) to extent students´knowledge in their practical education and through this support extention of their qualification
3) usage of the gained information from the field of nersing in our country
4) to support students in getting jobs in our country as well as abroad with the help of Europass mobility document
5) increased confidence of the students doing jobs abroad
6) to start long lasting cooperation with educational and health institutions in the visited countries
7) to increase motivation for studying not only special subjects but also foreign languages

The main objective of the project is familiarising  students participating in vocational education  with new technologies already used abroad, which  can be put into domestic practice , and thus strengthen their employment opportunities in the labour market . In this project we focus on the development of general and professional foreign language skills and willingness for mobility.  With the receiving partner, we have put together a programme, which allows  our students the development of professional competencies and  in case of teacher mobility the promotion of institutional utilization of the results. Secondary technical school that proposes this project provides secondary education in these fields: 4 year: Fire protection, Applied chemistry, CNC mechanic, Wood and furniture production, Construction materials. 3 year: Locksmith, Tooler, Plumber. 2 year follow up study – Operating technic, Wood and furniture production.

The name of the project is From Hranice to Europe and it is aimed for students of all branches. The reason for this project is passing workplacement to school educational program. The function is completing not only theoretical and practical lessons, but also improvement in foreign language and learning new culture.

The first host organization is Agrupamento de Escolas Henriques Nogueira in Portugal (Torres Vedras), where 6 Chemistry students will analyse food in May 2015.
The second one is Escola Secundária de Loulé (Portugal), which arranges workplacement for 8 Fire protection students in fireman stations and at the airport Faro. In June 2015.
The next two intermediatory organizations are Language Solution in the UK (Portsmouth - in June 2015) and Future Focus in Malta (Floriana - in October 2015). Both of them arrange workplacement for 10 students of every field. Every student has chance for taking part in project.

The project will run from July 2014 to June 2016 and includes staff and VET learners from four professional areas at Frans Schartau Business Institute in Stockholm. Stockholm is one of Europe’s strongest growth areas and Higher Vocational Education is provided within the Tourism, Visitor & Hospitality industry, Finance, Healthcare and Retail. There are just over 500 VET learners at the school, 20 permanently employed staff and around 60 employees who are contracted to work with teaching and education.



The aim of the project for staff is to gain more knowledge about EU cooperation and to obtain a greater insight into the overall objectives set out in the Europe 2020 strategy for Higher Vocational Education. More knowledge is needed about how ECVET should be applied regarding the transfer of credits & qualifications and also insight into how this is done in other parts of Europe concerning the professional roles that VET learners at Frans Schartau are educated for. Additional aims are to learn how the curriculum could better reflect the European dimension and the development of technology within teaching. The aim of the project for VET learners is to give them work experience abroad as well as an opportunity to strengthen their language skills, which is a request made by the labour market. As a result of mobility, employability increases and at the same time VET learners enhance their opportunities for working in an international labour market.



The project will be organised by three members of staff who have previous experience of international cooperation. Activities are well established and methods for running the project have been planned for some time. Once the project has started up and is implemented by staff and VET learners, the work will progress according to the Activity Plan that includes, among other things, theme days, help with writing CVs and that every participant prepares themselves by investigating/examining specific areas in the destination country.



Four different professional areas of work will be represented among the 18 members of staff participating in mobility, in order to achieve a comprehensive result. Staff should be in a position that enables them to apply their new knowledge immediately for the benefit of VET learners and to support the school’s own work with internationalisation. The 31 VET learners participating each year will be selected to achieve a good spread across these four areas of work. Learners should have good interpersonal skills and a clearly stated goal for what they hope to achieve in their future careers with the help of this new experience. Participants must also have good communicative skills to be able to convey what they have learnt after their period of WPL. After selection, the goals for mobility should be agreed and anchored with the host company or organisation and the Learning Agreement written.



The anticipated result is that Frans Schartau will be at the forefront when it comes to internationalisation. There will be a greater understanding of professional roles seen from a European perspective. This knowledge will add an international dimension to the school’s programmes and teaching. New knowledge will be generated concerning technology, not least the knowledge needed to continue providing relevant and high quality Work Placement (WPL) abroad. As the school is a part of the City of Stockholm, where all levels of education are provided, results can be spread via the municipality’s Intranet and newsletters. The 80 or so companies tied to the different steering groups will be invited to participate in breakfast meetings and theme days thus learning about the school’s work with internationalisation. Niche companies that the school also works with will gain access to employees with international experience.



Nationally, results from the project will play an important role since The Swedish National Agency for Higher Vocational Education (Myndigheten för Yrkeshögskoleutbildning) has already asked for help with the spread of information to education providers via a series of seminars to be held during autumn 2014.



On completion of the entire project, Frans Schartau Business Institute will have strengthened cooperation within professional vocational education in Europe, which will facilitate future work with the implementation of ECVET. If the project is carried out full scale, over and above the contacts made through staff training and skills development, this will also include supervisors from 50 companies/organisations in Europe where knowledge and insight is exchanged. VET learners’ participation in mobility will benefit the EU-regions in future through access to professionally educated employees who can work across borders.

Székersfehérvári Belvárosi I. István Secondary School carries out trainings based on matura examination. 396 students took part in different vocational trainings such as commerce-marketing, business administration, health, logistics, transport, nursing, environment, IT, building construction and administration training. (52-54 ISCED level). Number 52 OKJ trainings make our students eligible for both manual and intellectual work. 16% of students are involved in the three week internship. We regard the knowledge of computer applications, communication, marketable skills and knowledge, acquiring of foreign technical language, expertise in professional practice and theory as basic competences during the vocational training.
Accordingly, the objectives of our project are becoming acquainted with the related fields which apply more advanced technology in Germany and the U.K., improving technical language in native culture.
In relation to demands and needs our purposes are application of professional knowledge abroad and extending trainees’ knowledge of practice oriented studies. 
Shortage areas: professional training programmes provide only one or two foreign technical language classes a week or they do not provide any opportunities for teaching foreign technical language at all. However, labour market requires command of foreign languages. 
The implementation of our mobility project strengthens our trainees’ expertise in relation to the above mentioned needs, requirements and shortage areas.
Our students take part in our mobility projects in three turns.
Turn 1: Great Britain- August (10/08/2014-30/08/2014) 
 The group consists of 11 13th grade students of our business administration and secretarial vocational class (OKJ 54 346 02). Min. five of them are disadvantaged students. An English language teacher and a teacher of management are going to accompany the group. 
Turn 2: Great Britain- September (31/08/2014-20/09/2014) 
We are going to send 15 13th grade students studying Logistics Administration. (OKJ 54 345 01) Min. five of them are disadvantaged students. An English language teacher and a teacher of Logistics Management are going to travel with the group. 
Turn 3: Germany- September (31/08/2014-20/09/2014) 
We are going to send 
• ten 13th grade building construction technicians (OKJ 54 582 03),  min. 4 of them are disadvantaged students.
• five 13th grade highway construction technicians (OKJ 54 582 05), min. 1 of them is a disadvantaged student.
• eleven 13th grade practising nurses (OKJ 52 723 01), min. 5 of them are disadvantaged students. 
• eleven 13th grade environment technician (OKJ 54 850 01),  min. 5 of them are disadvantaged students. 
A German language teacher, a medical, an architecture and an environment science teacher accompany the group of trainees to Germany.
Mobility projects can be applied as effective pedagogical tools, which improve participants’ skills and competences in multiple and practice oriented way. Therefore they are built in our school documents. Among others participating in mobility projects functions as a newer and effective motivational tool in improving students’ school achievements since they are also important evaluation aspects during the process of selection.

The project is aimed at developing and implementing the  obtained professional knowledge by the students from theVocational School of Electrical engineering and Electronics in Gorna Oryahovitza in a real working environment in the European Union. The project includes the participation of 20 students of class XII in " Lomonosov " engineering school  , studying  " Electrical engineering and Power engineering " and " Electronics, automation , communication and computer equipment ." By participating in the project we want to increase the attractiveness of the professions, to implement innovation in vocational education and training in order for us to be  more competitive  on the European market and to contribute to the successful realization of the users of this project  on the labor market. Since  the school has a tradition in the training of specialists  on  regional and national level who find employment in major companies and electrical industry , the aim of the project is to acquaint the students as professionals  with  more information on  electricity , the design of equipment for wind turbines and recycling of electrical and electronic components so that they can  implement it in the future realization .
   Our main priority  is ,through the implementation of the project ,to introduce students to the recycling of discarded products and the production of energy from renewable energy sources as well as to  learn from the English experience in this field .
   Our main aim is to  encourage the students to apply the  acquired basic knowledge , habits and skills of general and sectoral vocational training in a  real working production environment. This will improve the practical knowledge and skills of the  students ,their work in a team and their self employment , their  abilities  to cope with  different situations, will enrich their  knowledge about the organization of the activity in the plant, will help them obtain a real picture of the organization and dynamics of production processes in the electrical industry and processing of old equipment in a country member of the European Union , and will improve the prospects and opportunities of the students for future integration into the labor market .
    We have also included the placement that will  take place in March- April 2015 /from 29.03. to 18.04./for the students of class XII in London , UK.
    Within three weeks, a group of students will practice in manufacturing enterprises .They will be introduced to European standards in the construction of various types of power plants, as well as  specifications of production of energy from renewable sources and recycling of discarded equipment in the UK.
  Upon accomplishing the activities envisaged in the project we want to achieve the implementation of the acquired professional knowledge and skills in a real working environment ,to improve the correlation between the placements in our professional school and the requirements of the employers .This  will improve  feedback between vocational education and the real production sector as a basis for comparison of our requirements and criteria set out in the state educational requirements for occupations and European standards for training and qualification.
 What the students have learned will be further summarized and proposed as information for the employers in the region. Due to increasing demand and shortage of trained professionals in the field of energy production , design and construction of eolic facilities and recycling, the experience and the acquired innovation will help  with successful implementation in the labor market.
  Working in a foreign language environment would enrich and improve  the language skills of students and increase the intercultural connections , their impressions of the traditions , lifestyle and activities in the United Kingdom

The aims of the project called "Transnational mobility for attractive employment prospect", to be carried out by  Zespół Szkół Mechanicznych - Centrum Kształcenia Praktycznego Nr 2, accord with the main ojectives of the ERASMUS+ programme.  The fulfillment of specific aims of the project will contribute to the enhancement of  students’ skills and qualifications as well as to lowering unemployment rate among young people through supporting students in acquiring key professional and language skills, in functioning and working in new social and cultural environment, with people of various nationalitites and cultures.  The project will involve 36  third-grade students of Technical Mechanical  Secondary School, who are being trained in the trades of mechanical technician, mechatronics technician and automotive/motor vehicle technician.  The implementation of the project will allow students to complete two weeks’ apprenticeship in leading mechatronics companies in Berlin, Germany, and automotive branch companies in Portsmouth, UK.  Participation in the apprenticeship will make students acquire new professional qualifications and exchange previous experience among young people.  The participants will become acquainted with rules and procedures in their trades, develop practical skills necessary to start and finish a specific task in their workplace ,  the skill of solving problems through making the right choice and use of methods, tools, materialsand information.  They will also acquire the skill od adjusting their actions and bearing to the situation which calls for solving a problem or performing a specific task.  Students who are being trained in the mechanical technician trade, in the course of their internship, will become acquainted with new manufacturing technologies - with the use of CNC machine tools, acquire new qualifications connected with managing CNC lathing and milling machines.  Mechatronics technicians will become acquainted with automation technologies as well as devices and components of control and regulation systems, practical assembly of systems with the use of hydraulics and pneumatics, units and components in electrical and electronic devices and mechatronic systems . Motor vehicle technicians will acquire new skills and qualifications in state-of-the-art methods of vehicle diagnosing, vehicle maintenance and repair actions. The project, apart from professional development, emphasizes personal development of intercultural competence through cultural and pedagogical experience, including language workshops - in order to develop skills in the use of professional language in practice,  bonding meetings involving Polish students and the participants from other countries in the exchange of cultural experience, including sightseeing and learning about German or English culture and history.  The acquired professional, cultural and linguistic competence will influence the participants’ educational, professional and intercultural mobility.  Mobility will enable them to learn and practise a foreigh language and enrich their historical knowledge and cultural awareness of the host country which will allow to shape or enhance young people’s respect for Europe’s cultural and historical heritage.

The project will considerably raise young people’s chances of finding good employment and will help improve the quality and marketability of vocational training.  It will also provide students with the opportunity to explore the occupational environment and work ethics in a foreign workplace,  which is crucial for developing their adaptability to the European labour market.  It must be emphasised that the major objective of this project is to facilitate the process of acquiring proper skills and competence to be used in specific trades, in order to meet the demands of European labour market.  The internship will add new quality to the educational, professional and intercultural exchange of experience, allowing to adapt the vocational training system to the needs of both regional and EU labour markets.  Students’ newly-acquired knowledge, skills and qualifications will be certified with a certificate, skills portfolio and  Europass Mobility document,  which will influence and increase their professional mobility on the European labour market.  

Our project partners are: BERLINK ETN GmbH and Training Vision Ltd. - experienced organisations, which have had broad experience in the organisation of professional visits, educational programmes  and vocational internships in Germany and Great Britain.

The planned dates of implementation of the project are:

Group I - March 2015 - 9 students of the automotive technician (motor vehicle technician) trade: internships in automotive companies in Portsmouth - the United Kingdom

Group II - April 2015 -  9 students - 4 mechanical technicians and 5 mechatronics technicians: internships in mechanics and mechatronics companies in Berlin - Germany

Group III - March 2016 - 9 students
Odborné stáže mladých informatiků v UK

The project " Young IT specialists ‘placements in the UK" is going to implement a four-week placements of 30 IT students in companies in the UK in two runs in May and October 2015 in collaboration with the partner Language Solution, Portsmouth , UK.

The main reason and objective of our project is to give students especially students from socially disadvantaged families, students with learning disabilities, but on the other hand to gifted students the opportunity to gain professional experience and improve their practical skills in their field, to gain language, organizational, social and personal skills, the possibility to integrate in the European working environment and to improve the level of key competencies and skills with regard to their importance for the labour market, to ensure their professional growth which will lead to their successful employment after leaving school and will improve the level of education at our school to meet the main objectives of the Europe 2020 Strategy and the Erasmus + programme.

Another aim of our project is implementation of ECVET project for developing learning outcomes in the field of IT, which will mean describing units of learning outcomes, establishing mutual trust with our partners in the Memoranda of Understanding, using Learning agreements for every mobility, recording and evaluating placements by means of Personal Transcripts and Europasses Mobility, validation, recognition,  transferring and accumulation of assessed learning outcomes and improving the quality of mobility and vocational education. 

The project will involve 3rd- year IT students including students with specific learning disabilities and 1st and 2nd-year gifted students of different specializations. We hope that mobility will be the impetus for these students to self-realization, gaining interest in studies and motivation to develop their potential and the successful start of their professional and personal lives. For both of these groups of students we must adjust training, educational conditions, units of learning outcomes with regard to needs of each group. 

Students will work in companies 7-8 hours a day 5 days a week and for a period of mobility they will fulfil units of learning outcomes, such as setting- up a computer, designing and involvement of the local network and the Internet, work with Office, database, website design, increasing the professional competence and skills in vector and raster graphics, programming, troubleshooting. During the first days of placements, participants will also be instructed in safety and fire protection in the workplace. Within the placements learning outcomes will be assessed and the results of evaluation will be recorded in Personal Transcripts and after the mobility according to the Memoranda of Understanding and Learning agreements validation and recognition of learning outcomes will take place. The overall evaluation of the project will be held as well. To obtain social and intercultural skills, we want to visit Highbury College Portsmouth and in free time and at the weekends we would like to take trips and do sightseeing around Portsmouth and Hampshire, organize professional visits of companies in engineering and shipbuilding industries.

Validation and recognition of acquired units of learning outcomes by each participant will be provided by means of specific Learning Agreements, Personal Transcripts, Europasses Mobility and Certificates of Proficiency Work Experience.

We expect that our project will have a huge impact on participants who will connect their theoretical knowledge with practical experience and improve their professional, linguistic, organizational, intercultural competences and skills. There will be an important impact of the project on participants´ gaining social and personal skills, communication skills, gaining confidence, the ability to adapt to the working environment particularly for students with specific learning disabilities and gifted students. The project will have an impact on all SŠTE students which will be interested more in studies. The level of vocational education at our school will improve. Setting the quality of vocational education will be proved by the implementation of the project results in teaching, particularly of technical subjects, English, introducing new technologies and IT programs in teaching, experience gained from work with gifted students and students with learning disabilities. Regarding the partner organization and companies in addition to gaining experience in organization and management of international mobility, experience of working and providing placements for gifted students, students with learning disabilities and their practical support during their stay in the UK, cooperation with SŠTE, the development of international relations and improving communication between the partners in the UK will be strengthened.

Project title: Foreign internship - a good start in vocational career
Key action: Education mobility within  Erasmus+ program financed by European Commission
Action type: VET  learner and staff  mobility
Project duration: September 2014 – June 2015
Participants: 16
Beneficiary: Upper Secondary School Complex no 1 in Nowy Targ / Poland / Vocational School
Internship place: Portsmouth / Great Britain
Project description:
Project involves organization of  4 weeks vocational training in Portsmouth – Great Britain for 16 students of Upper Secondary School Complex nr 1 in Nowy Targ – Poland, in professions: Information Technology and Digital Processing of Graphics.
Project starts in September 2014 with language and cultural background preparation. The internship is planned as one go to Portsmouth for the whole group of 16 students in April / May 2015.
After the internship there will be 2 months period for reporting, evaluation and dissemination of the project results. 
Our partner in the project is Training Vision Ltd from Portsmouth , who will enable the work placements in English companies specialized in Information Technology and Graphics.
The purpose of the international internship is:
- improving the vocational training and increasing the knowledge and skills of the students
- implementing the theoretical knowledge into practice
- getting acquainted  with modern technology used in English companies – gaining European standard of education by participants
- observing the functioning of English enterprises
- improving English language skills, especially on vocational level
- broaden the horizons of participants through getting to know English culture and history as well as establishing international contacts, exchange of experiences with maintaining the tolerance and respect for other nations
- developing the cooperation between employers and  institution of vocational education on national and international level
- gaining the European standard of education in Upper Secondary School Complex no 1 in Nowy Targ, Poland
The above aims represent also  the planned effects of the project.
Moreover increased mobility of the participants and their bigger possibilities of finding job due to  having international vocational experience will be other great effects of the project .
Our project implements strategies of European policy concerning spreading the recognition of vocational qualifications through carrying out ECVET and Europass Mobility procedures, where all the tasks and achieved skills will be specified. This factor will also cause better competitiveness of the participants on the labour market.
Experience gained by Upper Secondary School Complex no1 in Nowy Targ will be  a long term effect creating perspective of carrying out successfully following mobility projects and increasing the numbers of beneficiaries.
