Project Erasmus + KA - 1 Learning mobility of individuals put forward School of Nursing and College of Health in Nymburk (the SZŠ / VOS ) for a period of 1 year. Date of commencement of project work is set for September 1, 2014 , completion date of July 31, 2015 .
The project aims is to increase interest in school quality provided vocational training , improve mobility of students in vocational education , support of key competences of pupils / students at the school , the further development of international cooperation between the school by involving schools in the network of European vocational schools and other institutions involved in the training of professionals ( non-physician ), increasing employability and competitiveness of graduates and their subsequent successful integration into the world of work in the Czech Republic and abroad.
The project is prepared for 18 pupils / students SZŠ / colleges . From the high school it will be 16 students from college 2 students. The project includes high school students following educational fields : medical assistant , social activity, assistant dental technician and medical lyceum and college students training program qualified dental technician .
The project partners (host organization) are schools / educational institutions from France ( Dijon , Bordeaux ), Turkey ( Istanbul ) and the UK ( Portsmouth ) . 
We cooperate  with the majority of the partners for the long time , this cooperation is very good .
Length of stay of each pupil / student is set at one month . Pupils / students exchange will be organised abroad in three periods.
The first period is October 2014, when for the internship leave  4 pupils ( 2 pupils Bordeaux, 2 pupils Istanbul ) , the second season is March 2015 whan mobilities are prepare for 10 students in total (group of 6 pupils in Porthsmouth and 4 pupils in Dijon ) . The last period is May-June 2015 for  4 pupils / students ( 2 students in Istanbul and 2 pupils in Bordeaux ).
Organizations and other prescribed requirement of learning mobility are contracted fully by sending and receiving institutions.
For this we use the recommended materials : Memorandum of Understanding , Europass , Learning agreements, European ECVET and other essentials socuments such as health and travel insurance , mentor´s plan of working , Crisis Action Plan.
For each learning mobility is is named  a mentor who satisfies support, assistance and supervision of students and keeping the project rules.
Project results are expected in the field of medical assistant and social activities to deepen skills in the field of nursing and nursing care. These include the areas of disinfection, personal care mobile and immobile client, serving meals, psychosocial stimulation client monitoring physiological functions and their assessment.
Pro Dental technician expect support and deepen skills in the use of modeling materials, the ability to make model a situation of producing both fixed and removable restorations
Outcomes of learning mobility will be used for implementation in the educational content of every field of education (if beneficial) will be used for the preparation of other international school projects .
ECVET will be used to compare the units of learning outcomes of professional subjects which are by internships practiced and developed in our country and in foreign practice.
Outcames gained in term of learning mobility will be described in Europass-mobility
Disseminace of project activities will be performed in the form of student presentations for classmates , teachers , parents , as well as placing the material on the project and the school's website , contribution to the school radio, publishing in the local press .
Organizowanie praktyk zagranicznych dla uczniów technikum.

The project applicant is The Complex of  Schools nr 2 in Ostrzeszów with Training Vision Ltd., Hildburghäuser Bildungszentrum e. V. (HBZ) Stredni skola automobilni Holice  as partners. There are 48 students, in job training for mechanics and vehicle technicians, information technology and logistisc technicians. The overall time frame of the project is 24 months, whereas each particular job training visit takes 2 weeks and will be carried out as a school practice. There are 2 job training groups which are based on the partners’ training center capacities and the quality of the job training exchange, and which will stay at the respective training centres in  Portsmouth, Hildburghausen, Holice,  as stated in the programme exchange timetable. The project main objective is to carry out abroad, 10 days long school practice, to improve  quality of education  and to transfer innovations in vocational education for students of the Complex of Schools Nr 2 in Ostrzeszów, by developing new vocational skills, language and culture competencies. The project objectives is to familiarize the participants with the following items, relating to and as upheld in foreign partners:  new developments in technology,  quality standards, work regulations and standard; workshop safety, research facilities, as well as Management of Health and Safety at Work Regulations. Furthermore, thanks to the participation in the project the students will improve  their professional knowledge and develop their practical skills, which, as a result, will increase their work competiveness. The participants will get a chance to develop  their language competencies, with a focus on work related vocabulary, which  will help them to pass vocational qualification exams in the future. 

The partners training centers in Portsmouth, Hildburghausen, Holice,  possess excellent training facilities and equipment as well as  experienced staff necessary for organizing the job training exchange and  carrying out the project objectives. Partners ensure methodological supervision and training, accommodation arrangements as well as  organization and coordination of  cultural component experience.
"Stwórz sobie szansę "- zagraniczne mobilności edukacyjne w programie Erasmus +

In the project  will participate  46  students from  II, III classes from  schools fro District of Admin in Ostróda  who are training in occupations: 
- IT sector  ( UK in March 2015)
- technician hotelier, ( UK in November 2014 , Spain in May 2015)
- technician of the nutrition and organization of catering services.  ( Italy in May 2015) 

The changing economic reality creates an urgent need to prepare young people for the difficult role of participant modern market economy.  In planned  mobility the have  opportunity develop personality  and competence. 
The overall objective of the project is to confront theoretical knowledge with practice, participants in the workplace in an international environment.

The operational objectives of the project:

- improvement of language skills and cultural competence constitutes the key principles of EU policy
-  development of creative and mobile attitudes
-  acquisition of new vocational qualifications
-  increase the practical skills of the participants in order to increase their attractiveness on the labor market    

Soft results of the project:  

- raising the professional qualifications and language of participants
- validation of non-formal learning
- school enrichment knowledge of the participants about the skills needed for future employment
- participants will receive certificates and Europass documents

The impacts of the project :

Dissemination of the project results will positively affect the development of the region.;

 The project the support and complement the activities of member states of the European Union in the field of vocational education and training, to strengthen mutual adaptation of European education systems.
Profesjonalny logistyk na europejskim rynku pracy

In the project taking 32 students The Non-public Vocational Technical School in Nowe Miasto nad Pilicą Zakładu Doskonalenia Zawodowego in Kielce. Learning in occupation logistic technican, who were send on three week practice occupation into United Kingdom – Portsmouth. Realisation practice provided in two term:
The first group from 16th November 2014 to 6th December  2014 – 16 students + 2 teachers
The second group from 1st March 2015 to 21st march 2015 – 16 students + 2 teachers
Competitions in trip will be held occupation practice in Portsmouth.
Teenagers learning in our school are coming from rural territories. That is way, they have not so good access to education. The most of them come from poor and broken families, which do not pay attention to education. Therefore, our students need strong motivation for learning. Taking part in a foreign training will help them improve their qualifications and skills, widen intellectual horizons and make equal their chances for finding a job/working place. The training programmes and time of its lasting was made due to Polish Core Curriculum with excluding main purposes and requirements of profession, their preference and specificity of its members and also requirements and expectations of employees from the local and European work trade. 
The first aim of this projects is to improve professional competences in accordance with the requirements of EU. The logistic technician should have knowledge, skills and experience, which gives him/her be competitive on the local and European work trade. Gaining knowledge and experience will motivate students to improve their qualifications interests in their own development. That is way students will understand how important is value and education and that people learn for whole their life by widen their experience, competences and qualifications. In globalizing world a young graduate person must find himself/herself in constantly changing work trade. Additionally, more and more important is shaping a posture of professional mobility and knowing of the work system of logistic companies in Europe. It makes it easier of members os such project to work in a specific job. Students will better get to know the functioning system of companies in Great Britain, rules and requirements rulling in the partner country. They will learn better about British system of work, different strategy solutions which are used in companies. This thing in the future will contribute to use innovative ideas in development of native countries. 
The second but also important aim of this project is improving skills of oral and written communication in English language when development of international cooperation is being concerned. Our students will learn all the professional terminology with using English language. The participation in the project will enable students to check English competences and break off linguistic barriers. It will also enable to shape the poster of openness, communication, both cooperation and responsibility for made decisions. The communication in some foreign language requires the understanding of cultural differences, needs and interests of people bringing up in country with different cultural traditions.
" Impossible is nothing."- Technicy z kartuskiego Wzgórza zdobywają europejskie doświadczenie.

The beneficiaries of the project will be 48 students of Complex of Vocational and Grammar Schools in Kartuzy, who study in Technical School of Advertisement, Technical School of Economy, Technical School of Information Technology  and Technical School of Commerce.  

They will fulfill their recruitment duties and leave for their two week workplacement  to international partners of our school , that is Tellus Plymouth, England  and  Lycée Professionnel Jean Capelle in Bergerac, France.

The choice of partners is based on our earlier, greatly positive experience, related to the realization of international projects. 

Group A are 12 students of the third year of Technical School of Advertisement, who will leave for their workplacement  in September 2015, to Bergerac, in France. Group B are 16 students of the third year of Technical School of Information Technology,  who will leave to Plymouth, in October 2015. The last group, group C, are 16 students of the third year of Technical School of Economy and 4 students of the third year of Technical School of Commerce, who will also go to Plymouth, England, in March 2016

Apart from doing their apprenticeship, students will create their final products, such as an instruction manual  concerning the set- up  of computer equipment, business plan of a company and a flyer concerning marketing strategy of a company. 

 All these products can be used during educational classes at school and outside. The programmes of workplacement were prepared according to our local market requirements, and are compatible with the school curriculum and the programme of teaching. 

In many cases, our students come from rural background, very often from families with a lower economic status, that is why, leaving for apprenticeship  is so crucial for them. It could be their first step to change their life, to become more active and motivated.

It should be also mentioned, that students  from our  technical school often gain very good and good results in learning, they are communicative in English. Their knowledge of vocational subjects is on a good and very good level, what they prove by participating in many competitions, tournaments and olympics.

Our previous experience show, that leaving for the apprenticeship, influences the students in a positive way. It also improves te image of sending ogranization.

Each participant will get a certificate of attendance  and Europass mobility, which not only confirm participants’  vocational skills and experience gained, but they can also allow students obtain a  job, not only on local but also European market. 

Thanks  to all issues mentioned above, the perception of a Polish person abroad may change , and trainees  may become more self- confident when looking for a job. It is a good opportunity for students to gain key competences, such as creativity, resourcefulness or being initiative. To overcome their mental obstacles arising from the fact, that they live in countryside or in small towns.
"Rozwój Kompetencji Kluczowych Szansą na Dobry Start w Zawodzie".

The project "Development of key competences as a chance for a good start in the profession " was created to acquire and improve key skills and competences , which include such skills as communication , assertiveness , creativity , resistance to stress, leadership competences , the ability to cooperate with others, work independently and time management. The impact of these skills on the quality of the work team is huge. Same skills and theoretical knowledge - technical and purely specific to is not sufficient in the era of highly specialized technical staff in companies. Therefore, the so-called elements of emotional intelligence , which undoubtedly consist of the so-called soft skills and transversal skills are more important than substantive knowledge . Therefore, it seems important to emphasise on these particular competences of our students during the month-long internships in Portsmouth on the south coast of England. There will be monthly internships of our technical students - electrical technicians and logistics technicians -  10 - person per group in autumn - spring periods. A total of four groups of 40 students will go . Each group will be accompanied by a teacher from the school and our partner and host companies tutors and mentors. Our host partner - Training Vision will provide adequate training internships according to the profile of our students . There will be will be, among others, companies such as : Mr Pine & Sons, the British Heart Foundation -Electrical and Furniture , Direct Carpet Centre , InfonetMedia , SEEKIT , Spinnaker Waste , Sue Ryder and Homebase . The assessment of acquired skills will be determined by the document ECVET Skills Portfolio, according to which students will receive certificates of ECVET. In addition to these, trainees will receive a certificate of mobility internships issued by our partner , the Europass Mobility certificates and language course certificates, on which our students will attend during the first two weeks of stay. An important element of the project will be a cultural, educational and language program before starting an internship and a cultural program during your stay. There are planned  excursions to places of tourist values, such as: London, Isle of Wight, Stonehenge , Winchester , Salisbury and others. Students will learn the unique character of the UK with its rich history and culture . The students will be staying with English families to help them grind the English language and get acquainted with the culture and customs of the English. At each stage a comprehensive evaluation will be conducted,  and during the project and after its completion dissemination activities will be provided. After returning from the internships , students will receive appropriate assessment of the practice on the certificate.
Kształcenie zawodowe dla europejskiego rynku pracy

There are 60 students (boys and girls) and 6 caretakers are going to take part in the project. The number of caretakers results from the regulations about the organization of abroad trips for schoolchildren. The pupils who take part in recruitment process are from the vocational high school in Zespół Szkół nr 2 in Wyszków and they study in the following specializations:  logistics, forwarding, electrician, advertising, IT, mechanics,  mechanics of  vehicles, devices and systems for renewable energy. They are pupils of the first, second and third year. The pupils are going to three different places in three groups. 1st group: the pupils of  electrician, mechanics,  mechanics of  vehicles, logistics and forwarding specializations: are going to Berlin in Germany; 2nd group: the pupils  of IT,  the pupils  of mechanics, mechanics of vehicles and IT, logistics and forwarding, devices and systems for renewable energy specializations are going to Rimini in Italy; 3rd  group: the students of IT, advertising, logistics and forwarding, specializations are going to Portsmouth in the UK.  The project will take place from July 1, 2014 to June 30, 2016 – all two school years, that is why students from the same profession can go to different places. The idea for this project originates from students' needs to be in touch with the latest technologies. Unfortunately, because of financial reasons, our school laboratories are not equipped with the most modern technology equipment, especially computer programs and other technological facilities. What is more, our pupils have taken part in a school survey in which they clearly stated they are interested in taking part in  this kind of projects. Students admitted, almost unanimously, that this kind of projects will help them to get better jobs in the future, to increase their self-confidence and to overcome a linguistic barrier. The most important aims of this project are: the improvement of students' abilities and competence which will help students to find a good job in the future; the improvement of the quality of vocational education that enables our graduates to improve their skills  so that they can compete with the other graduates on  the job market; the promotion and cognition of new technology especially those which contribute to the protection of the environment; the improvement of the knowledge of English; the propagation of the European citizen attitude; opportunity to use knowledge in practice and to get more professional experience; motivation to achieve better results in education.

Besides, the results of this project are: Students personal and professional skills improvement,  project final report and promotion of mobility project in our region, new school practice plan; promotion of using ICT; to extend  the cooperation with Partner Countries.

Our center is located in Iniesta (province of Cuenca) and it is placed in the North-East part of Castilla La Mancha, the area is called “La Manchuela”. Our school is in a rural area which is the main income for families.



This project has a duration of 2 academic years, and 6 students of Technician in Microcomputer Systems and Networks will be able to work in Italy and in the United Kingdom. 



The project will be conducted by the ICT coordinator of the project, being supported by the Foreign Languages department, as well as the management team and parents. 



Thanks to this project, our students will be able to develop specific skills that can stimulate  the local market, so that students can become more competent and competitive in our labour  market and in the European labour market, specially in the ICT sector.
Staż uczniowski potwierdzeniem kompetencji i umiejętności

The project ‘’Traineeship  confirmation of  skills and competence’’   is   an integral part of vocational training  allowing  the students  to  acquire  new job related  skills, enhance their employability after they  leave school and   get acquainted with the  European Labor market and the opportunities it gives to the learners of  Zespół Szkół Energetycznych ( ZSEn)  in Lublin.
The project meets  the objectives of  Erasmus + program  such as   strengthening employability and equipping young people with  new   skills and competence expected by employers and    preventing  social exclusion. The participants are also given the opportunity to  get familiar with the European  work standards. The projects aims at enhancing career prospects and work force mobility by issuing for its participants  Europass certificate  recognized  in EU countries  as well as  their  language competence improvement.
Furthermore  the projects allows young people coming  from underprivileged background to go abroad for the first  time to a European country and use that experiences for their  personal development. The aims of the project are in line with  the  national needs  included in the strategies for Lublin region  such as: building new quality of skills and knowledge,  modern forms of teaching , constructing modern  system of vocational education and training. It   also creates an excellent opportunity to introduces innovations in the field of vocational training, general and  technical  foreign language teaching  not only from  the students’ perspective but  also from  the teachers’ point of view.
The number of projected  participants is 22,  out  of which 16 is to take part in  traineeship  in England and 6 in Germany. The participants will be the  third form  students aged 18 of the following vocational lines: IT technician, electrician, power energy technician, renewable energy systems technician. 
The tasks resulting form the project execution will be shared by Zespół Szkół Energetycznych and the receiving partners. ZSEn  will be in charge of:  participants selection, defining the project aims, preparing mobility agreements, linguistic and cultural  preparation, arranging transport from Lublin to Portsmouth and to Drezno ( purchase of tickets), participants insurance, providing   teachers taking care of the group during mobility  and cooperation with the receiving partners throughout the project period, monitoring of the project execution and if necessary taking corrective actions, assessing professions and personal development of Erasmus + participants, project evaluation and  in cooperation with the  receiving partners issuing certificates conforming the acquired skills ( Europass mobility ) and dissemination and exploitation of the  results of ZSEn  participation  in Erasmus+.        
Training Vision Ltd. and Europa – Direkt e. V.   will  be in charge of: board and accommodation,  local transport,  care and  supervision over the trainees,  introduction of  participants to new living  and working environment, work placement  in accordance with the training  program and Erasmus + objectives, in  cooperation with the sending organization carrying out evaluation, preparing cultural program according  to the agreement,   issuing document confirming acquired skills and knowledge  ( Europass Mobility ) , cooperation with the sending organization throughout the whole traineeship period and results dissemination,
The expected results of the project execution: new job related skills acquired  by  students, holding  Europass mobility certificate recognized in  EU countries and  increased  language competence. Due to participation in the projects students  will have the opportunity to verify their knowledge in practice on the  European market. The traineeship will allow  them to compare companies operation in Polish, English and German  markets but first of all  it will strengthen their  employment opportunities both at home and abroad. Additionally participation in the project will be  motivation for further self – improvement thorough  life long learning and taking advantage of non -formal  informal learning.

EUROCIP V aims to provide, by conducting internships in European companies, a transnational perspective to Initial Professional Qualification Programmes (PCPI), to improve the professional, personal and social skills of young participants in favour of their social, educational and employment insertion. More specifically, it pursues the general goal of increasing choice and quality of future employment of students PCPI, broadening their outlook, reinforcing their professional profile and promoting adaptation to the particularities of different European labor markets.

This objective is particularly relevant for students of PCPIs, composed mostly of young people at risk of training, cultural and social exclusion, in need of specific measures to learn, with frequent negative attitude to learning and low self esteem. Consequently, their needs include both the development of their abilities to learn and do, as their personal growth (self-esteem, self-awareness, accountability, acquisition of social values), the acquisition of patterns of coexistence, or the assumption of habits of responsible citizenship and autonomy.

Based on the identified needs, the project EUROCIP V has the following specific objectives, through mobility actions planned (5 week stay, including training in the language of the destination country and internships in companies in sectors related to the module enrolled under the supervision of a tutor accompanying person):

- Strengthen their communication skills in a foreign language. 
- To promote personal, social and cultural enrichment 
- To supplement their competence profile and training. 
- Assume and apply the principle of equality and diversity in all areas of life.
- Increase their chances of employment.
Consortium members EUROCIP, BILBAO EKINTZA EPEL, EDUCATION AND PROFESSIONAL Otxarkoaga PEÑASCAL, SDAD. COOP., manage since 2012 Professional Qualification Programmes (PCPI), having a whole offering 1,500 seats for the academic year 2012-2013. 


LANGUAGE SOLUTION, host partner in the UK, collaborates in the project EUROCIP since its first edition and ÜBERLINGEN Akademie, host partner in Germany, has worked in the last two editions of the project.

The target group 1 consists of 16 young residents at Bizkaia, with the following profile:
- PCPI (Initial Professional Qualification Programmes) students that are completing modules "Kitchen services", "Pastry/Bakery", "Maintenance of microcomputer equipment " and " Mechanics " .
- Aged between 17 and 21 years.
- With basic knowledge of English language.
- Have not reached the minimum objectives of formal education.
- People without work experience or work experience in informal economy.

The target group 2 consists of 2 people trainers and/or tutors of the PCPI modules contractually linked to the sending partners, familiar with the members of target group 1. They will accompany the target group 1 during the entire stay.

The expected outcomes for the target group 1 , students PCPI , include the development of skills of personal autonomy and identity (self-esteem booster , abilities and skills, improved academic and professional liability), coexistence and respect (respecting differences , resolve relational conflicts, exercise their rights and duties within the framework of respect and the rules in social and cultural context, organized leisure time healthy and non-consumptive), and learn to know and do (develop work habits, experience sense of social and labor autonomy).
Meanwhile, accompanying tutors acquire through their participation in the programme knowledge and criteria for incorporating the dimension of mobility in the itineraries of orientation and training as well as contacts to articulate a network of permanent cooperation for the realization of mobility actions.

The dissemination strategy aims to raise awareness about the importance and the potential mobility, specifically the program Erasmus +, offers people who enter their first job, in general, and students PCPI in particular, and to disseminate the results the project.

The project will be assessed formatively, by monitoring the work process, which will ensure the achievement of objectives. Summative evaluation will be also performed based on the achievement of the expected results, in order to measure the effectiveness and efficiency of the project.

Our mobility project for job-seekers within the framework of Erasmus+ takes into account ten principles of the European quality commitment for mobility. 

The regional council of Basse Normandie is widely supporting this project since it answers to its strategy of openness towards Europe and the world. The Region wishes to develop its international exchange programmes and especially company internships in Europe to allow job-seekers to get a faster occupational integration (80 % during the last programs). By bringing its financial support to this project, the French Region of Low Normandy shows its interest and its will to collaborate in the placement of job-seekers



A Steering committee that consists of an executive of Pôle emploi Basse Normandie, representatives of the French Region Low Normandy and advisers of the PEI ( International Employment Agency), determines a protocol of implementation concerning the choice of countries, the contents of the stay in host countries, the administrative aspect (social welfare) and the remuneration for the trainees, the selection of the partners and the participants, the financing of the program, the follow-up of the action, the qualitative and financial balance assessment.



This program is directed by the contractor which leans on sending partners and host partners based in European countries. The host partner is appointed by the contractor to build-up a real network of local companies interested in the European mobility of the workers and presenting the need for staff. There are several companies interested in receiving interns. Thanks to 19 years of European experience, we benefit from a wide network of companies in most of the European countries, facilitating the placement of the trainees. 

Regular contacts between the various partners, the beneficiaries, and companies will facilitate a continuous monitoring of the project.



Individual and group evaluations will allow us to measure the gap between the initial project and its realization. 



Living and working in another country of the European Economic Area will allow job-seekers to:

• Better match the needs of companies, to strengthen their professional and linguistic skills in a different professional environment 

• Discover new techniques, new fields of experience, 

• Know new cultures and another way of company organisation  

• Become integrated as soon as possible within the European labour market, 

• Develop new employment prospects, 

• Be more autonomous. 



Moreover, this project allows young job-seekers to live a first work experience in Europe in a context where job offers target only experienced people. This type of programme is often the response to their integration preoccupations. A mobility experience is a real asset to build employment pathway in Europe. All sectors can be concerned. The potential beneficiaries will be informed through posters in the different employment areas (Pôle emploi, local missions, youth areas,…) during employment forums an through www.pole-emploi.fr.



We will specifically target job-seekers with level IV diploma that didn’t already benefit from a training course in Europe and that know some occupational integration difficulties. 



The French Region Low Normandy participates financially in this programme and allows the participants to have the intern in vocational training status so they can obtain remuneration during these 9 weeks. 

In their return, the candidates will have to write a report and will get a certificate of internship in complement to the EUROPASS. A final balance assessment will be realized by the contractor and send to all our partners and financiers.



The intended impact of this project is to get an occupational integration of the targeted public. Indeed, this immersion in a company will be a determining factor in the professional evolution of the candidates. It will allow either integration in the host country, or additional assets for an occupational integration back in France.

The impact of this program also concerns the interest of the politics to participate to this kind of action, to build a partners' network specialized in candidates' reception.



This year, countries aimed by this program are: Germany, Spain, Ireland, Italy, Malta and the United Kingdom.

The project is being carried out by the General Bem’s Vocational School in Zawiercie in cooperation with the Training Vision institution which has great experience in organizing professional apprenticeships for young people. The students’ exchange is planned to be in the 2014/2015 school year. The first group will go in October/November, the second in March/April to the companies located in England. 
Students taking part in this project will undergo traineeships in British workplaces as well as will be able to get acquainted with English culture and history throughout the participation in trips to London, Salisbury and  Isle of Wight.
The aims of the projects are:
- Apprenticeships implementation in occupations: automotive technician and mechanic technician through the acquisition of new skills in the automotive and mechanical industry.
- Development and improvement of professional competences.
- Getting to know the rules of the companies.
- Taking control of language skills in everyday life and of technical vocabulary during the carrier.
- Raising qualifications essential to find on domestic or European labor market consistent with the education profile.
- Leveling changes of Polish technicians on the European labor market.
- Enabling beneficiaries to get the latest perspectives for undertaking the career, also outside the country.
- Enabling to establish professional contacts by beneficiaries in the host country.
The participation in the apprenticeship will improve students’ chances of the professional start as well as it will constitute the meaning support in case of establishing their own company after school graduating.
The students will be given support as they come from Zawiercie district, which has a high level of unemployment.
Participants’ self-confidence will grow, they will get to know different work methods in European multicultural environment . They will reveal new opportunities of the professional development. Their self-assessment, openness and responsiveness will grow in the team of employees. Above all, participants in the project will increase their professional skills by the unique elements associated with the taught profession.
Each of 26 participants will receive the Europass Mobility document describing exactly what professional and additional benefits the participants achieved being on the project. The participants will also receive a certificate of serving the apprenticeship and a certificates from the host companies confirming the date and the exact place of undergoing the apprenticeship.
At the end of the project meetings will be arranged to present assumptions and the participants’ achievements. We are also going to create interesting proposals of based on new technologies traineeships programs.  
There will be measurable results: printed and websites materials containing information about the politics of vocational education and training in England, examples of good solutions, the best practice and the approach towards the vocational training, as well as programs of professional courses. The Training Vision company through the project implementation will capture latest experiences in provided services and the chance for promoting themselves  in new environment.
Requesting and partner company guarantee the best quality of this undertaking.

This project is directed to students of vocational schools from Lublin province who in the future will be craftsmen of the services sector within the framework of four branches: mechanical sector, food sector, hairdressing and construction sector. Four groups of eight students will go to four European countries to increase their actual skills, gain new competences and to improve language skills. The individual placements program, which was worked out and prepared on the basis of the experience of experts and vocational trainers who are also employers, will be stimulating the development of competences and skills adequated to every each participant. The assumption of the project is to stimulate the students to develop their professional career, professional mobility and to be open to new, innovative solutions used in European countries. During the three-week stay the students will pursue a traineeship increased their professional skills, they will have to use foreign language in practice what will positively affect to improve their language skills, they will gain international and intercultural compteneces. The students will realize the nowadays meaning of the importance of  professional and personal development in the context of professional mobility – not only regional or domestic, but also the foreign one. The participants of the project are young people in most cases under age but standing on the threshold of the adult life and after this foreign stay it will be easier to them to make a choice of their life way, to overcome fear and to free them from prejudices. They will gain self-confidence and be certain of  their skills and competences. They will make decisions more consciously and they will comprehend that a professional permanent development, an incessant vocational traning both formal and informal is very important. Thanks this kind of projects we will increase the number of young people who will be aware of their choices and skills, people who will have a chance to become specialists in their occupations. There is an insufficiency of good qualified employees and specialists particulary in Lublin region so this is advisable to realize this kind of projects. Some of the participants will become employers who will take care of the development of their own and their future workers and the skills of some of them will be advantaged by other persons during rendering services on a high degree of standard. Undoubtedly all of participants will open to modern technologies and technical solutions and a broadly understood enterpreneurship and innovativeness.
ZAWÓD TO PRZYSZŁOŚĆ -  staże zagraniczne uczniów ZSEU

"TRADE IS THE FUTURE - Work Placements Abroad for Pupils of The School Complex of Economics and Services" is implemented by School of Economics and Service in Swietoclowice in cooperation with Vitalis Betreuungsgesellschaft für Modellprojekte Schkeuditz mbH and Company Ltd Training Vision Portsmouth



Within the project we want above all to raise professional and linguistic competence and support the mobility of students and participants in the European labor market.



The main objectives of the project are the results of the needs of the participants, because the foreign practice is supposed to:

-  prepare students for the professional work,

-  increase the employability of students in the future

- prepare students for the smooth functioning in the modern world

Therefore, the emphasis in the project has been put on the acquisition and improvement of possessed   by the students general and professional competence.

The achievement of the  objectives of the project is the best preparation of the students  for entering the labor market, because they will be aware of:

- what they learn at  school, what they learn outside school,

- what are the requirements of the labor market,

- what competence and skills they have, and what competence they will have to acquire in the future

- how to plan your professional career effectively.

The answers to these questions and the evaluation of the proposed methodological changes in the implementation of the apprenticeships will become expected project results.

The participants of the project are the students of:

1. technical school -  profession technician (21 people) and  techniques economist (19 people)

2. vocational school -  cook (12 people), pastry (6 people), shop assistant (12 people), car mechanic (9 people), bricklayer-plasterer (3 people).

We have planned  7 practices(3 in the UK and 4 in Germany). As part of the foreign apprenticeship  students will :

- improve their language skills of English / German,

- increase  their qualifications,

- develop the ability to work in a group,

- increase intercultural awareness.

The project will improve the image of the school in the local community. By the dissemination of  the results of the project we want to mobilize students to learn in vocational schools. 

A few weeks working  experience will also be a good opportunity to encourage participants to assess for themselves their skills .
Staż zagraniczny uczniów technikum - inne spojrzenie na świat

The participants of the project will be 2nd year students who study to be economy specialists and 3rd year students, future hotel industry workers, IT specialists and advertising techniques specialists. As part of the project, German company WBS TRAINING AG will organize a two-week training for students of each speciality in 2015. Additionally, in 2015 and 2016 an English company, Training Vision, will organize a two-week training  for a group of 16 3rd-year hotel industry students , who are now 2nd and 1st  year students. The aims of the projects, which are consistent with the aims of mobility projects, is support learners in acquiring such competences as knowledge, skills and attitudes with a view to improving their personal development and employability in the European labour market, developing skills in foreign languages, knowledge and understanding of other cultures, developing a sense of European citizenship and identity and acquiring the skills to adapt to living and working  conditions in a foreign country. We will pay particular attention to the extension and combination of knowledge and skills to contribute to the self-realization and personal development of our students. Innovation, creativity and entrepreneurship are the qualities that should characterize our students, and future graduates seeking employment and creating their own businesses. We want to enable foreign training for students of each profession in the school. For these young people  participation in the project is the only chance to gain professional experience abroad. Most of them come from villages and families facing unemployment problem and living off unemployment benefits. The unemployment rate in Świętokrzyskie district is over 25% now. The German company, WBS TRAINING AG, we have been cooperating since 2006, is our partner in this project. It is experienced in working with young people thanks to taking part in different projects of LdV, Socrates, etc. WBS TRAINING AG is a company with more than 30 years of experience. It is a leading provider of educational services famous for its versatile and qualitatively first-class range of vocational training. We will start the cooperation with Training Vision Company, which deals with the planning and management of international mobility projects for students, teachers, young workers and organizations in the framework of EU programs. After the training,  the beneficiaries will obtain certificates of WBS TRAINING AG and Training Vision as well as Europass-Mobility Documents to confirm their skills and experience gained and to  be additional advantages for young people in search of employment in the European labor market. In this way we help to improve the transparency and recognition of qualifications and the competence of future school-leavers, including those acquired through vocational training. Students learning to be economy specialists will have their training in Dresden from 4th to 17th April 2015; IT specialists ( Dresden) and the hoteliers (Leipzig) from 12th to 25th Sept. 2015; advertising techniques specialists in Dresden from 3rd to 16th Oct. 2015 and the hoteliers in London from 12th to 25th April 2015 (present 2nd year students) and from 3rd to 16th April 2016 (present 1st year students). As part of the project we want the present 1st year students, future hotel industry workers, to have the opportunity to complete their  internship in two different countries, get to know the functioning of the hotels in Germany and England. Only this profession in our school has eight weeks of training in the curriculum and this gives us the opportunity to share the training for 2 weeks in Germany and England and four weeks in Poland. It will be particularly interesting professional experience. Being able to compare how the hotels operate, how the staff work, how the hotels advertise their services and how they are equipped  will expand the professional, interpersonal, linguistic and adaptive skills, increase self-esteem because of additional qualifications. The project will give the students better chances of employment in their profession since it will raise their professional attraction for future employers. It will also encourage the students to become self-employed. Understanding the needs and difficult financial situation of the students the school is trying to enable them to have their professional training as part of the grant covering all costs of their participation. For young people this is the only way to acquire professional experience abroad. The benefits  the students will received is also acquiring new skills, references and experience, supported by a certificate and the Europass Mobility Document.
VIVRE ET TRAVAILLER EN EUROPE IV

According to the policy of european openness  anchored to its school developpement plan,  Brise Lames vocational high school  has given many young people the opportunity to live a professionnal and personnal experience abroad  through successful past projects.

Today, after 2 joint Leonardo projects with 2 other member of Provence Formation, our administrative supervision, 5 vocational high school form the current Consortium in this application:

-Brise Lames, situated in Martigues

-Marie Gasquet and Charlotte Grawitz, situated in Marseille

-Célony situated in Aix en Provence

-Caucadis situated in Vitrolles



All these schools have agreed to the project in order to allow the following mobilities:

-44 students in Terminale Baccalauréat European section in sales, commerce, administration  and logistics : 4 to 5 weeks  mobility in England, Malta, Luxemburg, Belgium

-10 students in catering and hospitality : 2 weeks in Sicily

-3 students in catering and hospitality : 2 weeks in England



These mobilities will be supervised by 4 accompanying teachers to guarantee the good working of the project and security of under 18 year old students. 27  known host partners and 6 intermediary partners with whom our schools have worked several years, complete the partnership in 5 european countries



In order to foster personnal developpement of teachers involved in european mobility and develop internationalisation of vocational education and training, all headmasters support the mobility of:

-9 teachers of vocational and linguistic subjects in England

-2 teachers of vocational subjects in Sicily



In reference to students' mobility, the performance objectives at stake are common to all students:

-facilitate socio-professionnal inclusion by using and developping professionnal, social and linguistic skills

-promote a complete immersion experience in a different cultural and linguistic environment

-improve technical and professionnal skills in other working contexts

-use and validate new skills in communication

-help awareness of intercultural relation of all stakeholders in a company

-enhance diplomas' competitivness taking into account cultural issues



For teachers mobility and schools , this project aims at:

- strenghtening professionnal, pedagogical and linguistic skills in order to anticipate changes in vocational education and training

- bridging the gap between education and employment

- making vocational education more attractive



A previous collaborative work within the schools helped developping a shared mobilty preparation plan in order to maximize quality and outcomes, for all beneficiaries ; all will be prepared before their mobility and their experience, assessment will come in a portfolio : Europass CV, Europass mobility and Europro for the students; european section students will add the oral exam to validate their curriculum and experience.



Logistics and organisation for this project are managed by a pilot and referent in each school of the Consortium; all have a strong knowledge and experience of mobility project insuring the good working of the project and comply to the bill of specifications/

yearly calendar, procedures guide for each group of mobility, evaluation and certification tools, project follow -up, dissemination plan allow an efficient management , information flow among all stakeholders;

host partners in the different countries have and will cooperate in this project 

The whole process implemented aims at developping mobility activities in all the schools involved and  obtain the accreditation for the Consortium for futur projects
Je travaille en Version Originale Européenne

The principal and the staff of our Regional Professional Lycée have developed a project which aims to improve pupils’ standards in modern languages and autonomy.   We are situated in a small rural town in one of the seven poorest departments in France.  Professional openings are scarce and the economy is losing momentum.  It is therefore necessary to prepare and train the young people in the Agen area to become mobile.  Our pupils can be in tough situations, as a result of living in a difficult family context.  In response to these sociological difficulties, the Lycée opened the first Professional Micro Lycée in France in September 2013 to accommodate young people who have dropped out of the school system.
One of our main aims is to create an awareness of European opportunities through work placements in Europe. These ambitious projects increase our young peoples’ self-esteem.  Although the approach is initially timid and incredulous, these projects are strongly supported by the students and their families.  The best proof of our success is during enrolment, when students tell us that a neighbour or a friend told them about their experience in a European country.  Whether it is through the Leonardo Da Vinci or Comenius programme, or through a school trip, these young people have been able to leave their region, generally for the first time, to go to Great Britain, Spain or Poland for work placements within companies or to almost any of the other European countries through the Comenius projects.
Our Erasmus+ 2014 project concerns 25 Lycée students which corresponds to the average number of accepted applications which we are in a position to deal with each school year.
Our European partners are constantly developing, according to the contacts and networks of the team in charge of the European activity.  For 2014-2016 the host companies will be situated in the towns of Torquay and Portsmouth in Great Britain, Toledo with whom we are twinned in Spain and we hope in Ceske Budejovice and Brno in the Czech Republic.
Recruitment is made on a voluntary basis.  With regard to the Micro Lycée, it is the team who proposes the activity to the pupils.  This process is intentionally long (5 to 10 months) and personalised to enable the student to adequately prepare himself for this experience.
Since 2006, our educational establishment has received 83 Leonardo grants and made more than 750 young people mobile.
A survey to evaluate the long term impact of these experiences will be carried out in September 2014. Pupils studying the “Baccalauréat Professionnel Vente Prospection”  (selling techniques) are going to trace and contact all those pupils who have benefited from these programmes, in order to provide quantitative and qualitative data which we are currently lacking ; as much on a school success level (diploma, further studies),  as on a professional level (local, regional, national and international vacancies; types of contract, periods of unemployment) and on a personal level (foreign language skills, general culture, responsibility, independence).
Movilidad Erasmus CM para prácticas en empresas

The "Erasmus CM Mobility for placements" project requested by the IES Escolas Proval is contextualized within the Erasmus + Training Action Programme "Mobility of persons based learning (KA1)". The project aims to provide students of intermediate Vocational Training in Electronics and Administration the possibility of their On the Job Training (FCT) in European companies.



The project arises primarily due to the interest shown by students in perform vocational training practices abroad, and the growing difficulty for teachers of vocational training to find suitable companies to perform FCT practices.

The main objectives pursued with these mobilities are:

a) Help students adjust to the needs of the European labor market and to have more and better employment opportunities

b) Allow students to develop specific skills, including language, and expand their knowledge on the economic and social culture of the host country while gaining work experience.

c) Promote cooperation between the school and companies.

d) Contribute to the development of a highly skilled group of young, open-minded and internationally experienced as professionals

e) Acquisition of knowledge and skills with a view to personal and professional development

f) Encourage the learning of foreign languages



It is intended with this mobility that students achieve the above objectives and be better prepared to enter the European or Spanish labor market. In short, obtaining a first work experience in an international environment.



The project offers 10 mobilities for internships in companies in Italy and the UK for 12 weeks to cover 410 hours of practical training in two annual periods project: from September to December and from March to June



IES Escolas Proval center ( Issuing Center and organizer of Mobility )  is responsible for:

- Request to the OAPEE the Erasmus grant for key 1 + Action program

-Make an agreement with the host companies (Annex I translated into English)

- Request authorization to the administration to carry out the placement of the student abroad

-Make a report (by the secretary of the Centre) in accordance with the student is covered by school insurance

-Conduct an individualized plan of FCT and translate it into English.

- Define the objectives of stay

- Select the participants

- Prepare the participants

-Establish a contract including a training agreement

- Help participants manage the transport, accommodation and insurance

- Negotiate an individual program

- Agree on monitoring and mentoring arrangements

- Implement agreed validation procedures

- Establish appropriate communication channels

- Evaluate the progress of the project so continues

- Generate the Europass Mobility Certificate for the Student

-Make the final project report and sendit to OAPEE through the Movility Tool



Intermediary companies commit to :

-Find accommodation for students

- Manage and look for host companies in Italy and the UK

- Keepa continous  track of the students

-Promote cultural understanding and mentality of the host country 

- Provide practical support if required 



The desired impact of the project on participants is to help achieving a technical degree through On the Job Training in European businesses, an improved employment opportunities , knowledge of new cultures and new languages that can help them to consolidate a European entity and to support their future employability .



The desired impact on our organization is to acquire new competencies and skills in relation to foreign companies that can help us to improve the training of future students.
Wiem i planuję - w drodze na europejski rynek pracy

This project is the result of the discussion on the reform of higher education, the situation on labour markets and the effective application of innovative teaching methods in order to prepare graduates of ZSH to fulfil professional goals in the best possible way. Taking the professional needs of students into account the project enables them to take part in vocational training placements at employment establishments that are flexible with regard to the changing labour market in Europe and do well during the recession. It also helps them learn about the requirements of the contemporary labour market, motivates them to gain further professional competences and qualifications and create their own career.



The project is open to 3rd year students of Technikum No 3 in Jastrzębie-Zdrój (advertising technician, tourism technician and trade technician) and offers 3-week vocational training placements in Portsmouth. In the first year (1 – 21 March 2015) one 10-person group of students (advertising technician) and in the second year (2-23 April 2016) two 10-person groups (trade technician and tourism technician) and one 12-person group of students (advertising technician) will visit Great Britain. The receiving organisation in Great Britain will be Training Vision Ltd., which has been chosen after a thorough analysis of a few offers submitted by organisations specialising in similar trainings.



The organisation guarantees comprehensive fulfilment of ZSH objectives in compliance with priorities and objectives of Erasmus+ programme: developing students' professional competences to increase their employability and increasing the competitiveness of the school by enhancing the educational offer of the school and binding it with the needs of the labour market, and strengthening the positive image of the school in the local area. Particular emphasis is put on acquiring new or practising already possessed by students professional skills and competences within curricula for adevrtising, trade and tourism technicians.



The participants will get to know the organisation and operation of an employment establishment acting within the market economy of Great Britain, learn how to put theory into practice and develop their language skills. They will also increase their interpersonal and intercultural competences and learn how to deal with difficult situations. Moreover, the programme of the placements includes cultural visits to famous places in Great Britain, which will let them to learn about the history and culture of the country. The students will be accommodated with English families, which will be a great opportunity to practice language skills actively in the natural conditions. 



The project will be managed by both ZSH and Training Vision, who will closely cooperate in organisational and logistical matters. Each of the partners will be responsible for precisely defined activities. The receiving organization in cooperation with accompanying persons will be responsible for monitoring each mobility. The accompanying persons will supervise the right course of the placements and support the students and receiving organisation. Evaluation will be carried out from the beginning, i.e. 1 July 2014 to the completion of the project, i.e. 30 June 2016.

Project „ Traineeship equals better job opportunities”/ „Staże zagraniczne szansa na pracę” / is meant for students aged 17 to 20 of a Secondary Technical School in Polkowice /Technikum Zespołu Szkół im. Narodów Zjednoczonej Europy w Polkowicach/. The youth who will participate in the project are educated in the following professions IT technician, hotel industry, advertising and accounting staff. The participants will do a four week practice in the UK at selected employers pointed by the English partner of the project which is Training Vision. Training Vision company  through its ongoing activity proves involvement in mobility, cross-cultural dialogue as well as creativity aimed at offering better job opportunities and apprenticeship in the area of Portsmouth. Training Vision company is involved in numerous UE projects, professional education and partnership projects focused on improving motivation and competence. All this is based on international experience of this company. All the services Training Vision offers match the participants’ needs. The process of finding the employer includes consideration of a participant’s CV, experience and the target language competence. The main objectives of the project are improving professional competence, gaining experience at the European level other than that offered in Poland based companies. Another objective is to improve language competence in both the casual and professional English. Moreover the practice prepares students for active life in the contemporary world by increasing student’s autonomy and resourcefulness. It can be noted that students take on greater responsibility for planning their own educational path and the future career after completing the traineeship. The participants become more competitive in the local, domestic as well as European labour market.
The participants of the project will be given a certificate of the traineeship and a Europass-Mobility document confirming gained competence in terms of professional skills, language as well as personal and interpersonal skills.

The Canary Foundation Youth Ideo through this project , aims to enhance the mobility of European students Canary , and more specifically 60 students / as- workers / Training Workshops as phased recruitment and / or male / female students Programs training in Alternation ( Canary adaptation program temporary retail shop schools )



The objective of the project is the realization of labor practices in companies in the European environment , related to the occupation in which they receive their certificates of professionalism and strengthening the language in another language. These practices are intimately linked to his dual training program in the case of student-workers of the Workshops, etc. .



The Ideo Foundation is the entity that will assume the role of the Organization of the project , taking charge of the promotion, coordination and administration of the project, and has to do with various departments of the foundation belonging to the Assignment Area Projects , Programs and Employment .



With respect to the host country , has the support of several companies and entities acting as intermediary partners with extensive experience in the international arena , especially in the pre LEONARDO programs , and a wide network of centers located throughout Europe : VISION TRAINING (England ) , TELLUS Workexperience UK (England ), F + U Sachsen gGmbH (Germany ) , Vitalis (Germany ) , BULGARIA GATEWAY (Bulgaria ) , TOURISM (Italy ) , ENEA (Italy ) , PARAGON SYSTEMS EUROPE (Malta ) , etc. ..... These entities will be responsible for managing the facility and the search firms in the / participants will practice , as well as support in the language reinforcement. Through them already contacted companies from different sectors , for performing the internship / learners / as .



The number of youth participating in the mobility program is 60 , and will consider the possibility of sending participants of the smaller islands , these islands that have fewer opportunities for geographic mobility limitation.

The length of stay is 3 weeks and it provides that many of them are minors or belonging to groups at risk of exclusion, each group of 10 students will be accompanied by a guardian , which make a total of 6 companions.



Priority specialties are associated with the following professional areas : land , new technologies, building and civil engineering , personal and community services , hotels and restaurants , without implying that along the project is valued incorporate some other industry of interest to all parties.



The dates will be provided to the mobilities from March 2015 to December 2015, taking into account the periods of experimental practices and procurement phases of these programs.
Zagraniczne praktyki zawodowe drogą do europejskich standardów w kształceniu zawodowym

The project is addressed  to  54 students  of  the first and second year  of a technical college in Zespół Szkół Zawodowych  Nr 2  in Starachowice. The participants are going to be students who attend the following  education profiles : information and communication technology, technician electrician, car mechanic,  logistics, natural resources conservation. The partner organization  is Tellus (Group) Ltd  in Plymouth. Foreign practical work experience will last two weeks and will take place in Great Britain in 2014/2015 and 2015/2016 school years. The beneficiaries of the project will  do it according to the planned program  of  vocational training for each vocational group. Most students of the school come from rural areas. Unemployment is quite a common occurrence in their families. The families quite often have low ambitions  as for  professional and social success.  They lack to believe that they are able to  develop  their professional skills. The students tend to fail to overcome their  learning problems. The ability of acquiring new skills and knowledge is very useful and appreciated by modern employers. The school does everything  to prepare its students to be able to start their jobs in the future.  Vocational training plays an important part in developing appropriate competence. It combines  theoretical classes with practical knowledge. The main aim of the project is causing an increase in educational mobility of students, developing their language skills and personality. It  is also supposed to improve  vocational education and meet European Union standards. Taking part in the foreign practical vocational training should help our young people to realize how important it is to be educated. The project  aims to give educational support for young people who are exposed to social exclusion due to material status or their social background. It will restore their  self- estimation,  motivate them  to improve their own qualifications and made them  invest in themselves and their own development. The practical training will teach them how to work in an international and multicultural  team. The two-week stay in new, unknown surroundings  will increase students’ competence in entrepreneurship, language and cultural fields. It will also enhance their  need to develop their abilities. As the confirmation of their developed skills the students will get: Europass Mobility Certificate, Europass- Language Passport, and certificates from the partner organization which will affirm the realization of  the vocational training. As a result of the project, the young people will get more chances to find employment in the very demanding and mobile job market. The foreign vocational training will also show our students different cultural  background. All the activities involved in the realization of the project will be widely publicized ( school internet site, local media, conferences, meetings). The school will definitely strengthen its position in the local environment, which will  result in wider interests in vocational studies among young people.
Mobilité - Adaptabilité - Responsabilité : Je prends mon avenir en main

Jean Baptiste Poquelin high school is located 20 km West of Paris, in Yvelines shire, at the heart of Saint Germain en Laye ( 41000 inhabitants) residential town, rich in history and in culture with a very marked international character. This multi-purpose establishment of 1500 pupils is the oldest of the 8 high schools which counts the municipality. It proposes a big variety of formations mainly in the tertiary domain, the Spanish European Section for the technological sections, the English European section for the professional sections Management / administration, an European formation for the professional sections sales and trade and a BTS International trade (equivalent to a BTEC Higher National Diploma in International Business)

Our project can allow 28 pupils (15 girls and 13 boys), stemming from 6th year of high school  diplomas sales and trade and from Final year of high school diploma Management / administration, to make an immersion stay in England. (3 weeks 1/2 for Sale / business and 4 weeks 1/2 for Management / administration). The durations are imposed by the imperatives of the examination.

The project leans on the expectation to improve the gratitude and the organization of the professional program following different observations as a bad image of the pupils directed by default, an expectation of the labor market and a bad preparation to follow higher studies. It seems a priority to supply to these students modern ways to succeed and which will allow them to appear competent, open-minded, more confident in their school program and on the labor market. We use several management tools as boards, files, forms, agreements and set up a charter and an intent letter for example. This is to bring this project to success and evolves in very good conditions.

As for the previous projects, we began by defining the main actions to be led and the division of responsibilities of each according to the experiences and the skills. Although the tasks are distributed within the teaching staff, one of the teachers and the management assistant insure the coordination of the project. This team benefits from the financial support and from the support of the administration staff of the high school associated with the assembly and with the follow-up of the various actions connected to the project.

The linguistic and cultural educational preparation is made throughout their 3 years formation in the vocational high school diploma. The pupils receive a specific formation by an English teacher (1 hour) and by a teacher of the main professional subject in English language (2 hours). They attend conferences, debates, participate to different meetings about Europe. They organize their own travels in English (in particular two days of discovery in London). The objectives and results expected for the pupils are the improvement of their level of English which can allow them to obtain the European Mention in the high school diploma, The Europro, the Europass Mobility certification and the success of their personal project regarding to their motivation: the high school diploma (with distinction), following chosen studies, participating to a professional integration. Those for the positive future of the project are the adequacy between the skills expected by the companies and those of the students, valuation of the vocational field mainly at the local level. The county is well-known for the success of its elite stream and the incitement to develop European Sections in high schools.

As regards to the mobility, to assure an excellent quality to this project, we call upon an onsite partner with whom we have already worked. The mobility will take place to Portsmouth. This human-sized city has a network of contacts well adapted to our students. The partner mainly provides the selection of host families and host companies, the assistance of the onsite trainees, the communication with the various partners and the teachers.

The students are accompanied during their installation, followed during their mobility and evaluated at the end of internship by their teachers. At the end of their stay they create, then present orally, a professional file in English and a slide show on their experience in England. They spread articles on the web site of the high school and in the local newspapers.

Besides the certification EUROPASS MOBILITY, their mobility is valued by the assessment grid and the certificate of internship corresponding to the regulation of their exam signed by their work placement’s tutor. If they pass the specific exam, the students who follow a European section will get «European Distinction " specified on the diploma “baccalauréat” and the others the Europro.

In the long term, although the sustainability of our project is assured, we work on its improvement to be more autonomous.
Mobilité - Adaptabilité - Responsabilité : Je prends mon avenir en main
