This project is part of the strategy of initiating institution for education and improving the quality of vocational  training, including  European mobility.Participants in the project are the two partner institutions - Professional School of Vine and Wine production  "Alexander Stamboliiski" - Pleven, Bulgaria - initiator and Training Vision - Portsmouth, England - receiving partner.The project duration is 12 months / June 2016-June 2017 /, placement  will be held for three weeks in the area of Portsmouth, England in March-April 2017. Beneficiaries of the project are twenty students in the initial vocational training  from the specialties "Vine grower and Wine producer" - a protected profession, "Plant Protection and Agrochemistry" and "Agroecology".The project objectives aimed at users are:- Increasing the professional knowledge and skills in the field of viticulture through practice in different real working conditions;- Enrichment of acquired professional competence in viticulture through utilization of innovative experience in mobility;- Improving and deepening of linguistic competence in English in the field of viticulture;- Expanding the knowledge of the culture, customs and traditions of England;-Increase the level of competitiveness of users on the basis of achieved sustainable results and their multiplication.The objectives of the project to partners organizations are :- Developing the existing successful cooperation between PGLV and Training Vision at international level in the field of vocational training;- Strengthening the position of PGLV as an educational institution and Training Vision as a professional center for organizing and conducting innovative practices.The methodology of the project activities include the organization, identifying indicators of quality control, implementation of activities and monitoring and dissemination of results for  resistance of the project. The planned project activities related to the choice of the partner, preparing  of necessary documents, communication for the drawing up and approval of the work program for mobility, choice of users,  training of users, organization and implementation of mobility, certification of acquired competences, dissemination and replication of experience.The organization of mobility is common work of the two organizations – promoting and hosting. The quality organization guarantees the value mobility. Learning outcomes of mobility are the main objective of the project. They have gained an innovative experience in viticulture, increased professional and personal skills, improved communication on English language and  increased competitiveness for users, utilized expertise for innovative methods of accompanying persons.The project will impact on participants in practice by achieving the goals set to them.Participation of teachers from PGLV as accompanying persons in the project will increase their competence to implement innovative teaching practices. This will spread the experience and the results will multiply in school and beyond.Certificates issued to participants, will certify their experience and qualifications that make them preferred in employment and increase their competitiveness in the national and European labor market.Stability of  the project results will be achieve by distributing them outside the framework of the partnership among:- Local, regional, national and European institutions, which traditionally work with promoting organization ;- Organizations with which promoter  wants  to create contacts for future collaboration.The expected long-term benefits associated with the project's impact on local and regional level. They are in direct relation to the direction of economic development of Pleven region, particularly in traditional viticulture industry. In the area has favorable conditions for development of the vine culture, but not  enough specialists applying innovative technologies. Increased competence  of beneficiaries on the  project will motivate and prepare them for the implementation of modern, appropriate practices in the establishment and cultivation of vineyards.Innovative experience gained will increase the confidence of users as knowledgeable and capable young professionals to create their own business.

The implemented projects experience shows that students who participated in the project activities more confidence in their own ability and have more cooperation skills. Experience in foreign countries for a young person is an extremely useful. Participants have the opportunity to get acquainted with the practice in the European labor market requirements, to demands for the workplace, quality of work concept.The project "Development of professional experience in EU countries" will give students the opportunity to carry out part of apprenticeship abroad.The main goal of the project is the improvement of professional competences foreign business services, development of creativity, innovation, which will contribute to the successful integration into the labor market.Particular attention is paid to new technologies, creativity, information management skills improvement. The public has highlighted the need for not only good specialists, but also people who are capable of creative debate and to doubt that critically and freely to think, pay to adapt to the constantly changing world. Creativity needed everywhere there is a need for new solutions. Creativity and innovation in professional career goes hand in hand with the success and it is irrelevant whether the product produced in the creative, or being developed innovative technologies, or other professional activity. Under the current conditions on the labor market of the future employee must be fast, flexible and creative.The project tasks for all for students:- to develop creativity, innovation, autonomy, tolerance collective work and individual activities;- to improve operational skills and professional abilities, to deepen the professional knowledge of foreign languages.The project tasks:- chefs will improve their different dishes preparation skills, will get acquainted with the new technologies and the use of the equipment in the real work place, tool diversity and use of countries catering enterprises organization of production peculiarities, organization of work;- Small Business Service Providers participants will improve their professional skills, to come up with new technologies in business enterprises;- Computers and organizational technical operators will acquire knowledge and practical skills computer graphics, layout technology, sites development areas.In project will take part - 24 students, for  6 students in each host country (United Kingdom, Italy, Spain and Portugal).In to visits will take place with the students and accompanying person, who first week will help to adapt and respond to the questions of pathway will co-ordinate project document.The systematic assessment of project activities will help ensure the quality of the implementation of the project and to achieve the expected results.Practice abroad students will help improve not only professional competence, but also the key competences to a level that will shape the skills of intercultural communication will promote tolerance to other cultures, will help deepen your knowledge of foreign languages.

The project "Improving the skills and competencies of the students in real multicultural environment”, which is a beneficiary from PGLPT was developed in accordance with the Strategy for the Development of Vocational Education 2014-2020 of the European Commission,  Ordinance №1 / 08.09.2015  the terms and conditions for training through work / dual training /, The Act on pre-school and school education and development strategy of PGLPT.Partner of the project is Training Vision Ltd, Portsmouth, United Kingdom. The Mobility will take place in accordance with the work program, agreed and signed with the partner during 26.03.2017g. to 04.09.2017. The final beneficiaries are 20 students from grades 11 and 12 - 10 from specialty "Economics and Management", 10 from specialty "Guide services" and two accompanying teachers. In July 2016 the principal will conduct a preliminary site visit within 5 working days for knowing the work places, mentors and living conditions in which the students will be accommodated. Knowledge, skills and competences obtained during the training will be validated by a certificate Europass mobility and certificate held manufacturing practice in a real business environment. By decision of the pedagogical Council of PGLPT-conducted by the students mobility in the United Kingdom will be considered as a production practice in the specialty.At the current stage of economic development of our country there is a mismatch between the requirements of the labor market and professional competencies of young people who have received secondary education and vocational training in vocational schools.As the main objective set by the strategy for development of the school is to provide a European vocational education of young people in close cooperation with the business through internationalization of the learning process for the realization of the European labor market, whose member is Bulgaria. This motivates the team PGLPT to develop and implement this project, whose main objective is to upgrade and enhance the professional skills and competencies of students by providing a work placement in a real and multicultural business environment.Specific objectives:-To increase motivation, professional and personal growth and self-esteem of young people;-- To acquaint young people with the best European practices in the organization and implementation of vocational education to improve quality and competitiveness of the European labor market;- To promote lifelong learning.- To improve linguistic skillsThe project objectives will be implemented conditionally passing through three stages:-  Preparatory - development, coordination and signing of a work program with the partner-  selection of beneficiaries, getting acquainted with the activities of the work program, conducting special and cultural preparation, signing contracts with beneficiaries, insurance, ticketing, preparing a presentation of PGLPT and Valley of Roses and Thracian Kings, development of questionnaires and diaries for manufacturing practice.- Actual - conducting a two-week manufacturing practice in strict compliance with the work program, monitoring the individual development of each participant, completing the diaries to conduct production practice, completing questionnaires.- Conclusive - analysis of the activities, reporting, dissemination of project results among students, teachers and parents of PGLPT, representatives of local businesses directly connected with professional preparation and realization of students, related vocational schools in municipality, state institutions and public organizations multiply the results of the project.Expected results of mobility are:Increased and improved professional skills of beneficiaries in a real multicultural business environment that will use in their future career;- Improving foreign language communication and personal skills in an unfamiliar environment;- Gained valuable experience of teamwork;- Providing the opportunity for application of acquired in terms of the Bulgarian educational system - theoretical knowledge into practice in a multicultural business environment;- Promoting mobility between European countries;- Encouraging young people to become acquainted with European best practices to improve the quality of vocational training;- Enriched knowledge of the history and culture of the United Kingdom;- Popularized Bulgarian educational system, history, tradition and culture;- Increasing the competitiveness of the labor market.

Secondary technical school Hranice that proposes this project provides secondary education in these fields: 4 year: Fire protection, Applied chemistry, CNC mechanic, Wood and furniture production, Construction materials. 3 year: Locksmith, Tooler, Plumber. 2 year follow up study – Operating technic, Wood and furniture production.The name of the project is Across Europe and it is aimed for students of all branches. The reason for this project is passing workplacement to school educational program. The function is completing not only theoretical and practical lessons, but also improvement in foreign language and learning new culture. The system ECVET will be used to improve the quality of project.The first host organization is Agrupamento de Escolas Henriques Nogueira in Portugal (Torres Vedras), where 6 Chemistry students will analyse water and 6 Fire protection students will have workplacements in fire stations in May 2017.The second one is Escola Secundária de Loulé (Portugal)  which arranges workplacement for 6 Fire protection students in fireman stations and at the airport Faro. In June 2017. The same aktivity will be in Slovakia in June 2017.The next 3 intermediatory organizations are Language Solution in the UK (Portsmouth - in September 2017) for 8 students and Future Focus in Malta (Floriana - in September 2017) for 8 students and Cork Language Institute in Ireland for 6 students. All of them arrange workplacement for students of every field. Every student has chance for taking part in project.The term is from 1.8. 2016 to 30.11.2017.The impact should be improvement of professional education and student´s practical preparation. Futhermore there will be contribution of language skills and selfconfidence. The result of project is going to have influance of educational program, enriched of new technological processes.
Inovativní evropské zkušenosti, postupy a technologie

The project "Innovative European experience, methods and technologies" involves VET learners´ traineeships in vocational institutes abroad (Activity 1) and Staff training abroad (Activity 2).Activity 1 is built on the previous cooperation between The South Moravian Region and partner regions and is implementing a 2-week traineeships of 20 students at the partner VET school - Strukovna škola Vice Vlatković in 2 runs in April 2017 and 2018. The aim of learners´ traineeships is to provide students the opportunity to gain professional experience, improve practical skills in their field of studies, particularly in solar systems, programming microprocessors, and improve their linguistic competences in English, gain basic communication skills in Croatian, gain organizational, social and personal skills. The project also gives students the opportunity to improve the quality of their key competencies to ensure their professional growth and their competitiveness in the labour market, which will lead to their successful employment after graduation, a fruitful career and improvement of education quality at our school.Minor and major 3rd year Mechanic electronics students (specialization – mechatronics) will be participating in Activity 1. We also want to involve students with learning disabilities to the project  to motivate and help them in self-realization. Participants will spend 7 hours per work day at the partner school fulfilling the unit of learning outcomes which will be assessed according to specified criteria and recorded in Personal Transcripts. For gaining social and intercultural skills we are planning to organize excursions in companies in Zadar County and to visit interesting places in surroundings.The project will use the ECVET principles for improving the quality of mobility and training, which primarily means the signing of the Memorandum of Understanding. It will establish roles of both organizations in the project. The certification of Activity 1 will be provided by means of Learning Agreement, Personal Transcript, Europass of Mobility and Certificate of completing the traineeship for each student. We see the biggest impact of the project in relation to the participants and their professional and personal growth, gaining professional experience, particularly with solar systems and programming microprocessors, gaining social and personal skills. The project will have an impact on other students; they will gain higher motivation and interest in studies. The level of VET education at our school will be improved by implementation of the results of the project in teaching, which will increase the competitiveness of our graduates. There will certainly be some impacts on partner organizations which will gain experience in managing mobilities, preparing students for the traineeships. In addition the project will lead to improving communication between partners and strengthening their cooperation and friendship.To ensure Activity 2 SŠTE will be cooperating with the intermediary organization Language Solution, which will provide the visits of VET organizations in Hampshire, shadowing of technical and Science subjects, shadowing methods of administration and management of the organizations, exchanging experience with teachers, passing down the examples of good practice, procedures and know-how. 10 teachers of technical and science subjects and leading teachers and deputy heads of SŠTE will be taking part in 2-week mobilities of Activity 2 in Portsmouth, Hampshire UK in 2 runs in October 2016 and 2017. An integral part of the mobility will be learning about the culture and life in Britain. The improvement of teaching skills, teachers´ professional skills and knowledge, teachers´ language skills, capturing new methods in education, expanding cooperation and partnerships between educational institutions in the field of vocational training are main objectives of Activities 2. The outcomes and impacts of the Activity are connected with the objectives when improving teachers´ professional knowledge, skills and experience will lead to using acquired knowledge and new methods in teaching, improving the quality of teaching, transferring the acquired knowledge to students, and thereby increasing the competitiveness of our school graduates and their better employment after school.We expect another impact of Activity 2 in increasing the quality of services provided by SŠTE, improving the school climate and strengthening the staff, which will be ensured with gaining knowledge and tips for effective school management, becoming familiar with quality management systems used for school management, becoming familiar with the documents used in VET organizations in the UK.Impacts regarding Language Solution are mainly in getting experience in providing shadowing and other activities. The project will also strengthen the cooperation and friendship among organizations and develop international relations and communication.
Παραγωγή Εκπαιδευτικού Διδακτικού Υλικού με τη χρήση Οπτικοακουστικών Μέσων και των ΤΠΕ- Εικονικά εργαστήρια

The proposed project constitutes an innovative way to support the educational work of our school and our teachers in implementing their mission.In our school, there is laboratory of audiovisual media. We already have experience in producing educational material using ICT. It is also equipped with modern computer labs, used to teach multimedia classes, as a part of the curriculum of the Informatics specialty in the cooperating vocational schools. Moreover, we have a webradio  station (http://radio.mysch.gr), which is a result of the cooperation of teachers and students.We have designed this proposal after acknowledging the need for continuous improvement of the teaching staff, while learning and applying modern teaching methods, with the ultimate aim of effectively embedding the use of ICT in the educational process. Therefore, the scheduled visits and workshops focus on the digital production of media and the sharpening of administrative, creative and technical skills.The teachers of the school already have experience in the production of educational material, as can be seen in our YouTube channel (https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZOt0RDXURw933T2xcQV0ng). Our goal is to use any technology available (eg smartphones, laptops, tablets) for the production of teaching material for our students. We will focus on all aspects of the production of multimedia educational tools related to the goals and curricula of our course, aiming to improve the learning process.The project includes 16 teachers, coming from the Electrical, Electronics and Computer Science specialties. Participants have a future in school and excellent development prospects, but at the same time great learning experience and scientific competence. Teachers selected have strong concerns and considerations to improve teaching practices for the benefit of students and thus the efficient operation of the school.Through this plan, the participating teachers will seek to know in depth the various technologies and procedures applicable in the host institutions for the production of innovative and workable classroom educational products (video, movies, presentations) using audiovisual and appropriate computer software.

Jean Baptiste Poquelin high school is located 20 km West of Paris, in Yvelines shire, at the heart of Saint Germain en Laye ( 41000 inhabitants) residential town, rich in history and in culture with a very marked international character. This multi-purpose establishment of 1500 pupils is the oldest of the 8 high schools which counts the municipality. It proposes a big variety of formations mainly in the tertiary domain, the Spanish European Section for the technological sections, the English European section for the professional sections Management / administration, an European formation for the professional sections sales and trade and a BTS International trade (equivalent to a BTEC Higher National Diploma in International Business)Our project can allow 28 pupils (23 girls and 5  boys), stemming from 6th year of high school  diplomas sales and trade and from Final year of high school diploma Management / administration, to make an immersion stay in England. (3 weeks 1/2 for Sale / business and 4 weeks 1/2 for Management / administration). The durations are imposed by the imperatives of the examination.The project leans on the expectation to improve the gratitude and the organization of the professional program following different observations as a bad image of the pupils directed by default, an expectation of the labor market and a bad preparation to follow higher studies. It seems a priority to supply to these students modern ways to succeed and which will allow them to appear competent, open-minded, more confident in their school program and on the labor market. We use several management tools as boards, files, forms, agreements and set up a charter and an intent letter for example. This is to bring this project to success and evolves in very good conditions.As for the previous projects, we began by defining the main actions to be led and the division of responsibilities of each according to the experiences and the skills. Although the tasks are distributed within the teaching staff, one of the teachers and the management assistant insure the coordination of the project. This team benefits from the financial support and from the support of the administration staff of the high school associated with the assembly and with the follow-up of the various actions connected to the project.The linguistic and cultural educational preparation is made throughout their 3 years formation in the vocational high school diploma. The pupils receive a specific formation by an English teacher (1 hour) and by a teacher of the main professional subject in English language (2 hours). They attend conferences, debates, participate to different meetings about Europe. They organize theirown travels in English (in particular two days of discovery in London). The objectives and results expected for the pupils are the improvement of their level of English which can allow them to obtain the European Mention in the high school diploma, The Europro, the Europass Mobility certification and the success of their personal project regarding to their motivation: the high school diploma (with distinction), following chosen studies, participating to a professional integration. Those for the positive future of the project are the adequacy between the skills expected by the companies and those of the students, valuation of the vocational field mainly at the local level. The county is well-known for the success of its elite stream and the incitement to develop European Sections in high schools.As regards to the mobility, to assure an excellent quality to this project, we call upon an onsite partner with whom we have already worked. The mobility will take place to Portsmouth. This human-sized city has a network of contacts well adapted to our students. The partner mainly provides the selection of host families and host companies, the assistance of the onsite trainees, the communication with the various partners and the teachers.The students are accompanied during their installation, followed during their mobility and evaluated at the end of internship by their teachers. At the end of their stay they create, then present orally, a professional file in English and a slide show on their experience in England. They spread articles on the web site of the high school and in the local newspapers.Besides the certification EUROPASS MOBILITY, their mobility is valued by the assessment grid and the certificate of internship corresponding to the regulation of their exam signed by their work placement’s tutor. If they pass the specific exam, the students who follow a European section will get «European Distinction " specified on the diploma “baccalauréat” and the others the Europro.In the long term, although the sustainability of our project is assured, we work on its improvement to be more autonomous.

Continuing with the line of internationalization of our center that began with Becoming International I in 2013, Becoming International III continues with the current project, the aims of our center summarized in needs of teachers and students are:Teachers needs: 1. To improve the skills and professional profile as well as to acquire new didactic innovative methodologies in favor of our students. 2. Exchange didactic experiences with professionals of other countries. 3. Better mutual knowledge of the different systems of vocational training. 4. Learning of different methods and technologies of work from those of the own labor context. 5. Use of different technologies and possibility of sharing new methods of work and to take them to the practice. 6. Improvement of the linguistic skills. 7. To guarantee the relations with other centers in Europe. 8. To provide our organization with a much-needed international and multicultural dimension .Students needs: 1. To contribute to the creation of a community of young and future qualified well professionals, with opened minds and international experience, improving their professional and linguistic skills. 2. To increase the possibilities of our pupils to compete on the labor European market. The way of obtaining our aims, in agreement to the raised needs, is carrying out activities that promote, on one hand, the mobility of  students to an European country, during a month of practices included inside the module of formation in centers of work.  And on the other hand, the mobility of our teachers, as an essential piece in this process, they could realize mobilities to improve his skill, in Job Shadowing, in order to optimize the quality of the education.The improvement in the linguistic and cultural skills that stems from the own mobility, both for students  and teachers, will constitute a very important added value to fight for an ideal positioning inside the labor local market, increasing the possibilities of insertion in the European area and laying the foundations for the establishment of stable networks of collaboration between organizations and institutions.The activities of mobility raised for the following project are : - Students' mobility for trainning : Six students of the formative cycle " Technician in Taken care Auxiliary of Infirmary "to do the trainning in Finland. Two students of the formative cycle " Technician in Drugstore and Parafarmacia " that will realize his mobility in United Kingdom.As for the profile of the participants, this year they are all very young pupils who deal the first course of the formative cycle. It is a very heterogeneous profile as for level curricular minimum and socioeconomic level, being pupils who come both from baccalaureate and from programs of professional initial qualification. The teacher's profile:One teacher of the Health family that  will travel to Finland to do a Job shadowing in Etelä-Kymenlaakso, our better partner.  Another teacher of Physical - sports family that will realize a Job shadowing in another institute of Holland still for detailing.In terms of the teachers' profile,  emphasize the teachers are fixed in the Centre, belonging to the Center's international programs Committee, with some linguistic skills and very motivated for the acquisition of new pedagogical knowledge of trainning work.The impact will be materialized in the improvement in the positioning with respect to the labour market. And, for the teachers, in the obtaining of official degrees of languages, teaching classes in foreign languages and the introduction of methodologic changes that reflect the acquisition of new skills, didactic and methodological.In the long term a strengthening of the center as a reference within the professional sector. The teaching of subjects in a foreign language, the internationalization of studies, the establishment of contacts and stable relationships with companies and European institutions working in the same field, will be a distinctive feature of our institution.
BENCHMARKING INOVATIV IN INVATAMANTUL TEHNOLOGIC SI TURISM PENTRU O COOPERARE EUROPEANA DURABILA

The project with the title "Innovative Benchmarking in Techological Education and Tourism for a Sustainable European Cooperation" is a Erasmus+ KA1 and VET mobility project for students and staff which contributes to the objectives of the Action Programme of the EU on training and provides the European dimension of education, corresponding to the national priority in order to ensure the access to quality education in initial vocational training, while at regional level is correlated with the priority of ensuring transparency of qualifications and promotes the European mobilities.The AIM of the project results from a real need for training the high school students from 10th and 11th grade from the Technological specialization, Services profile, ‚Tourism and catering’ domain, with the qualifications "Hotel worker" and "Technician in tourism", providing an initial training correlated with the Romanian and European employers' expectations from tourism. The project also satisfies the need to apply our high school’ in-service (continous) training policy of the high school teachers specialized on VET to ensure the European dimension of the technological education.The OBJECTIVES of the project are: a) General: -international cooperation for innovation and sharing the best practices for technological education; -developing cooperation in the European education and training of studentsb) Specific: b.1.) specific for students: Formation of core competencies transition from school to work and teamwork, specific skills to provide quality hotel services and achieving the technical operations of the travel agency, cross-curricular skills : communicating in a language Stain and digital;-forming the behavior based on respect and hospitality tailored to the expectations of European tourists;-forming a positive attitude in order to improve the quality in technological educationb.2.) specific for teachers:- improving the professional skills capacity for analysis and synthesis of technological education in the European context;-applying new methods and tools to increase the quality of European Benchamarking in the technological education;-developing skills to use ICT, communication in a foreign language; adapting to the European organizational culture, work in an international team.The target group consists of 28 students from 10th and 11th grade with the qualification: ‚Hotel worker’ and ‚Technician in tourism’ and 10 teachers specialized on VET education who teach in the high school and post secondary school.MOBILITYFlow I: 6 specialist teachers from the high school, Job Shadowing, April 2nd-8th, 2017 -Helsinki, Finland, partner organization-EUNEOSFlow II: 14 students, qualification ‚Technician in tourism’; June 4th -24th, 2017-Portsmouth, United Kingdom, partner organization - Traning Vision LtD.Flow III: 4 teachers specialists at the post-secondary school, Job Shadowing,Aprilie 3rd- 20, 2018 -Nancy, France; School partner Frederic ChopinFLOW IV: 14 students qualifying hotel worker, 17iunie-July 7, 2018, Rimini, Italy organization partner -Sistema Turismo PROJECT ACTIVITIES:-Information in two meetings, announcement on the board with projects;-Selection of beneficiars based on the following criteria: 10th grade or 11th student, technological high school, Services profile, basic training field - Tourism; or teachers -specialists in the Technological education area who have not benefited of a Erasmus+ scholarship;submitting a complete application file; selection tests: test of knowledge and test in the foreign language;-Pedagogical preparation -6hours / flow; Linguistic preparation in the country for English / French / Italian, 20 hours on for the teachers’ flows and 35 hours for the students’s flow; Cultural and pedagogical preparation -8hours in the country and 10hours  abroad for students, 4 hours for teachers;-Monitoring the mobilities by observing, advice, satisfaction questionnaires, diaries, filling in of practice and individual reports- Initial/during/final evaluation of the participants in mobility using tests, work samples-Certification, validation of the results by the foreign partners and Sc.Sup.Com.N.Kretzulescu- Dissemination locally, regionally, nationally and internationally through mass media, meetings of methodical committees, symposia, fairs of training firms, workshops, the following results: 28 students with upper level professional standards skills for the qualifications ‚Hotel worker’ and ‚Technician in tourism’ and 10 teachers with improved professional skills in order to increase the quality of the technological education, obtaining for each beneficiary of the Europass,of the participation and foreign language certificates, 38 portfolios of mobility, 20 new teaching materials using ICT, a methodological guide for increasing the quality of technogical education, a CD with videos, with modern teaching activities, the project website, a partners’ network.

Project Nr. "Science without borders" implies participation in professional seminars  and internships of 119 students and 31 teachers of vocational schools of theWest- Pomeranian and Lubuskie voivodships. Learners and trainees will take trainings ans internships in trades such as: gastronomy,  automotive technician, mechanic an of motor vehicles, hairdresser, hotel management, photography, hairdresser, IT- digital processing.Students will be invited to monthly interns to Italy (40 persons), United Kingdom (20 persons) and Spain (59 persons). Each group will be accompanied by a guardian from Poland. During the internship students will pursue the issue referred to the Foundation of the training programme in the profession and acquire practical knowledge of performing the profession. Teachers will leave for weekly trainings to Italy (20 persons), United Kingdom (4 persons) and Spain (7 people). Teachers will be trained by the employers adopting the youth for practical internships to observe and get to know the reality of the implementation of the knowledge which they teach in the way of the theoretical activities in practice.In the context of the personal and professional needs, the project will carry out such objectives as:-to acquire international certificates-transnational mobility on the European labour market,-development and acquisition of practical professional skills,-improvement of language skills, openness and intercultural sensitivity,-stimulation of creativity and entrepreneurship,-the development of characteristics such as confidence, responsibility, equality, diversity, transparency, respect, honesty, passion and commitment. These aspects affect the greater attractiveness of VET schools, and in the future, greater economic development in the regions, which is consistent with the Lisbon strategy, which envisions as the most competitive economy in the countries of Europe and the world.

The CUENCA PLUS III, which aims to provide citizens of our city, Cuenca, the impulse to strengthen and develop the economic fabric and business competitiveness of the municipality, is presented through quality training among urban youth to enable them to gain future employment.There have been several reasons that led the City Council of Cuenca to promote this initiative which encourages the development of the city through training their young people. On the one hand, this project is given continuity to the mobility projects that have been developed over the years from this institution. Thanks to these previous projects, a positive development has been seen in the profile of young people of the city who may now aspire to a wider range of possibilities in the labour market or to establish the foundations for future personal and professional projects.Also, as explained in the previous project (CUENCA PLUS II), with this proposal the City Council intends to continue its efforts to alleviate the growth rate of emigration that is experienced in the town since the crisis began, due to the worrying situation of unemployment in the the city. From the data handled by the institution itself, the City Council considers quality training of young people as the key to combating the deficiency of foundation in the education system, school drop out and lack of expertise of young people. Additionally we must add the lack of employment policies and existing widespread discontent in the town.The City Council has proposed new collaboration at 3 local institutions that participated last year and has also invited another institution for the creation of a Consortium that allows them to continue the work that began in 2014. The Consortium is formed by the City Council of Cuenca, Pedro Mercedes School, San José School, the CEOE-CEPYME Cuenca and Alfonso VIII School to collaborate in the development of CUENCA PLUS III project.This project is aimed at 15 young Vocational Education Trainees who are following their final year or are undertaking a course of training for employment leading to a Certificate of Competence. The training placements will be for 3 months and will take place between July and September 2017. The countries that will host future participants will be UK, Italy and France.Participants will receive language training before their departure through the online course OLS that Erasmus + Program will make available. Before departure, participants will also receive a socio-professional and cultural training organised by the team of the Consortium.The results that this project will provide are:- To consolidate practical training that strengthens the knowledge acquired by young people.- To promote the improvement of the teaching-learning relationship and academic training.- Professional specialisation.- Promoting language proficiency with the aim of achieving bilingualism.- Promoting the autonomy and responsibility of young people.- To understand how an EU company operates promoting the entrepreneurial spirit.- To promote intercultural education as a basis for quality European training.- To improve social skills of young people.- To promote mutual understanding of academic training in the different EU countries.- To develop values such as solidarity, tolerance and respect amongst young people.- To promote recognition of their studies.- To promote the multiplier effect of mobility experiences.- To encourage the economic development of the city through better preparation of their young people.The expected impact associated with this project: - Increased competitiveness at local, regional, national, European and / or international levels; - The flow of the economy, knowledge and ideas; - Increased collaboration and cooperation between institutions and businesses at international level; - A social and cultural impact which will create more tolerant citizens.The expected long-term benefits are: - Improving the quality of candidates for jobs; - Expanding frontiers in the search for work; - Generation of new skills; - New approaches to work.

Project title: International internships - a good start.Key action: Education mobility within  Erasmus+ program financed by European CommissionAction type: VET  learner and staff  mobilityProject duration: 15th September 2016 – 14th September 2017Participants: 34Beneficiary: Upper Secondary School Complex no 1 in Nowy Targ / Poland / Vocational SchoolInternship place: Portsmouth in  Great Britain and Rimini in Italy Job shadowing: Portsmouth in Great BritainProject description:Project involves organization of two mobilities for  students of Upper Secondary School Complex nr 1 in Nowy Targ – Poland:a/ 4 weeks vocational training in Portsmouth – Great Britain for 17 students in professions: Information Technology,       digital processing of graphics, photography.b/ 4 weeks vocational training in Rimini - Italy for 16 students in professions: clothing production technology,      advertising, photographyas well as job shadowing and English course for 2 information technology teachers from our school for 2 weeks.Project starts in September 2016 with language and cultural background preparation. The internship is planned as one go for both groups of students in February/ March 2017.Job shadowing will take place in the beginning of July next year. There are two intermediary partners - experienced institutions, in our project: Training Vision Ltd from Portsmouth and Sistema Turismo s.r.l. from Rimini - sister companies belonging to ETN Network group. They will enable the work placements in  hosting companies specialized in Information Technology,  Graphics, Photography  as well as in clothing and advertising companies in Portsmouth and Rimini. Training Vision will also organize the job shadowing in the information technology training centre in Portsmouth. After the internship there will be two months period for reporting, evaluation and dissemination of the project results. The purpose of the mobility project of students and staff  is:- improving the vocational training and increasing  knowledge and skills of the students- implementing the theoretical knowledge into practice- getting acquainted  with modern technology used in foreign companies – gaining European standard of education by participants- getting to know teaching methods used abroad and implementing them at our school- observing the functioning of foreign enterprises- improving English language skills, especially on vocational level- broadening the horizons of participants through getting to know culture and history of the foreign countries as well as establishing    international contacts, exchange of experiences with maintaining  tolerance and respect for other nations- developing the cooperation between employers and  institution of vocational education on national and international level- gaining the European standard of education in Upper Secondary School Complex no 1 in Nowy Targ, Poland.The above aims represent also  the planned effects of the project.Moreover  increased mobility of the participants and their better possibilities of finding a job due to  having international vocational experience will be other great effects of the project.Our project implements strategies of European policy concerning spreading the recognition of vocational qualifications through carrying out ECVET and Europass Mobility procedures, where all the tasks and achieved skills are specified. This factor will also cause better competitiveness of the participants on the labour market.Getting to know teaching methods which are used abroad  and gradually implementing English as the language applied in Information Technology during lessons in our institution will be an important result of this project in long time range.Experience gained by Upper Secondary School Complex no1 in Nowy Targ will be  another long term effect creating perspective of carrying out successfully following mobility projects and increasing the number of Erasmus+ program beneficiaries.
Mobilny Technik w ZSGH w Wiśle

The aim of the project, implemented by Secondary School of Hospitality and Catering in Wisła in cooperation with Training UK and Tribeka Training Lab S.L., is to give 50 students a chance to undergo 4-week long internship in the Great Britain and Spain. The participants of the project will be the students of gastronomy and  hospitality.The main objective of the project is meeting the participants’ needs concerning gaining practical work experience in order to enhance the key competences so that they can improve their position on the job market. The students will have a possibility to benchmark the operation and methods applied in the companies in Poland and abroad which will increase their flexibility and adaptation to various working environments both in the country and abroad. Moreover, the participants will receive Europass Mobility document, which proves the qualifications and increases  the employability in different countries. The internship abroad will  have a positive effect on  improving language skills. The participants will have an opportunity to  check their language competence in real everyday situations as well as in professional life. The necessity to use language every day will have a positive effect on communication skills. As a result they will be more self-confident and motivated to learn. Furthermore, the improved language skills will facilitate their participation in further trainings and international experiences, which will promote the idea of long life learning. The students will also have a chance to develop social and interpersonal skills as well as the valuable employee’s qualities such as consciousness and self-reliance.Participation in mobility project will enable students to go abroad and meet people originating from different cultural background which will help  increase tolerance and openness. The group which will especially benefit from the project are  the students living in the rural areas who, owing to their family, social and financial situation, have a limited access to  experiences building multicultural awareness. Their participation in mobility will allow them to become more open to different cultures.Another aim of the project is to promote the European dimension of our organization by commencing cooperation with foreign companies and to increase its prestige in local community.The expected results:- increasing the level of key competences facilitating  job searching  and career development,- gaining professional experience abroad facilitating participant’s mobility during job searching in the future,- increasing participants’ self-reliance through travelling abroad, staying away from family and home as well as increased self-confidence steaming from managing new experiences,- increased language competence gained through practical learning in the native speakers environment, increasing the motivation to further learning and improved learning results,- encounter with different culture facilitating cultural dialogue and increasing multicultural awareness,The project implementation will be beneficial not only to its participants but also to people indirectly connected with it. Owing to the promotion of the results, other students, parents, teachers as well as local community will be aware of the benefits steaming from European cooperation. It will teach the openness and tolerance and promote the idea of long life learning and gaining new experiences to be more flexible on job market. The project will have long-lasting effects noticeable after its completion. The results of the project will be disseminated during the events promoting our school such as open day or educational fairs, which will increase school’s appeal and attract new students. The promoting activities combined with European dimension will increase the school’s prestige and position in local community.
TRAINING ABROAD THE BEST WAY FOR JOB HUNTING

FOR THE STUDENTS ´  TRAINING PRACTICESThe goal of the project is to bring the professional world closer to vocational students and to enable their integration into the working world in the European Union. The Meka Vocational School  project will send 15 students to Europe to complete their Work Center Training from different vocational programs: Nursing Assistants, Geriatric and Dependent Care, Business Administration, Bodywork, Automobile Electromechanics, Machinery Electromechanics, and Welding.The activities that will be completed in the host country´s  work centers will be determined between the tutor of the educational center and the company instructor. In any case, these activities will correspond with the professional needs of the program that is being studied. Before beginning these activities, the students will have completed training practices by means of theory classes as well as practical experience in the workshop of the educational center. They will have completed their training with participative methodology and the completion of small projects which aim to include the knowledge imparted through different subjects. These students will also receive English classes in the educational center, with the goal of reinforcing their knowledge and thus facilitating their integration into the host country.The expected results can be divided into the following categories:1. - On a professional level, the student will acquire work habits which are different than those adopted in their normal environment.2. - On a personal level, the student will learn about other cultures, languages, and customs, gaining a rich experience.3. - Meka Vocational School will be able to compare the training that it offers to its students with training offered abroad, and share that training with citizens of Elgoibar.FOR THE STAFF MOBILITY PROJECT2 members of the staff team of the nursing Care department will take part in this project.Our intention with this project (ICEUVET)is to find new references, exchanging ideas and new ways of working and taking a close look at the organizational and operational aspects.In order to do this, the partner of the Swedish center (Aranäsgymnasiet) will organize the workshops, conferences, meetings and visits to thclassrooms and workshops in the Nursing care field.It is about creating different directions for improving educational activities that will benefit our surroundings, providing solutions to the demands of students, companies and, ultimately, to the whole of society.5 members of the department (services to the community) take part in the project in Finland. the objective is to make job-shadowing visits to the schools in Yliviesca.7 teachers in the business administration department will participate in this project that intends to deepen and share new teaching methodologiIn the same way, for the 3 projects,we are looking for the interaction between different European centers in order to cooperate in finding new ways of acting,facing the same problems and sharing experiences to take advance of the effort for the benefit of the community.These projects expanded to more schools aims to renew the drive representing other ways to work in Vocational Training, recognizing good practices, assessing our progress and capturing ideas to address common challenges.The projects aims to understand the best practices that may be using other schools at a European level and then integrate them into the management of our centers and the teaching practice, therefore, to obtain a training in continuous improvement that relies on academic  excellence.The main result to be obtained is to achieve Vocational Training of quality that nourishes from the surrounding environment in order to serve as a link between the different sectors of society satisfying the needs of them.In addition to the above results, this project seeks to achieve a number of more intangible results, but no less important , as an effective collaboration between the European Vocational training or cooperation and transfer of knowledge and innovative experiences.The foreseen assessment  of the projects will be undertaken by records of the working groups meeting in Sweden, Finland and Estonia  in order to set the deviation between the objectives and the achievements.The planned dissemination of the experience and the results will be held in each of the websites of the participating centers and in the common MOODLE platform.The local and regional radio stations and other media who want to echo the activities in these projects,will be informed about the obtained results and more specifically the organization of the meeting in the three countries shall also be communicated.Furthermore, the coordinator of the project team will prepare a final report in electronic format and on paper, which will be disclosed among the different components of the educational community as well as the socioeconomic environment of the center .

The project is organized by District Centre of Continuing and Practical Education in Bedzin (PCKUiP). Education staff mobility project "Practician on the practice" is addressed to teachers of PCKUiP and of the Group of Schools of Technology and Service in Bedzin. It is a response to the need for continuous deepening of knowledge in the field of vocational education and the need to adapt to the growing demands of the European market.The main objective of the project is to improve the quality and attractiveness of vocational education through comprehensive preparation of teachers to undertake professional tasks realized by improving the skills and qualifications of teachers, emphasizing the European dimension of the institution (familiarizing teachers with specific objectives, values and tasks arising from European and global trends in education, acquiring partners for school mobility, co-creating international educational platforms, exchanging experiences with teachers and educational organizations in European countries) and learning new tools or methods of teaching (knowledge of European and world educational models, learning strategies and teaching methods, techniques and programs).The participants of the project will be 30 teachers (six groups of five) representing various sectors (mechanical, electric-electronic, catering, construction, information technology, hairdressing and cosmetic).In the project will be organized six mobilities of groups (of five teachers). There are planned three mobilities of education staff in the school year 2016/2017 and another three in the school year 2017/2018. Each mobility will last 12 days. There are planned two mobilities to England - for the electro-electronic industry and information technology, two mobilities to Italy - for mechanical engineering and construction and two mobilities to Spain - for foodservice and hairdressing and cosmetics. It is planned to serve an internship in the form of job shadowing in training institutions of learning profiles consistent with the professional profiles of the participants. Mobility also involves cultural knowledge of target countries - England, Spain and Italy. The internship program has been agreed with the host organizations. Recruitment of teachers will be based on defined criteria. All the project addressees will undergo language training before mobility.Partner institutions (Sistema Turismo Tribeka TRAINING LAB Training Vision) will be responsible for monitoring internships. Contact with PCKUiP will be maintained electronically and by telephone. The tutor appointed by the host organization will supervise the  current monitoring of the  participants'  practices. Within the internships will be organized the meeting participants, during which all problems and remarks will be reported and solved.In terms of evaluation, the project participants will complete prepared questionnaires and draw up individual reports on held practices. They will share their insights and observations on the created for this purpose online forum. They will prove the progress of their internships in the form of presentation. With the gained experience they will prepare lesson plans based on known methods of teaching and innovative curricula used in England, Spain and Italy. Designed handouts and presentations of participants will serve organizing peer lessons for other teachers of vocational education to exchange experiences.The project involves the dissemination of results at local and regional level. The acquisition of new knowledge and skills will be supported by relevant documents. Acquired knowledge and skills will be passed on to other teachers, not only through peer lessons and presentations, but also through meetings and educational boards. With their experiences participants will support the colleagues in workshop development. As a result of the project  school curricula base will be enriched. They will respond to the newly learned methods and techniques of teaching and technology. Progress of the project will be shared on the Centre's website and online forum.The knowledge and skills acquired during their mobility in the framework of the project "Practician on the practice" will equip teachers with better tools, increase the quality of the educational offer of PCKUiP and affect the prestige of the institution.

The Pontevedra Provincial Council does not hesitate when it comes to promoting measures that develop employment and entrepreneurship, through the broadcasting of job placement programmes. Nevertheless, we find unmotivated young people, with difficulty in accessing the labour market, with little or no knowledge of a second language, with little knowledge of and experience in ICT and whose concerns revolve around issues such as education, housing, employment and health. On the opposite side, we find that companies in the province demand increasingly prepared young people, as a result of innovation in different sectors internationally.To help boost the economy of the province, the Provincial Government has formed a consortium with 29 Vocational Education Training schools, which will offer 116 newly qualified young people in a middle level cycle of one of these centres, and those aged above 18, the possibility of working practices for 6 months in a European company. Participants must return from their mobilities before 12 months has passed since obtaining their degree. International internships are not part of the FCT  (training in work placement in Spain) but they will mean added value to the training in work placement previously done in companies in the province.Participants will take part in a linguistic training activity through the online tool "OLS" made available to the Programme for English, Italian and Dutch. For participants travelling to Portugal and Finland, a two-week intensive course in Portuguese or Finnish will be held on arrival, running concurrently with internships during the first two weeks of stay. The project also provides for the mobility of 5 teachers who have shown interest in job shadowing in an EU country. Staff mobility will last for 5 days for teachers going to Ireland, Italy, Germany and Malta, and 10 days for teachers going to Finland. The practices consist in visiting training centres similar to integrated vocational training centres in Galicia, in order to learn the teaching methods used in the destination country’s training.The Consortium is formed by: - The City Council - Integrated Vocational Training Centre A Granxa- Centre for Art and Design "Atlantic"- Training and Experimentation Centre Agroforestry Lourizan- Centre for Teacher Education Divine Vigo- CPR Daniel Castelao- A Cancela Association EFA- IES A Guide- IES Chan Do Monte- IES Chapela- IES Rodeira- IES Laxeiro- IES Framework Camballón- IES Pedra da Auga- IES Pintor Colmeiro- Multilingual IES A Paralaia- IES Ramón Cabanillas- IES Ramon Maria Aller Ulloa- IES Ricardo Mella- IES Salvaterra de Miño- IES Tomino- IES Vilalonga (Sanxenxo)- Galician Institute for Aquaculture Training (IGAFA)- IES Luis Seoane- IES Montecelo- CPR San Miguel- IES Polytechnic Vigo- IES A Xunqueira I- Multilingual IES Terra Turonio- Maritime Polytechnic Institute Pesqueiro do Atlantico in VigoDestination countries and distribution of grants will be organised as follows: United Kingdom (25), Ireland (20), Italy (30), Malta (10), Portugal (10), Finland (6) and the Netherlands (15). With regard to teachers, staff mobility will be held in Finland (1), Malta (1), Germany (1), Italy (1) and Ireland (1).The specific objectives of PRACTICUM DEPO 2016 are:- Accelerate the participants’ transition from education to the labour market.- Facilitating the acquisition of professional experience at international levels.- Increase knowledge and innovative entrepreneurship in the participants.- Encourage the practice and improvement of a second language and obtain technical vocabulary of the participant’s professional sector.- Foster synergies between education and labour.- Develop skills and knowledge to improve their competencies and skills for any job, project or situation.- Implement the concept of European citizenship and awareness of the importance of international mobility to create generations who are free and respectful of other cultures and societies.Similarly, youth and teachers consolidate new expertise in key skills in their speciality; they will achieve greater autonomy and a range of transferable skills that will benefit them in their work and personal future.Finally, it is important to add that PRACTICUM DEPO 2016 will generate staff who are more qualified, with integrity and, therefore, confident in their possibilities, promoting employment and contributing to the promotion and sustainability of the Erasmsus + programme.
Tehnologia SMART - Rol cheie pentru reusita profesionala si sociala a elevilor

Project Title: SMART Technology - key role for professional and social success of learnersParticipating organizations:1. National College "Costache Negruzzi" - Iasi, Romania2. Training Vision Ltd. - Portsmouth, United Kingdom3. Berlink - Berlin, GermanyBackground: The needs identified among learners:- The need for user training and skills development for using programs such as android, because in our school there is no option to develop this theme, but there are demands from learners and parents.- The need to correlate local entrepreneurs` social skills with the school offer .- Necessity of connection between theoretical instructive programming work performed in the virtual aspect of the concrete realization of program codes for smart devices;- The need to get acquainted with the working environment in the context of real work in IT companies, with activities in:           Infonetmedia (UK), Centre Adlershof (DE) GmbH (DE), Apple Store Berlin (DE) and LinguaTV (DE).- Facilitating the transition from school to working life: the domain of programming smart devices nowadays is closely linked with the business, and work environment of enterprises;- The need for socio-professional of values exchange, ethnic and cultural underpinning of a business relationship between the parties involved, through visits to universities, exhibitions, places, monuments, museums and theaters.The overall project aims to increase access to quality education for 28 high school students, through educational approaches aimed at developing competencies required by modern society and the educational process optimization using SMART technology.Specific objectives:1. Develop IT skills for 28 students through training in the development of software for smart devices, a specialized company for personal development and for improving employability in the labor market.2. Enchancing linguistic skills of the participants following this training course in UK / Germany, the language of communication being English and through direct interaction with the residents, to develop the skills required by modern society.3. The increase of the general knowledge of the participants through understanding the cultural of English / Germany, but also about the life and work of the countries visited.4. Developing institutional capacity to develop projects with grant funding, conclude national and international partnerships, improving management skills, to increase the prestige of the school.The target group consists of 28 learners from X grade, boys and girls, urban and rural, mathematics and computer science specialization, which will perform 60 hours of practice / laboratory in the development of software for smart devices.Their English language skills are minimal A2.Activities during the internship: development and implementation of applications using Android App programming for smart devices. In addition, they will perform:- visits to tourist objectives in Portsmouth, London and Winchester / Museumsisland and Bundestag respectively.Expected results of the training activity among learners are: -28 High school learners trained through educational approaches aimed at developing competencies required by modern society and the educational process optimization of using SMART technology;- 28 learners with knowledge and skills in programming development;- 28 learners who consolidated their language skills by participating in the training program in the UK / Germany;- 28 learners with a general knowledge greatly enhanced by knowledge, cultural understanding of English / Germany, but also about the life and work enviroment in this country;- 28 learners with increased chances of integration on the labor market.The impact will be multidimensional, on the development of organizational forms of training that are not possible without using traditional methods and means. Learning deed is no longer considered to be the effect of the actions of the teacher, but the result of the student's interactions with the leading learning.Project sustainability:The project includes operations and activities to ensure continuity, value, integrated approach of the results after finalization of the project and can be transferred locally and nationally. The project aims at a wide promotion of its results through extensive promotion activities directly through the applicant, the partners and participants.

Zawodowe rozdroża - korporacja a mały biznes, jak rozszerzyć wachlarz możliwości zawodowych wyborów.

Career crossroads – corporation or small business, how to branch out the gamut of professional  choices. This is the project developed by Zespół Szkół Elektrycznych nr 1 in close cooperation with Vitalis GmbH from Germany and Training Vision LTD from Great Britain.The beneficiares of the project are 62 the third-year  students of technical profiles: IT technician, electronics technician, electrical technician who will do a traineeship in Great Britain-England and in Germany. The mobility will last from 30th April to 27th May 2017.The main objectives of the project:- Comprehensive training of professional competences and key competences (linguistic, social and civic, cultural awareness) of 62 students from technical school in order to prepare graduates to apply for higher education and for the future  mobility and professional competition in the European Labour Market.- Improvement of quality and  atractiveness of vocational education and training.- Enhancement of international cooperation in the field of implementing the  good practice- Equalising the path to a career for students from less developed areas ( small, non-industrial towns and villages)The specific objectives of the project:- Completion of the compulsory, scheduled traineeship by 62 the  ZSE students,- Comparison of education systems in European countries,- To obtain qualifications and skills confirmed by certificates Europass, ECVET,- The best trainees will get the references from the companies,- Comparison and interpretation of performance of market economic system for medium and small businesses,- Improvement of the ability to co-operate  in an international group,- Development of mediation and negotiation skills, dealing with difficult situations,- Improvement of language skills especially in the language for specific  purposes areas,- Getting to know the culture of Great Britain and Germany,- Building up self-esteem of all beneficiares of the project.- Raising awareness of the possibility of creating  own career paths  as well as motivating beneficiares to constant personal growth.- Augmentation of job opportunities for ZSE graduates,The added value of the project will be:- Making international friends,- Promotion of the idea of doing traineeship abroad in the  Cracow area,- Encouraging  students of middle schools, including girls, to choose technical schools,- Promotion of our school in the city and the region, which results in the recruitment process.All the beneficiares will receive linguistic and cultural preparation. ZSE will take care of the youth during the training, training coordination, merit aid, language support, care during trips around Germany and Great Britain, organization of their free time, monitoring the course of traineeship and conduct the evaluation.The receiving organisations will organize receiving the group and 4-week practical training.  Execution of the cultural program concerning History and culture of Great Britain and Germany will improve general knowledge of the participants and can have positive influence on their attitude towards multicultural  society.The completion of the project will result in better career prospects for our students. All the beneficiares will improve core competencies  and professional skills. This experience will also ease their professional mobility in Poland, Europe and beyond, increase their competence in German and English for specific purposes, as well as more strategic and integrated  use of ICT at school and work. It can also influence the school  curriculum  and rise education market atractiveness of our school. The teachers who will go with students will be responsible for monitoring  the course of the traineeship. Final reports will help evaluate the project and plan other mobilities and strategic partnerships .

IES Alonso Pérez Díaz is a public secondary school located on the island of La Palma in the Canary Islands. Our position of double insularity along with the current economic crisis that is affecting Spain has lead to our people having to introduce this training and so increase their chance of employment. The project presented aims to give our students vocational training and the opportunity to undertake a stay outside of our country, which will enrich them, not just personally, but also on an academic level. Thus increasing their employment possibilities and the opportunity for them to forge a future career outside of our borders. Those students to whom this project is targeted are those of the health branch or more specifically the intermediate cycles of ‘Auxiliary Nursing Care’ and the  ‘Emergency Health Technician’ programmes. As health professionals they are subject to continuous training, avoiding their knowledge becoming stagnant and not progressing.Because of this we feel the need to opt for a project of this scale, which enriches the environment for our students with new technologies, techniques and innovations that are developed in other countries. The total number of students eligible for this offer is 16, split between both cycles. Amongst them we have 5 students from the Health Technician cycle and 8 students from the Auxiliary Nursing cycle who will develop part of their FCT during their stay. Along with 2 recent auxiliary nursing technician graduates and 1 health care technician graduate. The intended objectives are to strengthen the knowledge during the cycle, to learn about a new culture and language, to be more professionally competitive and finally acquire a job placement.Furthermore, the project aims to internationalise our faculty, offering 3 opportunities for teaching staff to ‘job-shadow’ in the health sector of foreign companies. We hope that this activity will increase the training of our staff since the objective is that the participating teachers learn and assimilate new professional techniques, and study how to apply them in our teaching. Taking into account our limited experience in such projects, the country chosen for the student to stay is Italy. For teaching staff we have chosen Italy, the United Kingdom and Germany. Our goal is to expand, in future announcements, our options to countries leading in the field of science such as those aforementioned. During the initial phase of the development of the stay, students and the recent graduates will have to also undertake the course provided on the OLS platform. a series of linguistic activities proposed by the Department of foreign languages of our Centre, with whom we will be co-ordinating for this purpose. On the other hand, we consider it necessary that prior to the completion of the foreign stay, students perform part of their FCT period in businesses on the island. With regards to monitoring the participants, we will establish an online exchange of information through email, Whatsapp and Skype between the tutors of the FTC at the receiving centre and those at the origin. As well as with the tutor responsible for monitoring the recent graduates and the co-ordination of European projects at our centre. It is expected that students complete their stay to the best of their ability and upon their return will fully share their experiences as well as those new techniques and new knowledge acquired during this period. In addition, the great autonomy that the student will acquire during their stay, being away from their family and being forced to communicate in a foreign language, is another value to take into account. With regards to staff training we hope to discover and understand new ways of working as well as new activities of teaching and learning which will be useful to apply to our centre. In terms of impact, we believe that this project will allow us to motivate all of those students on our island whom, for one reason or another, cannot picture their formal, higher level education completed, in such a way that they find our cycles to be motivating and rewarding with training that provides real working opportunities. For IES Alonso Pérez Díaz this initiative will be a big step forward in its internationalisation and in the improvement in the quality of its education.

"Future Career? Touch IT! " is a project that aims to facilitate the transition from school to work of young graduates specialising in mathematics-informatics with intensive English study from "Dimitrie Cantemir"  National College Onesti, making their insertion into the labour market, whether national or international, easier.The target group is represented by 20 students rigorously selected  from 11th grade students of mathematics -informatics with intensive English classes . Divided into two flows of 10 students each, they will participate in 3-week traineeships organized in July 2017 and  July 2018, respectively, in Portsmouth, UK . Since the majority of students will be travelling abroad for the first time, they will be accompanied by a specialized teacher who, besides being in charge with the coordination of the group, will be their element of stability in an environment completely new to them.By attending the traineeship, participants will not only improve their abilities, skills and practical knowledge in the field of their professional qualification (IT), but they will also acquire new skills in Android, an operating system which is not taught in Romanian schools . They will also practice and enrich language, cultural and social skills, becoming well-trained young  people able to perform in the field, representing the future human resource in IT companies or even willing to become future entrepreneurs in the field. Their digital competence will improve since the traineeship will offer access to new and updated knowledge in a market rapidly and continously changing. In addition, trainees will adapt more easily to the current requirements of  the economy  and they will find it easier to integrate into the national and international labour market.Given that approximately 40% of our pupils come from rural areas and for most of the selected pupils this mobility will be the first direct contact with the Western world, their involvement in project activities will provide them not only the opportunity to work within companies, but also to live for 3 weeks in a multicultural environment, developing the capacity to adapt to new environments. When returning home after the traineeship they will feel enriched not only professionally but also personally, they will feel more confident, proud to have represented our country in a multicultural environment. The rigour of all the actions provided within the framework of a European project, pupils' active participation, the sense of discipline, teamwork, organizational skills and completed activities, self-confidence, confidence in others, growing interest in human relationships are just a few examples of best practices acquired by the future employees in the labour market thanks to this traineeship in Europe.

The Integrated Vocational Training Centre “Reina Victoria Eugenia” is an academic centre with a wide range of training and vocational courses for students in the Autonomous Town of Melilla. With more than thirty years of experience, this is one of the reference centres in vocational and professional training courses for young students to get into professional careers. We’ve taken part in some former European programmes such as Leonardo da Vinci, Comenius and Grundtvig. Our centre has also a long experience organizing students and teachers mobility and we take part in every local or national project organized with this purpose. Moreover, our centre has got norm ISO 9001 AENOR certificate for Quality Management System in Education, which is revised annually.We pose a total of 14 learners’ mobility for academic year 2014/15 for students from different courses at Intermediate Level VET Cycles (Ciclos Formativos de Grado Medio): 4 from “Auxiliary Nursery Care” (“Cuidados Auxiliares de Enfermería”), 4 from “Assistance to People in Need of Care” (“Atención a Personas en Situación de Dependencia”), 4 from “Emergency Health Care” (“Emergencias Sanitarias”) 2 from "Business"(Actividades comerciales), 2 from "Electromechanical" (Electromecánica de vehículos) and 2 from “Electrical and Automatic Installations” (“Instalaciones eléctricas y automáticas”). In the hosting enterprises, students will develop activities related to their training programme in their “On the Job Training” part of the syllabus, following the model designed by their tutor teacher based on the National Syllabus.
