This model states not only the activities to develop but also the final capacities to acquire and the criteria to assess them.We expect this project will increase our learners’ motivation so that they won’t abandon their instruction, we also think it will provide higher expectancies for future learners and a positive point in the student’s Curriculum Vitae which will give him/her a better starting point  when applying for their first job. Taking into account nowadays economical problems, we will try to favour our students’ personal and professional qualifications. We also hope to improve the teaching of a foreign languageIn respect to the staff mobility , we pose 9 mobility that will promote the improvement of their qualifications so that it will have a positive impact in their teaching practice. Improving quality and teaching methodology.We think that the involvement of our teaching team and our students will work in the benefit of the whole teaching and learning community in our town and it will mark positively our learners’ professional training and eventually, it can result in higher economical perspectives for our town, Melilla.
Praktyki zagraniczne uczniów -  szansa na lepszą pracę w przyszłości.

Forty-two schoolgirls and schoolboys of Warcislaw IV Vocational School in Szczecinek will be participants of the project:-          24  students of the 2nd and the 3rd hairdresser classes, hospitality classes, catering business classes, logisticis classes and business and trade classes in 2017;-          18 students of the  2nd and 3rd class of hospitality ,  class of catering business and the 3rd hairdresser class and Logistics class in 2018 ;Essence of the project is students’ participation in vocational training in Portsmouth ( United Kingdom), Rmini ( Italy), Berlin (Germany) in companies of their specialty. The foreign partner of Warcislaw IV Vocational School is ETN GROUP with its three branches Training Vision in UK, Sistema Turismo in Italy and Berlink in Germany. Duration of apprenticeship is three weeks. Vocational training plan will be created on the base of educational programs, school work program and in cooperation with foreign partners. Our school has an obligation to create the best learning circumstances for students and the work placement abroad is manifestation of it. Foreign experience of our students will be very important on the labor market. What is more it is significant because half of our students come from rural area where unemployment level is higher  than average.The most important aims of the project:-          Participation in vocational training in companies in London;-          Increase of competitiveness of the participants on the labor market after finishing school;-          Improvement of quality of vocational education in Warcislaw IV Vocational School.Before the departure the participants will receive pedagogical and psychological support. Moreover they will be covered by language and multicultural preparation.  Transport, care of English-speaking patrons from the school, care of companies’ patrons, food ,accommodation and entertainment will be provided to the participants . Responsible for realization and managing of the project will be appointed persons both from the side of applicant and the side of partner. Activities will be realized according to schedule prepared in cooperation with the partner. The  participants, the partners and the school will evaluate the realization of the program from the beginning to its end with the use  of school diaries, reports and tests. Final written evaluation with conclusions for future will be prepared by the headmaster, the person managing of the project and representative of ADC Collage.The most important expected results:-          Increase of a level of lingual and professional competency;-          Increase of a level of interpersonal, intrapersonal and cultural competency;-          Better preparation of participants to enter the labor market;-          Improving of experience of Warcislaw IV Vocational School and ETN GROUP staffs’ in field of international cooperation;-          Improving of awareness of value of science and openness towards experiences among local society and students through dissemination of the results of the project. Potential long-term benefits:-          Increase students’ professional mobility;-          Businessmen will receive better qualified and experienced employees in services connected to tourism;-          Promotion of use of EU-programs among the local society, schools, teachers and students;-          Promotion of Polish culture and education abroad.
Małe miasto w wielkim świecie- staże zagraniczne uczniów z kartuskiego Wzgórza.

The beneficiaries of the project are 60 students of Complex of Vocational and Grammar Schools in Kartuzy.After fulfilling their recruitment duties they will leave for  two weeks apprenticeship organized by  international partners of our school: Tellus in England,  Lycée Professionnel  Jean Capelle in Bergerac, France and Future Focus in Malta.The choice of partners is based on our earlier, greatly positive experience, related to the realization of international projects and the recommendation of other Polish school. We have already got the letters of intent from these  institutions.Group A are 8 students of the third year of Technical School of Commerce who will leave for their apprenticeship in September and October  2017, to Bergerac, in France, together with 4 students of the third year of Vocational School of Commerce.Group B are 16 students of the third year of Technical School of Information Technology who are going to Plymouth in UK in October 2017 with two teachers. Group C are 16 students of Technical School of Economy and Group D are 16 students  of Technical School of Advertisement. Group C and D  will leave  for apprenticeship to Malta  in March 2018 and in April 2018,  with two teachers for each group. At the same time their classmates will attend apprenticeship in Kartuzy. The time of the apprenticeship is determined by education cycle in our school. The monitoring visits of  the coordinator of the project and the headmaster of the school have also been planned.Apart from doing their apprenticeship, each group will create their own websites ( in English and Polish). All groups together will create  on-line  shop ( including regional products of each country) and catalogue of the products. The shop on-line will be the perfect tool to be used while learning vocational subjects. It can be used during different educational classes at school and outside. The programmes of apprenticeship were prepared by the teachers of our school and are compatible with the school curriculum and the programme of teaching. Each participant will get a certificate of attendance  and Europass Mobility certificate ( in Polish and English). These documents not only confirm participants'  vocational skills and experience gained, but they can also allow students  to obtain a  job, not only on local but also European market. Our previous experience shows, that leaving for the apprenticeship, influences the students in a positive way. It also develops the great cooperation between involved institutions on the local and international market.
Prácticas en Europa Erasmus +, fp grado medio, FCT y titulados.

We are requesting 10 mobilities for students and graduates of  IVT training degrees  involved in the families of administration, and electricity  of our institutions , they will complete their FCT period or they will do an internships as graduates in companies of UK, France,Italy and Malta.At the same time we are requesting for 6 mobilities for staff, five of them for teachers and the sixth for a concierge.  MOBILITIES QUALITY :  Always there will be only one participant in each company except in the case of students in the electricity companies, they have enough workload and the tutor 's ability to accommodate two students.  We have enough partners host  to ensure maximum utilization and improve the integration of the participant in the company and the destination city and to deal with any unforeseen change   that may arise.We have the experience and infrastructure necessary based on experience from previous years in different European programs to carry out this project , facing any unforeseen problems that might arise during  his development.  Applicant Organization : Public IES Alonso de Avellaneda of Alcalá de Henares will manage all aspects of project completely autonomously .  Host partners in the UK ( 8) , France (2 ), Italy ( 2) and Malta(1)  NEEDS : - Improving training for IVT trainees with the completion of the FCT in European companies.- Increase the employability of these students and graduates of these degrees.- To enable participants to learn to work in a European business environment.- Expand their business horizons , self-sufficiency and ability to work in an international team .- Improve their professional and linguistic skills.OBJECTIVES :- Increase the possibility of  mobility of  IVT students.- Raising the quality of the FCT .- Improving the employability of these students and recent graduates .- Learn new techniques used by European companies in each of the specialties.- To facilitate this learning experience to people who otherwise would have no chance , promoting equal opportunities for different types of students.- Increasing the prestige of the IVT and interest of the general population in order to follow these studies.- Promote the use of  IT's in IVT and teaching "on line"- Encourage the use of our virtual platform through internet based Moodle "Prácticas en Europa Erasmus +, fp grado medio FCT y titulados"- Expand our network of companies and partners  RESULTS : Increasing interest in studying an IVT degree ,learning languages in order to do  FCT's in another country, or doing an internship  as graduates, increasing their motivation , improving the social image of the IVT  WHERE : Participants will do the internship in companies in the UK, France, Italy and Malta.  WHEN:- 72 days  over the regular period of the FCT's : From March to May 2017 for the trainees of Administration, and Electricity degrees.-To the graduates will also be 72 days , the dates between July and September of 2016 or between October and December of 2016 depending on the possibilities of available dates for the graduates.We ask for five training mobilities of staff, five of them for UK , they will be prepared and planned carefully with the help of our partners to make them as profitable as possible, for IVT teachers into the  IT ,administration degrees and the matter of labor training and guidance(FOL). We expect that these training visits allow to the teachers  learn about processes and activities carried out in European companies and that can be incorporated into teaching for our students, this will  improve their acquired knowledge and skills. The diffusion of personal mobility activities will contribute further to give our most prestigious institution and attractive to students interested in studying IVT in our school.Relating to the concierge's mobility , their will carry out it in a French Lyceum, doing  different tasks with the concierges of the institution, learning about working methods, new tecnologies, etc.The staff mobilities will be carried out over the spring, probably a week in April or May of 2017, depending on the posibililties of the hosting companies where we will complete the job shadowing.

The project "Staże zwodowe uczniów ZSEU" is realized by the Zespół Szkół Ekonomiczno-Usługowych in Świętochłowice in cooperation with VITALIS Betreuungsgesellschaft für Modellprojekte mbH Schkeuditz and Training Company Vision Ltd of Portsmouth.Within the project we want to increase the professional qualifications and language learners and support the mobility of project participants in the European labor market. In addition, we want to know the vocational training system operating in Germany and the UK.The main objectives of the project are conditional upon the needs of the participants. Foreign practice is to:- To prepare students for professional work,- To increase the employability of students in the future,- To prepare students for smooth functioning in the modern world.That is why the emphasis in the project has been on the acquisition and improvement of skills possessed by them - general and professional competence.Implementation of the objectives of the project is best to prepare students to enter the labor market because become aware:- What they learn at school, what beyond,- What are the requirements of the labor market,- They have or need to acquire competencies in the future,- How to effectively plan their a professional career.The answers to these questions and the evaluation of the proposed methodological changes in the implementation of apprenticeships will be expected by us results of the project.The project will bring together students:1. technical - in the profession techniques informatics (14 persons) and techniques economist (6)2. The basic vocational school - the following professions: cook (8 people), the seller (4 people), car mechanic (4 persons), electrician (6 people), hairdresser (6 people).We planned 4 mobility of students (2 to the UK and two in Germany).As part of the practices of foreign students:- Raise skills in English / German,- Raise their professional qualifications,- Learn the foreign job market and employers' requirements.- Develop the ability to work in a group,- Increase intercultural awareness.Implementation of the project will improve the image of the school in the local community. Promoting the results of the project we want to mobilize students to learn in schools leading to professional qualifications.A few weeks apprenticeships will also be a good opportunity to encourage participants to assess for themselves their skills (competencies).
Staż zagraniczny na miarę ucznia Technikum w Polkowicach

Project „ Staż zagraniczny na miarę ucznia Technikum w Polkowicach” is meant for students of a Secondary Technical School in Polkowice /Technikum Zespołu Szkół im. Narodów Zjednoczonej Europy w Polkowicach/. The youth who will participate in the project are educated in the following professions IT technician, hotel industry, advertising and accounting staff. The participants will do a four week practice in the UK at selected employers pointed by the English partner of the project which is Training Vision. Training Vision company  through its ongoing activity proves involvement in mobility, cross-cultural dialogue as well as creativity aimed at offering better job opportunities and apprenticeship in the area of Portsmouth. Training Vision company is involved in numerous UE projects, professional education and partnership projects focused on improving motivation and competence. All this is based on international experience of this company. All the services Training Vision offers match the participants’ needs. The process of finding the employer includes consideration of a participant’s CV, experience and the target language competence. The main objectives of the project are improving professional competence, gaining experience at the European level other than that offered in Poland based companies. Another objective is to improve language competence in both the casual and professional English. Moreover the practice prepares students for active life in the contemporary world by increasing student’s autonomy and resourcefulness. It can be noted that students take on greater responsibility for planning their own educational path and the future career after completing the traineeship. The participants become more competitive in the local, domestic as well as European labour market.The participants of the project will be given a certificate of the traineeship and a Europass-Mobility document confirming gained competence in terms of professional skills, language as well as personal and interpersonal skills.
Aktywni i Skuteczni w Europie wolnej od uprzedzeń

"The active and effective in Europe free from prejudice"is a project carried out  by the School of Economics in Poznan, and it is a part of a series of projects entitled "Active and effective" planned for the years 2015-2020.Project assumptions are compatible with community, national and regional legislation, and its objectives correspond with the Europe 2020 Strategy and horizontal guidelines for the years 2014-2020. The project also refers to the European School Development Plant, which assumes, among other things, the creation of conditions for students to actively participate in the European labor market in an intercultural society. There is also an identified, real need to strengthen the professional profile of students from the Complex of Schools of Economics to experience working abroad and its confirmation by a relevant certificate (Europass Mobility). The project is targeted at forty third grade students learning in the following occupations: economic technician, information technology technician, tourist service technician, and advertisement organization technician. Participants will, apart from having very good results in science, be characterized by an impeccable behaviour, creativity, openness, motivation to travel and enthusiasm for teamwork.On 02.07.2017 – 22.07.2017 students will leave for a three-week training period. Among the current second grade students learning to become information technology technicians and tourist service technicians 20 students will be selected who will participate in a training in Spoleto, Italy. The training shall be co-organized by the former partner of the school – Azzurra. Among the current second grade students learning to become advertisement organization technicians and economic technicians 20 students will be selected who will participate in a training in Portsmouth, UK, organized in cooperation with a newly acquired partner – Training Vision, which joins the project group.The applicant, through proposed linguistic, cultural and educational support before the trip, will provide comprehensive preparation of the participants to take part in international internships. During internships, the students will keep on co-creating a blog and post pictures on Instagram. Thanks to these modern and youth-familiar mass media, the idea of European internships within the Erasmus+ program will reach a large number of young people. During the stays in Italy and the UK the participants will also work on a task entitled "Young immigrants start working", and its results will be published in a booklet. It will also include reports on the stay, guidance for future participants, interesting memories, a collection of professional vocabulary, etc.The implementation of the project will provide participants with the opportunity to learn new practical skills and professional competence, linguistic and social abilities.The methodology used for the implementation of the project is a combination of theory, practical exercises and tasks previously prepared to be performed. These activities will be supported by a mentor acting on behalf of receiving and sending organization, and include: discussions, games, consultations, creative tasks, tests, teamwork, role play and video projections. Independent work on own portfolio and individual presentation will improve self-esteem of the participants.The experience gained in Italy and the UK will make people realize that mobility, initiative, entrepreneurship and innovation are the keys to succeed professionally. Creativity understood in this way will make students have a better chance to successfully enter the European labour market, as well as meet the requirements of Polish employers waiting for young workers to have experience in the intercultural work environment abroad. Due to the increasing globalization and the situation in the world, knowing English is not only important but what is also important is familiarity with other, not just European cultures. That and the knowledge of people and their traditions help to eradicate prejudice against people of other backgrounds.We expect that the project will result in personal development of participants who, through joint work on project tasks, will strengthen and develop the ability to come up with an alternate and peaceful solutions to conflicts, and will become more open to other cultures, which is very important in the era of recent events in Europe.
Zawody przyszłości: technik budownictwa, technik i mechanik pojazdów samochodowych, ślusarz oraz technik logistyki.

The project realizes the Erasmus priorities and objectives. The project’s objective is to improve and increase the students’ practical skills in the scope of the professions of a construction technician, a motor vehicle technician/car mechanic, a logistics technician and a locksmith. Increasing student mobility aims at improving their prospective attractiveness on the labor market as well as improving their English language skills. It also aims at their personal growth through developing the habit of continuous in-service training, acquiring new competencies, enhancing self-confidence, getting to know the rules of work organization, planning further professional development, getting to know the culture and customs of partner countries. The project is to develop “the habit of working” in the students and enables them to get more independence and self-reliance. Another crucial thing is emotional development: coping with stress, reducing prejudice, enhancing motivation as well as increasing key competencies: team work, project work, self-reliance, responsibility, creativity, assertiveness and the English language abilities within the scope of technical terminology. The training courses will help those, who are at the beginning of their careers to get competitive advantage on the labor market. A well-educated construction technician, motor vehicle technician/car mechanic, logistics technician and locksmith will contribute to our national economy as its human and intellectual capital. Learning through practice is a way of increasing personal potential as well as developing professional identity, which in turn strengthens the participants’ self-esteem. This is the mobility project of 10 groups of students (10 students in each group). The participants are 20 construction technicians of the Construction School, 40 motor vehicle technicians and car mechanics, 20 logistics technicians and 20 locksmiths of CKZiU (the Professional and Constant Training Center). Main operations take place in Spain, England, Italy and Germany – each mobility for the period of 2 weeks. The training courses will be scheduled from Monday through Friday, from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. Saturday and Sunday have the cultural agenda. The training courses will be organized in cooperation with the Spanish host Europroyectos LdV in Grenada for construction technicians, the English host Training Vision Ltd in Portsmouth for motor vehicle technicians and car mechanics, the Italian host Sistema Turismo s.r.l. in Rimini for logistics technicians and with the German host Berlink ETN GmbH in Berlin for locksmiths.The construction technicians will learn innovative techniques in the mason-plasterer profession with the added value of working in the historic buildings. The additional value will be the opportunity to become familiar with the culture and customs of southern Spain. The motor vehicle technicians and the car mechanics will develop their practical skills within the scope of car repairs as well as assembling and dismantling. The additional value will be the opportunity to speak high level technical English talking to native English speakers. The logistics technicians will familiarize themselves with the organization and supervision of storage processes. They will also have the opportunity to get to know the culture of the cradle of European civilization. The locksmiths will perfect their skills at working all kind of metal parts. As the project method will be employed, the students will have the opportunity to use various ways of metalworking: machining, heat treatment, turning, milling.  The stay in Berlin will give them access to high quality training.Other expected outcomes include the participation in the project of the disabled as well as of people in difficult socio-economic conditions; higher qualifications (FN certificate, Europroyectos/Berlink /Sistema /Training as well as Europass Mobility and Skills Portfolio certificates), new employment perspectives both in Poland and in EU, getting to know vocational education standards and the practical solutions applied in Spanish, German, English and Italian companies and institutions; increasing awareness of further education, enhancing professional passion; increasing cross-cultural awareness and social skills, personal development and self-confidence.The emphasis is on meeting learning needs and getting to know the innovative methods and strategies. A training course abroad will stimulate development of social and entrepreneurial skills. The contemporary youth is in need of developing the awareness of the value of work; of acting according to social rules;  foreign language knowledge (especially the specialist language of a particular profession). Active participation in the project will enable the participants to gain more awareness of the international environment. The project will certainly enhance correlation between education and business.

The Project "Staż zagraniczny szansą na sukces" ("Training abroad - a chance to success") is aimed at students of second and third form in Zespół Szkół Informatycznych in Kielce. Students come from classes of an IT technician profile. We are planning to send two groups of students to Portsmouth in Great Britain. There will be 16 students in each group and 2 accompanying teachers. Students are to go to Portsmouth in the following dates: 4.06.2017 r. - 17.06.2017 r. and 1.10.2017 r. - 14.10.2017 r. They will gain their work experience in companies related to IT industry. Training Vision company is our partner in the Project. It has an extensive experience in organising work placements within European projects. The main goal of our Project is to enhance our students' motivation to learning, to improve their vocational qualifications, to improve their language skills and to increase their chances in the domestic labour market and in the external one. Thanks to the internship our students know a new vocational environment and organisation of work in another country. They will be encouraged to openness, cooperation and mobility. Our students will be able to use their theoretical knowledge in practice. Achieving adapt skills, sensibilising to mental and cultural differences and personal development are the next aims which are possible to gain with this Project.  Our students are to take different actions to document their apprenticeship: they are going to write about their experience on the blog, take pictures in their work placements, prepare a presentation on how to interview the client who wants to give the computer to be repaired, give hints for typical troubleshooting on the web page. Obtaining Certificates provided by the School and our partner company and Europass Mobility document will be a confirmation of acquiring proper skills and qualifications by our students. The Project is important as it will also raise our students' awareness of being a European, it will contribute to enriching  their personal experience of benefitting from belonging to the European Union. Thanks to the Project the quality and the educational offer of our school will be more attractive and competitive on the local and regional  educational market. The Project "Staż zagraniczny szansą na sukces" ("Training abroad - a chance to success") uses and develops our experience within international cooperation.

EUROCIP VII aims to provide, by conducting internships in European companies, a transnational perspective to Initial Professional Qualification Programmes (PCPI), to improve the professional, personal and social skills of young participants in favour of their social, educational and employment insertion. More specifically, it pursues the general goal of increasing choice and quality of future employment of students PCPI, broadening their outlook, reinforcing their professional profile and promoting adaptation to the particularities of different European labour markets.This objective is particularly relevant for students of PCPIs, composed mostly of young people at risk of training, cultural and social exclusion, in need of specific measures to learn, with frequent negative attitude to learning and low self-esteem. Consequently, their needs include both the development of their abilities to learn and do, as their personal growth (self-esteem, self-awareness, accountability, acquisition of social values), the acquisition of patterns of coexistence, or the assumption of habits of responsible citizenship and autonomy.Based on the identified needs, the project EUROCIP VII has the following specific objectives, through mobility actions planned (30-day stay + 2 days for travelling), to accomplish internships in companies in sectors related to the module enrolled under the supervision of a tutor accompanying person). - Strengthen their communication skills in a foreign language. - To promote personal, social and cultural enrichment - To supplement their competence profile and training. - Assume and apply the principle of equality and diversity in all areas of life.- Increase their chances of employment.The mobility actions will be reinforced with language training both before and during the stay (online).EUROCIP Consortium members, BILBAO EKINTZA, ESCUELA PROFESIONAL OTXARKOAGA, FUNDACIÓN ADSIS and PEÑASCAL, manage since 2012 Professional Qualification Programmes (PCPI). CDJ MAXIMILIANSAU, has collaborated with the Basque Government as intermediary partner in Germany, under the programme Ida of the ESF as well as in Eurocip.AKADEMIE ÜBERLINGEN, intermediary partner in Germany, has worked in the last 3 editions of the project.LANGUAGE SOLUTIONS LTD., intermediary partner in UK, has worked in every edition of the project.ALMAR, intermediary partner in Poland, has collaborated in other mobility programmes promoted by the Consortium.The target group consists of 24 young residents at Bizkaia, with the following profile:- PCPI students that are completing modules "Kitchen services", "Pastry/Bakery", "Maintenance of microcomputer equipment" “Hairdressing”, "Graphic Arts" and “Mechanics".- Aged between 17 and 21 years.- With basic knowledge of English language.- Have not reached the minimum objectives of formal education.- People without work experience or work experience in informal economy.The target group 2 consists of 4 people trainers and/or tutors of the PCPI modules contractually linked to the sending partners, familiar with the members of target group, whom they will accompany during the entire stay.The expected outcomes for the target group , students PCPI , include the development of skills of personal autonomy and identity (self-esteem booster , abilities and skills, improved academic and professional liability), coexistence and respect (respecting differences , resolve relational conflicts, exercise their rights and duties within the framework of respect and the rules in social and cultural context, organized leisure time healthy and non-consumptive), and learn to know and do (develop work habits, experience sense of social and labour autonomy).Meanwhile, accompanying tutors acquire through their participation in the programme knowledge and criteria for incorporating the dimension of mobility in the itineraries of orientation and training as well as contacts to articulate a network of permanent cooperation for the realization of mobility actions.The dissemination strategy aims to raise awareness about the importance and the potential mobility, specifically the program Erasmus +, offers people who enter their first job, in general, and students PCPI in particular, and to disseminate the results the project.The project will be assessed formatively, by monitoring the work process, which will ensure the achievement of objectives. Summative evaluation will be also performed based on the achievement of the expected results, in order to measure the effectiveness and efficiency of the project.

‘Copernicus students’ foreign internships’  is the title of the project carried out by Copernicus Secondary School of Economics in Kielce with co-operation with foreign companies: Berlink ETN GmbH from Germany, Polaris EU Enterprise Limited and Training Vision from Great Britain.The main aim of the project is increasing the level of professional and linguistic competence by allowing students to use and broaden the knowledge and professional skills acquired during vocational subject lessons at school and practiced during vocational training periods abroad.The implementation of the project will prepare the students for mobility at the European education and job markets. It will also give them more job opportunities and enable them to function in the multicultural environment. The project will also make them aware of the need of the constant developmentof their qualifications which is in accordance with the life-long learning concept.The project relates to the constant need of quality development and learning effectiveness regarding school as an institution offering educational services.64 students majoring in economics technician, advertising technician and merchandising technician will take part in the project.The project aims at organizing 3-week internships in Berlin, Germany, Stafford, London and Portsmouth in Great Britain. The students will be able to gain professional experience in companies related to their major. The internship is divided into two modules: workshops “Merchandising” for the merchandising technician, “Advertising in an informative society” for the advertising technician and “British IT accountancy” for the economics technician and vocational training period in a foreign company. The students will also participate in a 100-hour pedagogical and cultural and linguistic course. They will receive certificates which will confirm the acquired skills, such as Europass Mobility Europass CU – documents which are an important pass to the European job market.
Aktywni i kompetentni - praktyka zagraniczna drogą na rynek pracy.

Data published by Central Statistical Office (GUS) shows that in the counties where students of Zespół Szkół Ekonomicznych (Group of Economics Schools) live, the unemployment rate is twice as high as in the nearby TriCity (Gdańsk, Sopot, Gdynia). Considerable number of ZSE students come from small towns and villages where it will be difficult to find employment after graduation. The school’s aim to enhance the chances for employment of future graduates fits in well with the guidelines placed in Strategies of Development of Pomeranian Province 2020 (Strategia Rozwoju Województwa Pomorskiego 2020). (Operational object 2.1 High level of employment, direction of action 2.1.3 Improvement of tertiary vocational education and lifelong learning. of the methods of improving the level of the offered education is to provide students with high quality work experience. Therefore, ZSE has again prepared the project whose aim is, among other things, to organise high quality foreign work placements for the students. Project Active and competent – foreign work experience as a way to the job market aims to enrich students’ practical skills and experience, which consequently not only will improve their position at the local, regional and even European job market but also will enable them to answer the needs of employers.The project involves 36 students of ZSE learning the following professions: technician of hotel industry (18 students from 3rd grade), commerce technician (9 students from grades 2-4) and the advertising organisation technician (9 students from grades 2-4). Participation in the project will be granted to the students who successfully fulfil the recruitment process based on objective criteria linked with educational achievements, level of English and their social and financial situation. Each participant will take part in the 40-hour preparatory course including language, cultural and pedagogical workshops. The next stage of the project will be the work experience in Great Britain. ZSE’s partner will be Training Vision Ltd based in Portsmouth, Hampshire County. The following mobilities are planned: group 1 –  18 students of hotel industry class will have 4-week work experience organised as a part of the school obligatory curriculum in the spring 2017, group 2 – in August/September 2017, 18 students from grades 2-4 of commerce (9 students) and advertising organisation (9 students) classes will have extra-curricular 3-week work experience in August/September 2017. During their work experience students will have opportunity to improve their vocational competences and to learn European standards of organisation and functioning of companies. Another advantage of this work experience will be development of English language skills in the natural environment and expanding specialist vocabulary. Work experience in Portsmouth will also serve the opportunity to learn about the culture and history of this region and Great Britain because in their spare time students will take part in tourist and cultural activities.The implementation and all activities within the project will be subject to on-going monitoring by both partners. Monitoring will be conducted using various tools, such as surveys, questionnaires, individual interviews. Gathered data will be used for evaluation of the project.After the completion of the work experience, the beneficiaries will share their experience and present their newly acquired skills to the students and teachers from our school. The multimedia presentation documenting the course of work experience will be prepared and presented to local community, including the representatives of local authorities and business. Final reports will document the work experience and enable the formal assessment (grading) and they will also be used in evaluation of the curriculum. Europass Mobility document will serve as a formal confirmation of acquired skills and competences.The participants' experience of the foreign work experience will positively affect their ability to adapt to new situations, work in a team and improve their communication skills. The result of the participation in the project will be the improvement of language competence both in communication and specialist vocabulary, acquisition of new vocational skills and development of social and intercultural competences. Owing to the participation in the project the beneficiaries  will establish international contacts, their motivation to lifelong learning will increase,  their initiative and entrepreneurship will be stimulated. In the long term, the participation in the project may help students succeed professionally not only on the local but also national and international job market. This way, future employers gain specialists who are not only able to share their knowledge and experience but also are able to boost their own capacity as well as the capacity of the company they work for.
Dziś Stażysta, Jutro Specjalista. Program rozwojowy i rozwój kompetencjikluczowych uczniów leszczyńskich szkół ponadgimnazjalnych.

The changing economic reality creates an urgent need to prepare young people for the difficult role of participant modern market economy. The realities of Leszno subregion are not very favorable for theyouth when it comes to their integration with the labor market. The percentage of young people from the NEET group, percentage of young people studying to become professionals or are unable to find work for the sake of lack of experience, or choose the directions which the market is already saturated. Young people are discouraged. They can not connect theoretical knowledge with practice in a meaningful manner. Reality of employers of Leszno are such that in the sub-region, there is indeed a large number of enterprises, but they are small and micro-enterprises, whichare not prepared in no way to take on trainees. Little for this they are not well informed. On the other hand, formal educational institutions in Leszno are seeing a good chance for their pupils in mobility projects for them to intergrate with the labour market faster and in more effective way. Schools are ready and willing to participate in mobility projects of vocational learning. Those conditions have made the the applicant wrote this project. The project envisages sending 30 people, divided into three flows (those will be divided into two groups, according to the direction of Education) to three European countries to undergo internships of 21 days duration. Two tours will be held on 16/01 / 17-05 / 02/17 and the third on 01/05 / 17-21 / 05/17.Participants will be improving their qualifications in following professions: shipper-logistics and IT technician. They will carry out 120 hours internship in companies that are selected by the project partners, and with whom they have a good experience of cooperation. The project will contribute not only to improve the occupational skills and the key competences of participants. Its dissemination will also increase the level of information on vocational education among schools, the level of information on mobility projects among students who did not take a direct part in the project and will strengthen the sense European citizenship. The participants will be students of vocational education schools of Leszno and in their recruitment staff of those institutions will also take part. The participants will receive the necessary support in the form of language, cultural and informational training. The main objective of the project is to improve vocational training and indicate students the benefits and necessity of lifelong learning. Implementation of the project will improve the educational dimension of the activities of the applicant and will foster public - private contacts (schools and companies). The project will make the offer of institucions of formal education more attractive. Project participants receive a certificate of Europass Mobility, language certificates and certificates confirming the realization of Practice prepared by the host organizations and employers. Also ECVET evaluation systems will be implemented. Participation in the project will increase awareness of the need for continuous self improvement. In their free time, participants will have opportunity to learn about the culture and traditions of the country partner. A trip abroad for an internship is able to increase the self-esteem of participants, it will show  new opportunities and give a chance to break the stereotypes of thinking, concerning the lack of job prospects. The benefits of the project will refer also our city and region. Professional labs in our city are often not retrofitted, quality of professional duties in education is therefore at a very low level. Theoretical knowledge will be connected with practical application.  This will increase the level of awareness about the validity of learning a foreign language and its usefulness as a tool of labor market integration. .   The project will increase the number of people participating in mobility projects; will develop cooperation between vocational training institutions in Europe. Experience gained from the traineeships will be used by students and included in school curricula Practices. Mobility will be for trainees and their classmates, colleagues an excellent encouragement for continue learning foreign languages During their stay, students will have organized meetings to exchange experience and integration with the international environment. All institutions have extensive experience in organizing internships enabling students to acquire valuable work experience by organizing training programs for students, teachers, staff and scientific staff, provide an opportunity to gain professional experience and learn about the traditions and culture of their country. The project will strengthen the participants  in such a manner that with greater confidence they will enter the labor market without fear of self-employment or departure  abroad for profit-making purposes.
LogIT - algorym na lepszą przyszłość. Staże zagraniczne dla uczniówtechnikum logistycznego i informatycznego przy Zespole Szkół im. W.Szybińskiego w Cieszynie

ICT and transportation are dynamically developing branches of our social, professional and business lives. Students would like to appear in their professional lives in a competent way, work as ICT specialists or transport engineers. Szybinski High School enables students to gain theoretical knowledge in the field of their future profession, however, essential issue nowadays is the experience and practical training. Labour market competition is active and one need to defend their position being at secondary school, for sure. This is the reason why we would like to equip graduates with new, attractive skills, knowledge, experience and thus open doors to their future carreer. This can be done by organizing training abroad in companies with huge experience and opportunities of leading efficient practice. The following project involves students form 2nd and/or 3rd grades of ICT and Logistic Technical College, tutor-teachers at the place of apprentice, vocational subjects teachers, geography and history teachers, English and German teachers, educators, form-masters. 74 students and 10 tutor-teachers are going to take part in the mobilities, 5 groups of participants are intended during the 2year-project. Before each mobility, all students will be provided with additional training and support (language, cultur and pedagogic). Regular vocational education involves practical training in a Polish company, however, we would like to supplement it with international work experience. Our students will have the opportunity to improve their skills in computer graphics (animation, 3D), multimedia event organizationa, network management, data base management, e-commerce, shipping, storage, distribution, logistic process. The foreign partners offer dynamic and creative teams of specialists who specialize in advertising, marketing, producing advertising materials, organizing national and international transportation of goods, cultural and social activities. The students will be able to learn innovative working methods, equipment and softare which cannot be observed or tested at school. Hosting companies are experienced so the knowledged and skills taught are thorough and reliable. What is more, the companies work with apprentices in a regular manner, so their pedagogic and mentorial experience will influency the quality of students’ practical training highly. The goals and results of the project are:improving theoretical knowledgedeveloping practical skills and professional qualificationsexperiencing foreign company acting in the international marketaccessibility of newest ICT and technological advances, software, equipmentcreating logistic thinking and work planningexperiencing foreign work standardsincreasing students’ mobilitydeveloping language competencecreating open and tolerant attitude towards new culture and customsdeveloping skills in dealing with new professional circumstances, addapting to new environmentdisseminating the idea of international projectsimproving students’ labour market competencelonglasting cooperation with foreign companiescreating and supporting of innovative methods of teaching and learningsupporting education developmentThe practical training will take place in United Kingdom and Germany, where students will be supported and monitored by partner institution tutor and host company tutor. Pre- and post-mobility actions (psychological support, extra language classes, informative actions, organizing actions, evaluation and dissemination) will be organized according to a schedule set by managing staff, and partner cooperation will focus on organizing and training issues (organizing, supporting and monitoring training places, accommodation and nutrition). Mutual and efficient communication, which will use planty of methods and tools (web page, facebook, google docs, emails, skype, face2face meetings) will ensure high quality of management process and proper, effective realisation of all intended actions and goals set. Experience, knowledge, skills and formal certificates gained (Europass Mobility, confirmation of practical training, preparation to mobility) are the results which concern all actors of the project: students, teachers involved, partner institutions. Highly qualified staff, with high standards set and knowledge gained, influence directly and indirectly school and local development. This will bring longlasting benefits - mobility, openness, international cooperation, self development, institutional development.

A group of 90 students, who will be the students of Zespół Szkół Nr 3 w Łukowie in 2016/2017 and 2017/2018, and their  6 teachers are going to participate in the project. Taking into consideration the needs of both students and employers concerning developing skills, vocational qualification and improving language skills, intercultural, personal and social competence they will take part in four-week-long internships in international companies with advanced logistic, gastronomic and economic processing in Portsmouth in Great Britain. The choice of country and place of apprenticeship is made according to high job market standards and poor students’ professional experience.The main purpose of the project is improving the quality of vocational training through gaining knowledge and skills by 90 students studying in the field of gastronomy, logistics and economy in Zespół Szkół Nr 3 w Łukowie.The detailed aims are:-familiarize with functioning of modern European technologically advanced companies-using the acquired school knowledge, develop skills and competencies in new surroundings-improving cooperation skills in professional international team-developing the feeling of responsibility for the quality of work and for the organization of performed tasks in particular apprenticeship places-introducing the appropriate documentation used the firms in the field of gastronomy, logistics and economy-improving self-confidence through working in international environment, breaking professional language barriers and cultural differences-cross-cultural competences-personal development-multimedia presentations connected to the students’ occupations -electronic form of Vocational English dictionary with professional termsThe schedule of the apprenticeship is confirmed by trade employers, intermediary organization Traning Vision and is consistent  with the school apprentice schedule. The selected partner has held a lot of mobility projects and has cooperated with partners all over Europe. Traning Vision chose the places of students’ apprenticeship so that the project’s aims are fully accomplished. The activity schedule was appropriately prepared and the tasks were allotted project partners. Implementation of the project will contribute to increase students’ professional and linguistic competences. It will enable to notice how to work  in practice and gain experience in international environment. It will allow to introduce new technologies and devices and programs used  in large companies. The position of the school will improve through increasing potential students appeal. British partner will improve the ability of apprenticeship implementation.
Z Europą po sukces w zawodzie.

The project "With Europe for success in the profession" was created to acquire and improve professional knowledge and skills for students in the engineering professions: logistics, electrical, mechatronics and implementation of recordings and sound systems. Apart from the aspect of the professional skills improvement, the project also aims to build and develop key competencies of young students which include such skills as communication, assertiveness, creativity, resistance to stress, leadership, ability to cooperate with other people and to work independently and manage time. The impact of these competencies on the quality of work of the team is huge. It is true that vocational skills and theoretical knowledge - purely technical, specific to the profession, is often insufficient in the era of highly specialized technical personnel in companies. Therefore, the elements called emotional intelligence, which undoubtedly make up the so-called soft skills often perform as important role as the substantive knowledge. Therefore, it seems important to emphasise to these two spheres of development of the students during the month-long internships in Portsmouth on the south coast of England, in San Salvo on the east coast of the Adriatic Sea in Italy and Foligno in the Italian region of Umbria. There will be eight 10-and 6-person groups going in spring - autumn interval. In total in two years in eight groups there will leave 56 students. Each group will be accompanied by a teacher and a tutor from the partner institution. The foreign partner from England - Training Vision provides adequate placements according to the profile of our students. There will be companies like Mr Pine & Sons, the British Heart Foundation-Electrical and Furniture, Direct Carpet Centre, InfonetMedia, SEEKIT, Spinnaker Waste, Sue Ryder, Homebase and Oden Service. The Italian partners will ensure the internships in such companies as Traspec - Logistica e Trasporti (logisticians), Cultural Association Viaindustriae, SpazioZut, Calderini Music Service, SD-SERVICE , EasyEvent or Kino View (recording and sound technicians).The assessment of the acquired skills will be determined by ECVET Skills Portfolio document, based on which students will receive certificates of ECVET. In addition to these certifications trainees will receive certificates of completion of the placement issued by our partner as well as the Europass Mobility documents. An important element of the whole project will be the program of cultural, educational and linguistic preparation and a cultural program during their stay. Planned trips to places of cultural and historical values in England involve: London, Isle of Wight, Stonehenge, Winchester, Salisbury, Oxford or Brighton and in Italy: Rome, Naples, Florence, Pompeii and the Tremiti Islands. These tours will show the beauty and the uniqueness of both countries. In England students will be staying with English host-families to help them grind the English language and experience the culture and customs of the English. In Italy students will be accommodated in hotels or apartments. Before leaving for Italy, students will participate in the course of the basic Italian and all participants will take part in the linguistic preparation on the online course - Erasmus + Online Linguistic Support (OLS) prepared by the European Commission's language portal. At each stage there will be comprehensive evaluation conducted and during the project and after its completion dissemination activities will be held. After returning from the internships students will receive appropriate evaluation grades of the training on forms of entries on their final certificates.
Zagraniczne  praktyki uczniów wzmocnieniem polskiego kształcenia zawodowego

The project is going to be focused on:-Completion of training course within the following professions: a motor vehicle engineer and a motor vehicle mechanic by        acquiring new skills in the automotive and mechanical industry-Development and improvement of new professional skills- Acquintance with British rules how companies function- Improvement of language skills in everyday life situations as well as vocational language skills necessary for work-Improvement of qualifications indispensable to function on national or European labour market corresponding with the educational profile-Obtaining  equal opportunities for our students on the European labour market-Obtaining new opportunities  of getting the job in the state and abroad-Enabling beneficiaries to establish professional contacts in the host countriesParticipation of students in the project Erasmus + aims at making participants aware of importance of foreign language skills, encouraging the students to improve language skills, and confirming it through the external examination (certicficate).Participation in the training course is very important for the students as it is supposed to succeed in a better professional  start in their future as well as it will play a vital role in possible setting their own companies. Students  coming  from Polish territories where the unemployment rate is higher than the average (District of Zawiercie) are going to receive special  support. What is more self confidence of participants will increase as they are going to learn methods of work in multicultural European environment; they are going to discover in themselves new opportunities to develop professional skills such as openness, team work skills, communicational skills, entrepreneurship, creativity, independence, resourcefulness, resistance to stress, and the ability to make decisions. Furthermore new professional skills  of participants will progress  as well as their professional experience will be enriched with the unique features associated with the profession taught.Each participant is going to receive Europass Mobility Certificate which refers to host company’s  profile, includes and confirms the period of attended training course as well as the exact place of work placement.At the end of the project it is planned to organize meetings and seminars presenting the assumptions  and achievements of the project. Any ideas of new training programmes supported by new technologies will also be presented.Tangible results are supposed to be:  all printed materials, information about British educational and vocational system, which is going to be placed on our school’s website as well as  on the websites belonging to  local authorities,  and local media. They will also contain the examples of good training courses, approaches to vocational training, and vocational training programmes.Vision Training Company  is aimed at gaining new experience, and opportunities to promote themselves in local environment through the implementation of this project.Both, the Applicant party and the Partner company guarantee high quality of the project.

The participants of "European practice of wysokomazowiecki technique" are Zespol Szkol Zawodowych im. Stanislawa Staszica in Wysokie Mazowieckie and its partners: EuroMind (Spain) and Training Vision (England). The project is supposed to last from 01.06.2016 to 01.05.2018. The main goal of this project is to organise internships for students of second and third grade. These participants are students of our vocational school who specializes in economic, food production, gastronomy, tourism and information technology. The young people will take the 4-week traineeship in Spain and English corporations, which  meet the criteria tailored to education in a specific subject. Our pupils will leave with the teacher from our school to provide them with better care.The need of the project implementation results from more and more expectations of employers from graduates of vocational school. By being sent to different countries where infrustracture is well developed in aftermentioned areas, the interns will be able to learn about work conditions, they will gain professional skills, and they will improve language skills. The project will also increase students' self-confidence, indeed will contribute pupils' motivation towards the further education and in consequence will ensure a better position in the local and international labour market. Our school through the project will become more attractive for prospective students. New obtained skills as well as work, language and social competences will be documented, evaluated individually and certificated (Europass Mobility).The main goals of the project are:-widening by pupils the theoretical knowledge they get at school for professional skills educated on the practice.-preparation, sought by empleyers, graduate having european qualifications, professional and language skills,-development of international cooperation with new foreign partners,-promotion of the school,-to know the cultural legacy of other nations.The internship abrod contributes to developments of key competences of our participants. Futhermore, pupils will become more confident and learn new languages.Additionaly, the interns will have the opportunity  to learn about the culture, history and geography of Spain and England by excursions organized by our partners. Our students will develop their European awareness and learn to accept and tolerate other nations.The project will let our students the better start on completion schools, since they will be more professionally experienced than their peers. The foreign internship will also bring long-term benefits since will influence the mobility of future graduates, will equip them with professional, linguistic latest experiences and confirmed competence with relevant certificates. Moreover, the project will increase the attractiveness of school educational offer and thus the quality of education.
Try Europe - zagraniczne staże zawodowe dla uczniów i absolwentów szkół zawodowych z województwa pomorskiego

The following project is directed to tgraduates from Lebork subregion district trained in the following vocations: Economist Technician, Hotel Industry Technician, Information Tand Teleinformation Technology Technician, Food Processing Technician, Technician of Nourishment and Catering Service, Organisation of Advertising Technician., LOgistic Technican.  The project involves sending of five groups (inclusively 80) secondary young people for work placements to the UK, Italy, Germany, Spain. The main objective of the project is to improve educational and vocational training skills and give them an unique opportunity not only to gain work experience and training skills, but also to enable compliance with the requirements of the modern labor market in order to increase employability. All the parties involved in the implementation of the project will be required to apply the regulations set in European Quality Charter for Mobility.All young people who qualify to participate in the work placement will become involved in professional language and intercultural trainings. They will also attend two – or four week placements in foreign enterprises. As the result of participation in the project trainees will acquire new vocational skills attested with certificates that will enhance their chances on the labor market. Foreign Mobility will enable students not only to gain new knowledge and professional experience, recognition of the professional environment in another country, but will also contribute to the growth of personal and social competence through development of creativity in education, entrepreneurship, the ability to adapt to changes together with comprehensive personal and cultural development of young people. What is more, trainees involved in the project will increase their language and IT competences.

The main goal of the project is to get international experience, expertise, professional skills and language skills. Students of Logistics Department will have a chance to observe how the logistics companies function in terms of warehousing, demands, transport organization. Students of Economy Department will get acquainted with functions of HR, taxes, accountancy and finances. They will have a chance to observe law aspects of business activities.  Future technicians of Exploitation of ports and terminals at the airport, will gain the skills of dealing with services to travelers and luggage service as well as organization and carrying out works concerning transshipment and storage of goods and cargo in ports and terminals.Two groups of students (18 students in each group) will take part in four-week traineeship. Each group will be supervised by two teachers from the sending organization. The participants will be selected by a recruitment commission, whose decision will be based on the applications and competence tests. All the participants will take part in professionally-oriented language courses in English.. They will also take part in workshops with a careers office and foreign culture classes organized in cooperation with our project partner in Spain and Training Vision in England, who have many years of experience in coping with such projects. Our project partners will appoint the places where our students, according to their professions, will have their training. The acquired skills will improve their mobility in the labour market, facilitate personal development and increase the future chance for employment. Additionally, young people will have the opportunity to check themselves in taking first independent steps and taking up their own decisions.They will meet a chance to integrate within their own group, consisting of students from different classes and trades, as well as into the European environment.All the participants will get the following certificates, issued in cooperation with our partner organization (intermediary organization):• Students training certificate issued by our projects partners and employers: this certificate will be issued at the end of the program to every student• Europass Mobility Certificate, prepared together with our project partners When the traineeship is finished a lot of meetings, exhibitions and events will be held to recapitulate on the project. During one of them the participants will receive the above mentioned certificates.During and after the traineeship the whole project will be evaluated with the help of following tools:• questionnaires on training, filled in by the students after two weeks of traineeship and at the end of the traineeship,• questionnaires on training, filled in by the employers, the company tutor will evaluate the tasks done by the students,• Activity Register – the daily report of working hours and accomplished tasks, filled by the student and signed by the training supervisor,The conclusions after the first tour of training will be taken into consideration and implemented with the second tour.In order to propagate the results of the whole project the information about it will appear in the school website, in the town website, local press and exhibitions.The headmaster of our school as well as all the teachers involved will support the project on each stage in all necessary ways.

Education and Training Centre OHP Dobieszków is the executor of the tasks of training and combat social exclusion.With the project "Talent, profession, specialist" Centre gives 32 young people the chance to complete training and gain the first, a foreign professional practice.The project participants will be students of the Centre, aged 16-18 years, learning the profession: cook, hairdresser, carpenter and locksmith.Participants center is mostly young people coming from environments that are socially maladjusted, marginalized, economically disadvantaged or dysfunctional upbringing. It is the youth that requires enormous support from the country.Young people coming from rural, poor and large families, unemployed and pathologies, thanks to the participation in the project gets a unique opportunity for personal and professional development, impossible to achieve in a standard educational process.This project is an opportunity for a change in their lives, to gain qualifications, skills and knowledge bringing in their next life, not just professional disproportionate benefits.The project was planned long term, so that support can be covered by the majority of participants Center, trainees in those professions.Participants will leave in two rounds in groups of 16 persons, divided due to the nature taking on the practice of companies. Due to the age of the participants and the specifics of group, duration of practice was set for two weeks.The target group and the objectives of the project are part of the foundation of European policy in the field of vocational training, consistent they are the current strategies and guidelines in this regard.By analogy with the objectives of the project focuses on training and professional development inclusive, which should increase their employability, promote positive quality career, let gain experience, confidence, habit of professional integrity and provide opportunities for satisfaction and growth in professional life and personal life.The overriding objective of our activities is an effective combination of implementation of the two priorities which are developing the skills and gain work experience and personal competence development of youth.Thanks to the tools developed by the years and the methods of both partners is the maximum possible activation and stimulation of creativity and entrepreneurship project participants. A strong emphasis on active participation of the beneficiaries (of involvement in the recruitment process, to the dissemination of results) applies to the whole project. Achieving the goals is to provide participants with a high dose of theoretical knowledge supported the holding of the practice, which in turn motivates us to further develop knowledge and skills. Another advantage would be to document the acquired skills and knowledge, which in turn connects to the promotion of occupational mobility.The project TPS is an opportunity for long-term cooperation of our organizations, which gives the opportunity to promote the mobility of workers, creating a network of international contacts and increase the number of apprentices.
Rozwój zawodowy i osobisty kluczem do uczestnictwa w życiu społeczeństw europejskich.

The project "Personal and professional development the key to participation in European societies" is addressed to 45 students of Zespół Szkół Ponadgimnazjalnych in Krosno Odrzańskie learning the following professions: information technology technician, economist and labor occupations: shop assistant, barber, bricklayer - plasterer, mechanic, plumber and confectioner. The students will take part in a 4-week-apprenticeship in modern European companies in Germany, Great Britain and Italy, which will enable them to gain and develop their professional knowledge as well as to develop their professional skills in real working conditions. During 120 hours of the apprenticeship the participants will perform the tasks, use specialized computer programs supporting the work in their profession, use the foreign language and develop their knowledge of specific language. They will also learn about the culture of work and life in Germany, Great Britain and Italy, the history and the geography of these countries. The students will also integrate with each other as well as with inhabitants of the visited cities. Moreover, they will bring to their friends the news from Europe, and, consequently, they will share their knowledge about creating the companies in European countries, consumer rights and safe use of computer. In the future, they will also help the local employers in the development of their companies as they will use gained knowledge as well as language and computer skills. The project "Personal and professional development the key to participation in European societies" will equip the students living in the area of high unemployment in knowledge and competences useful in active and satisfying functioning in the united Europe. It will enable them to gain practical work experience abroad. Moreover, the achieved skills will be clearly recognized due to the Europass-Mobility certificate as well as the recommendations from Polish and European employers. It will prepare the students for the deliberate planning of their future career and their further professional development. It will also prepare them for entering the European labor market and increase their chances of achieving the professional success. The project will shape pro-European attitudes, democratic behaviors and  social competences as well as it will enhance the sense of Polish and European identity of not only the participants, but also the whole local community. Thus, the durability and the effectiveness of its results will be increased.Finally, the implementation of the mobility will affect positively the image of  the school. It will be recognized as a modern institution, which prepares its students to living in the united Europe. It will also motivate both the teachers and the students to achieving better and better results. Moreover, it will strengthen the cooperation with partners, which will result in the development of our future actions connected with the vocational training.

The project regards three-week international internships for the students of Zespol Szkol Ponadgimnazjalnych No 3 named after Jan Sobieski III in Stalowa Wola. The hosting institution is situated in Rimini in Italy and Portsmouth in the United Kindom. The project will last from 01.11.2016 to 31.10.2018. The beneficiaries of this project are the 80 students of ZSP No 3 (second and third grade  of high school students) who have been educated in various areas such as economics, trade, hotel industry, tourism, gastronomy&catering&waiting staff members, photography and also basic vocational school students specializing in cooking (chef ) and trade (salesperson). The  internships include four  departures of twenty students each : from 17.09.2017 to 7.10.2017r and from  22.04.2018 to 12.05.2018r.Each group of students will be accompanied by two teachers from ZSP No 3 during internships.Each participant of the project will complete a language course in a foreign language and will take part in pedagogical and culural workshops. The students who will do an internship in the UK, will take part in a 40-hour training course in professional English, whereas the students who head for Italy, will participate in two courses: a 20-hour English language course and a 30-hour Italian language course.There are several reasons why ZSP No 3 decided to prepare that project.Stalowa Wola is located in the south-east  of Poland, the region with high unemployment rate which results in low standards of living of most of our students and their families. Therefore , rarely do our students have a chance to leave our region for recreational purposes and it seems it could be difficult for them to adjust to a new lifestyle. Students complete internships in workplaces where due to gradual process of impovershiment , there are few customers. Accordingly, our students have little contact with real working conditions. Lack of suitable vocational training, intercultural competence and worldwide experience as well as the language barrier very often generate social and occupational disqualification not only in our region but also in the country. Our school has been cooperating with numerous employers both in our region and larger Polish cities. Unfortunately, due to bad financial conditions only few students have an opportunity to complete the internships in reputable establishments out of their hometowns. Taking into consideration the needs and expectations of not only our students but also Polish and European job market we prepared the project, whose main aim is to support its participants in  improving their professional and linguistic competence, personal development and increasing chances for being employed. The main aim of the project is to improve practical skills as well as professional and linguistic competence of 80 students of ZSP No 3.Detailed targets :• the completion of a three-week international internship by 80 students• improving the professional English  language by 80 students• familiarising students with the culture and customs of the Italy and English society• learning about the European job market and its structure• promoting the mobility of workers on the European job market• gaining experience, professional competence and developing social competence by the beneficieries Thanks to the internships the students will highten their vocational skills, strenghten their language skills and they will be more motivated to master their vocational training. The internship will enable students to improve their self- assessment, gain valuable experience along with social competence. Taking part in that kind of internship is favourable for finding a job not only locally or in Poland but also in other European countries including Italy and the United Kindom. The completion of the project is significant due to the high unemployment rate in the area where the beneficieries live. The skills that students obtain during the education process, characteristic for different professions, are still very attractive and required on the European labour market. The fulfillment of the internships will furnish ZSP No3 with information whether students have been educated not only in a modern way but also in accordance with the requirements of contemporary European job market.
IES Pasqual Calbó i Caldés keeps expandig through Europe

This project represents our third own project for Vocational Training, the second under the ERASMUS + program, since we finished the development of our first project Leonardo da Vinci on 31-05-15 (Call 2013) and from the course 2015-16 we are managing our first VET Erasmus+ project (KA102). Previously, our participation was taking place through projects managed by the Education Ministry of the Balearic Government.

Therefore, this project will involve our consolidation as an institution with international vision  offering our students the opportunity to develop a training quality placement in another European country.

The project focuses on the increasing need for the students to be able to develop their career and life anywhere, keeping in mind that their future is not limited to the possibilities offered here. Living on an island as Minorca, this need has even a greater importance.

The goal is that the students come into contact with other ways of working in the professional areas they study, and very different from what it can be found in the Minorcan work market and industry. 

In addition, it is intended that students know and assume the reality of the European Working Market to which they belong, and are able to eliminate boundaries and open horizons for cultural, social and professional levels. A difficult task, considering that our students have an additional limitation living on an island with few opportunities to travel to the rest of Europe, due to the double insularity of Minorca.

This time the project is aimed to students of all our VT educational offer (except Higher Education) 4 CFGM and 3 FP Basic A total of 16 mobility grants for students applying for training periods in schools and enterprises:
4 grants for students CFGM Gardening and Floristry (AGA-23) to Finland and Poland.
3 grants for students CFGM Electrical Installations (ELE-21) to Finland and Germany.
1 grant for a student of CFGM Mechanization (mechanical parts manufacturing) (FME-21) to Germany.
5 grants for students CFGM Administrative Management (ADG-21) to Germany, UK and Italy.
