VETCs and Regional Education System providers will integrate the Framework Agreement for the Dual-Training System with International Traineeships. The VETCs will start a qualification in English and the figure of Mobility Tutor will be formalized. The VETCs will increase their students by 5% and will planned two new Mobility initiatives E+ & PON.
HVE Mobility and Work placement training for students and staff

The project will run from August 2018 to August 2020 and includes staff and students from five professional fields of work at Frans Schartau Business Institute in Stockholm, which is one of Northern Europe’s strongest growth regions. The school conducts Higher Vocational Education in Travel & Tourism and Hospitality, Accounting and Finance, Health and Welfare, Retail, and IT. The number of students at the school is just over 700, there are 22 permanently employed staff, and 60 to 80 contracted staff working with education. The project is linked to the EU’s educational policy goals; at least 40% of all 30-34 year-olds should have completed tertiary education. The project is timely with regard to EU goals – Higher Vocational Education in Sweden has never before been allocated so many places. The political direction is clear – there is a strong commitment to HVE. 
 
The aim of the project for staff is to obtain more knowledge about EU tools, and to gain better insight into the overall goals set out in the Europe 2020 Strategy for Higher Education. Knowledge is needed about SeQF, EQF and how ECVET can be implemented concerning credit transfer. Staff will gain knowledge by learning how tasks are performed, taught and assessed in Europe within the professional roles that students are educated for at Frans Schartau. Further aims of the project are to see how the European dimension can be reflected in the curriculum. 

The aim of the project for students is to provide them with international professional experience, and increased language skills as requested by the labour market. One consequence of mobility is that employability increases while strengthening the student’s ability to work in an international labour market. Through exchange, students get the opportunity to acquire key competencies such as communicating in another language, learning new technologies that increase digital skills. Living in another country leads to the development of social, personal and cultural skills, and by participating in exchange projects a person’s capacity to take initiative is stimulated. 
 
Three members of staff with experience of international cooperation will organise the project. Well-established activities and methods have been planned for some time. After starting up the project and implementation with staff and students, work will progress according to the Activity Plan that also includes theme days, help with writing CVs, and that each participant prepares themself by examining specific areas in the recipient country. 

Five different professional areas of work at the school will be represented among the 14 employees participating in mobility to obtain a comprehensive result. Staff should be in the position to immediately apply their new skills to benefit students and promote work on internationalization at the school. The 25 students participating each year will be selected to achieve a good spread across the various areas of work. Students must have a good communicative ability to be able to pass on what they have learnt after their Work Placements. After selection, mobility goals will be anchored with the host organization or company and the Learning Agreement written.

The intended outcome is that the school should be at the forefront of internationalization work. There will be more knowledge within the organization about professional roles seen from a European perspective. The knowledge acquired will give courses and teaching at the school an international dimension, increase knowledge of SeQF, EQF and ECVET as well as ensuring that international Work Placements maintains high quality.

The school is part of the City of Stockholm, which organizes education at all levels so that circulation of results will be via the City's Intranet and in the newsletter. The companies (about 100) linked to the school’s various steering groups as well as industry organizations within the various fields of education will be invited to participate in breakfast meetings and theme days in order to gain access to the school’s internationalization work. All niche companies that the school works with will have access to a workforce that has international experience.

Once the entire project has been completed, Frans Schartau Business Institute will have strengthened international cooperation in Higher Vocational Education in Europe, which will facilitate future work on implementation of ECVET. If the project is carried out full-scale, in addition to the contacts made through staff skills development, it will also have included supervisors from 40 companies in Europe whereby knowledge and insights are spread further. Students’ involvement in mobilization will benefit the EU region through access to a professionally trained workforce that can work across borders.

The CEFAE,Vocational School Fialho de Almeida, in Vidigueira, Portugal, intends to develop an Erasmus+ 2018 Project, Key Action 1, whose title is “Entrepreneurial Skills in a European Context”. The goal of the Project is to promote and enhance the participants’ education and training within a European Context. This Project is meant to include 34 participants, encompassing students, ex-students and staff members.
EPFA wishes to ensure that the participants will take part in different learning experiences within the European job market. The vocational courses’ curriculum in EPFA includes three different teaching areas: sociocultural, scientific and technical, as well as training periods (internships) in companies. The participants in the Project, which include Mobilities ErasmusPRO, will all be students and ex-students from EPFA, namely: Social and Psychological Care, Sports, Viticulture, Health Assistant, Sports Management and Audiovisual. We also included in the Project for the students of the Viticulture, Health Assistant, Sports Management and Audiovisual Vocational Courses who have successfully graduated from EPFA. Moreover we included Job Shadowing Days for the Staff members of our school.      
This Project will allow all the participants to take part in training periods (internships) in companies abroad, giving them the opportunity to learn new technical skills and improve their professional competences in a different working environment related to their vocational areas. These training periods within the companies will put the participants in touch with different cultural and social realities, which will allow them to develop their interpersonal abilities and also improve their foreign languages skills. Through the internships experience abroad, EPFA expects the participants to learn and master new professional tools and gather useful job connections, which will enhance their employability and give them the possibility to enter the European job market more easily, or even motivate them to create their own job/company.  
We will work hard with our partners and make a joint commitment to assure that the beneficiaries will find in the placements abroad the necessary conditions to make them develop and improve as many personal and professional skills and abilities as possible, namely: critical and creative thinking, decision-making skills, autonomy, self-confidence, team-work ability, problem-solving skills, self-esteem, responsibility and several vocational skills implied in the job/tasks performed. The internships will also help the participants to prioritize interests, establish goals and improve their time management capacity and their ability to adapt to different working contexts. A safe and intellectually stimulating working environment will be provided to all participants. With the help of our partners abroad we will try to find placements where the participants will feel welcome and free to express their opinions, ask questions and share ideas and experiences. 
Bearing in mind that Alentejo is one of the most underprivileged regions in the country, taking part in a European Project means the world to most of our students who have low expectations towards their own future and lack opportunities to flee the lower conditions they live in and surpass the difficulties they face every day. This Project can be life changing for them and therefore we expect our participants to truly embrace this Project in order to develop their entrepreneurial skills, become more competitive professionally and widen their horizons. When they return from their working experience abroad they should be able to take advantage of what they have learned and be willing to use that advantage to take a chance, be positive, determined and confident, seize the opportunities ahead and trust their ability to find a suitable job and grab their place in the European job market with both hands.
We wish to provide the participants the possibility to take part in different experiences in a European context. Thus all the beneficiaries will have the opportunity to put the skills they have already learned at school and during the previous internships in local and national companies into practice abroad. The participants will take what they have learned in Portugal and share it with our partners abroad and at the same time learn new practices. The fact that they will be faced with different new ways of working in the companies abroad will be an advantage for them in the future. Both the national and the international internships will allow the participants to compare strategies, dynamics, entrepreneurial structures and relations, which will enrich their Curriculum Vitae and give them a wider perspective of what will be expected of them when they get into the European job market.
Kutse- ja erialaste oskuste ning ettevõtlikkuspädevuse arendamine Valgamaa Kutseõppekeskuses

The present application aims to continue the project "getting skills, opening minds" providing our students the access to a diversified, relevant and of quality formative offer that effectively enhances their level of skills and their professional performance, preparing them for insertion into the labour market, both national and European, thus combating unemployment levels.
The Afonso Lopes Vieira (ESALV) Secondary school, located in no lugar de Rego d'Água - Gândara dos Olivais, is situated on the periphery of the city of Leiria (district capital), with an unconsolidated urban context. It was found in 1982 to respond to the overcrowding of the schools of the Central urban center of Leiria and to correspond to the notorious demographic growth of the parish of Marrazes. This parish has been chosen as a place of fixation by (i) migrants, with diverse cultures and traditions, creating natural tensions arisen by the uprooting and adjustment to new customs.

Thus, ESALV assumes itself as an integrator hub of this multicultural community, not losing sight of its educational mission to promote scientific knowledge.

We believe that by increasing the level of education of our young people and the investment in their training, both academic and professional, we will contradict one of the main causes of unemployment and poverty in the younger age classes, which can be an important tool in Combating social exclusion.

It is in this context that our project is assumed to be fundamental for the promotion of education and training for young people, particularly those from disadvantaged sectors, encouraging creativity, innovation and entrepreneurship while promoting equality, social cohesion and active citizenship in our young people, contributing, consequently and simultaneously, to the appreciation of the image of our school.

The recognition and validation of learning done in a mobility context are also one of our goals, together with the improvement of communication skills in foreign languages and the chance to make them aware of other cultures.
These are, generally speaking, the goals we set for our European development plan. To achieve them we intend to give our third year students, as well as to students that have recently finished their courses, a set of 40 mobilities, over the next two years, to perform their internship in a working context in Spain, the UK, Bulgaria, Ireland and Italy.

Through the cooperation and the establishment of new partnerships with European organisations, we hope that these mobilities have a consistent outcome in the complete education (on the level of professional, social, linguistic and cultural skills) of our students and that their impact may be meaningful in their future career.

Other impacts are also expected: in what concerns our school, we expect gains in terms of formative quality, and in what concerns the business community, it will most certainly benefit from better prepared and competent co-workers.

The dissemination, a core goal of our project, will contribute also to the wide spreading and growth of its impact. Making the results of these experiences known in the community will make them aware of the opportunities a programme like ERASMUS + can offer, thus encouraging and motivating them to future participation.

So, on the short and long term, with the concretization of this project, major gains will be achieved: an innovative education and more ambitious training to our students; the introduction of innovation in the learning process, namely on the technical-pedagogical level; a stronger relationship between local decision-makers, organizations, schools and citizens and fulfilment of a common goal on the level of active citizenship and entrepreneurship, having on its basis Europe 2020 Strategy.

The project “More Skills, Best Opportunities” consists of a mobility project for learning purposes that the Agrupamento de Escolas Padre Benjamim Salgado (AEPBS) wishes to implement, so as to enhance the value professional education and, as a whole, the School.
It is important to increase the attractiveness of professional education, by promoting it as an alternative of quality learning and, simultaneously, fighting one of the biggest problems that AEPBS is facing presently: school absenteeism and dropout of professional education students. 
Another challenge of AEPBS is to provide the students with a diversity of civic, intercultural, social and professional skills which will play as a differentiating factor in an increasingly competitive and changing labor market.
Still, it should be noted that the AEPBS professional education students come from low financial resource families; therefore, it is the school’s job to promote social equity, by creating the necessary conditions to attain equal opportunities for all of them. 
Thus, the AEPBS needs to update and diversify its practices, in order to respond, properly, to its public and fulfill its mission: Educating for Success! 
This way, we would like the third year students of professional courses to undergo a training experience at an enterprise abroad and the recent graduates to go through a longer international training (three months). 
These mobilities would break down as follows: 
- 10 students of the third year, in the school year 2018/2019, would perform mobility in Barcelona, Spain, for a period of 40 days.
- 10 students of the third year, in the school year 2018/2019, would perform mobility in Brussels, Belgium, for a period of 40 days.
- 10 students of the third year, in the school year 2019/2020, would perform mobility in Portsmouth, United Kingdom, for a period of 40 days.
- 10 students of the third year, in the school year 2019/2020, would perform mobility in Valencia, Spain, for a period of 40 days.
- 5 graduates, in the school year 2017/2018, would perform mobility in Barcelona, Spain, for a period of 90 days.
- 5 graduates, in the school year 2018/2019, would perform mobility in Brussels, Belgium, for a period of 90 days.

The objectives we are aiming at with this project are, briefly:
 -to empower the students with diversified professional skills, promoting employability.
 - to provide the students with transversal skills, preparing them to the unpredictable and varied professional careers of the present.
 -to increase students proficiency in foreign languages. 
- to promote multiculturalism as a means of professional and personal enrichment.
 - to mitigate social inequalities, promoting equality of opportunities.
- to reduce school absenteeism and dropout.
- to promote the European citizenship and the recognition of Europe as a common area. 
- to promote professional education as an alternative of quality education.
 - to project the school grouping internationally, turning it into an European-style institution.

 The project will attain full success if all these objectives, results and impact are accomplished, namely:
- Improvement of the School grouping’s prestige and visibility among the local community.
- Deepening relations among local enterprises and the School grouping.
 - Development of an European culture within the School grouping.
 - Increase of employment rates of students who have completed a professional course.
 - Increase of professional courses completion rates.
- Increase of the number of students seeking professional courses for secondary education completion.
 - Better prepared students to face personal and professional challenges.
 - More active and interactive citizens in society and more intervening citizens in social, political, environmental and economic matters.
- Solution of social inequalities.
 - Increase of local communities trust in the educational system.
 - Helping make enterprises and national economy more productive and competitive.
 
With this project, The AEPBS, as a social organization of educational services provider, would like to implement tailor-made solutions to the community it serves, proposing to meet its requirements and expectations, by creating equal opportunities for all and assuming itself as an intervening and for change agent within the educational community.

The project "Nurses fin Europe" is prepared for the students of Secondary Nursing School in Hranice, branch Nursing, finished by the school leaving exam (Maturita) and  branch Carer, finished by the final exam. The presenter of this project as well as the sending organization is the Secondary Nursing School in Hranice. The students acquire at school wide theoretical knowledge and they have lessons of practical training at school laboratories, caring institutions for elderly people and hospitals. Suitable extention of above mentioned education will be  the internship  abroad where students could see new methods and get update information in their branch and also obtain higher level of language competences.
The  partners for this project  are three institutions.  Two educational institutions -  Language Solution, Portsmouth, England , Future Focus Ltd., Floriana, Malta  and 1 hospital Všeobecná nemocnica s poliklinikou Velký Krtíš, Slovensko whose main role is to find the workplacements in the local health and nursing institutions - care homes for seniors, nursaries and hospitals. In cooperation with these institutions we have already realized several runs of internships which were successful.   In the frame of the Call 2018 we  prepare 3 runs of the  mobilities for 38 students and  3 accompanying persons. The mobilities are planned to be organized in September/October 2018 and May/June 2019. The students of the third and fourth year will take part in them. In the above mentioned years students have regular practical training twice a week in different departements in the hospital in Hranice and in Přerov and one month practical training and the internship abroad will be effective addition to this practical training as well as theoretical education in the main subjects - Nursing, Psychology and Communication, First aid. Students from Hranice and from Přerov will participate in the  project.

The main goals of the project are:
1) to improve special education of the students - especially their practical training
2) to extent students´ knowledge in the field of their studies 
3) to show students different ways of nursing abroad
4) to extent students´knowledge and skills and introduce new methods
5) to support effective way of learning foreign language through the stay abroad
6) to help understand culture, traditions, education in a foreign country as well as the organization and conditions of the labour market in the EU countries.
The expected results of the project are:
1) to improve special nursing education of our students especially their practical training
2) to extent students´knowledge in their practical education and through this to support extention of their qualification
3) usage of the gained information from the field of nursing in our country
4) to support students in getting jobs in our country as well as abroad with the help of Europass mobility document
5) increased confidence of the students doing jobs abroad
6) to start long lasting cooperation with educational and health
7)to increase the motivation for serious studying of medical subjects and foreign languages, too

The Szeged Centre for Vocational Training School Deri Miksa continue training in technical fields, especially engineering and information technology fields, but progress has been dealing with the effect of automation and mechatronics training as well, as well as the mechanical and CNC machining is in training. Since 2012, the school has successfully implemented Erasmus + student (and teacher) mobility projects with positive experiences and forward-looking opportunities.
The sending institution wants to send foreign internships and foreign training 4 groups of students during the project. To Denmark, Viborg 6 students (manufacturing engineering technicians, mechatronics technicians, automation technicians, as well as graduates preparing for these courses, graduating in maturity) in October-November 2018 (2 weeks), to the local training center. Students in the training center located in Denmark learn about robotic technology, automation, and their practical use. To United Kingdom, Portsmouth/Gosport in 2 week turns three groups, a total of 18 students (CAD-CAM IT, manufacturing engineering technicians, mechatronics technicians, as well as graduates preparing for these courses, graduating in maturity) to Infonetmedia Ltd. and Norjon Engineers Ltd. in October-November-December 2018 (3x2weeks). At Infonetmedia Ltd, their design/programming/network knowledge is expanded and applied in practice by students. At Norjon Engineers Ltd, they practice their knowledge at home on hand and automated equipment (cutting, measuring, CNC machine operation).
At the time of each trip, at least one disadvantaged student is involved in the project, who is a family-oriented, problem-solving, large-family student. In disadvantaged students, we pay special attention to both their selection and preparation to their social sensitivity.
Completion is entirely the responsibility of the sending institution. The project is always divided into 4 sections (preparation, planning, implementation, closure), which always takes into account the opinions and needs of different participants (institutions, students, preparatory teachers, coordinators, parents). 
The main goal of this project set out that the participating VET students and teachers familiarize themselves with new used technologies in abroad and they transfer these things to domestic practice, teaching practice and thereby strengthen the labor market employment opportunities. During the project, we focus on the development of general and professional language, mobility willingness to promote the development opportunities of the new directions. Among the primary concerns can be found students develop social skills, their teamwork, communication skills, self-development and strengthening. The positive impact of the participating in addition to the impact of the institutions is also significant, such as curriculum development, promote enrollment. The project's ultimate goal in any case is that the new knowledge, experience packed with students from the school bypassing much faster and more easily able to get a job in today's difficult economic situation.
With the host partners, we put together the work programs for pupils and teachers, allowing the development of professional competencies (linguistic, technical, educational methodology). In the project we used the ECVET principles, which facilitate the adoption of the gained knowledge at home and abroad.
Both the short and long term effects of both the participants and the institutions will be visible to the project. We strengthen our commitment to foreign languages and the profession in the students. The partnerships between the institutions are even stronger, helping to achieve a further joint project. The program is a long-term cooperation start/resume along with partners for mutual benefit.
Kereskedelem, marketing és logisztika - tanulói és oktatói kompetenciafejlesztés az Egyesült Királyságban és Németországban

The applying institute is a secondary school of trade, marketing and logistics. It aims to provide up-to-date, socio-economic needs-based knowledge and adapted to European standards in the region for those who want to work in the commerce, logistics and business. We provide training in three sectors: advanced logistics executive, commercial executive and shop assistant. 
The aim of the project is to improve our students'  professional competences, with special regard to their foreign language, entrepreneur, civic, intercultural and digital competences. A further aim is to develop a culture of learning and teaching methods, in particular the development of non-formal and informal learning opportunities in the field of knowledge capacity. We wish to increase students' performance achieved in professional subjects and we intend to reduce the dropout rate. We hope that the international internship  will increase our students' adaptability, autonomy. We would like the project to contribute to their marketable skills which enable them to enter the labor market and grow their employment chances.
The present project is the means of these aims. 4 student groups are going to perform their work placement in the United Kingdom and in Germany. Our expectation is that this work placement will improve their professional skills and competences.
These aims are emphasized by 2 professional visits performed by our colleagues: in Germany they will study the dual professional education and the operation of the retailer units, on special emphasis on how they educate their apprentices. The practical questions of the education of logistics will also take part in the programme. The professional visit to England will include the study of the IT tools, softwares and recycling schemes used in logistics.
The partner institution is the Training Vision in Portsmouth (UK) and Berlink in Germany, both are members of the Education and Training Network. The beneficiaries of the project are 56 students, under the supervision of 4 accompanying teachers, and 6 professional  teachers. The implementation steps include: evolving the project management, an introduction to the project, the choice of beneficiaries, followed by professional, linguistic, cultural and educational preparation of the students. During the internship tutoring and mentoring of students will be organized by the foreign partner institution, but the four of our colleagues are going to be involved in the tutoring process. During their stay in Portsmouth and Berlin the students and teachers will keep work journals and will work on a pre-defined essay topic. On our return, we will organize reports, exhibitions, we will prepare a file of written materials (essay collections, worksheets,) which will be included in the local curriculum of our institution in respect of vocational subjects. 
On short-term  the project will have a positive impact both on the students' personal development and on the institute itself, because the good pedagogical practices can be incorporated into our program. We expect that in the long run,   we can establish a long-term partnership with the companies, the workplaces and hopefully with some schools of similar profile.

The aim of our project is to support the attractiveness and quality of vocational education of pupils, students and staff of secondary and post- secondary nursing schools. Within the staff mobility three teachers will visit a nursing school in Norway for the purpose of mutual professional development. They would like to share their experience, gain inspiration and start long- term cooperation. Twelve pupils who are being trained for the profession of Nursing Assistant, will take part in a short -term internship in health facilities in Slovakia, Norway and England and three students who are being trained for the profession of Qualified Nurse will take part in long- term internship ErasmusPro in social and health facilities in England. The interns will provide patients´ basic health care under the mentor´s supervision. 
Content and assessment of the internship is defined by the unit of expected learning outcomes according to ECVET. In addition all participants will improve their professional and language skills.
After providing written feedback on the project experience each student will gain Europass Mobility Certificate.  
The desired impact of the project is their motivation for further study and work. We believe that experience of the internship will positively influence personal and professional life and form students´ way of looking at the society and the European Union.
Обучение чрез работа за успешна професионална реализация
ΕΠΑΓΓΕΛΜΑΤΙΚΗ ΕΚΠΑΙΔΕΥΣΗ ΚΑΙ ΚΑΤΑΡΤΙΣΗ ΣΤΗΝ ΕΥΡΩΠΗ: ΧΤΙΖΟΥΜΕ ΓΕΦΥΡΕΣ - ΟΝΕΙΡΕΥΟΜΑΣΤΕ ΕΝΑ ΚΟΙΝΟ ΑΥΡΙΟ

The PUBLIC INSTITUTE OF VOCATIONAL TRAINING (DIEK) RETHYMNOU since 1995 provides educational and training services in the Prefecture of Rethymno. It serves a diverse population of adult trainees who chose to be trained in order to redefine their professional identity. In an effort to upgrade our faculty's educational services, we prepared this proposal for three European Mobility flows of students and personnel in three different European cities.

Ten trainees of the specialty MANAGMENT AND ECONOMICS EXECUTIVE and one attendant, will undertake a short-term, 2-week, training mobility in Bucharest, Romania, with Apopsis Activ s.r.l. as partner organization. There they will make professional visits to Greek, Romanian and multinational companies and banks and will attend special seminars. They will see real-time international "modern enterprises" and financial institutions. They will understand the importance of administration, organization, management of human and other resources, public relations, communication in an extrovert economic environment in a country like Romania with growth of over 5% , which receives international investments from the most significant of the eastern European countries. Experientially, they  will understand the notions of European economy - Balkan market - Common European Economic Area. In the long run, they will be able to evaluate investment plans and make decisions as future executives of European-oriented businesses and organizations.

The agency Training Vision Ltd was selected as partner organisation , for a long-term mobility of five trainees in the specialty  TECHNICIAN IN TOURIST FACILITIES AND HOSPITALITY BUSINESSES. The trainees will practice in hotels of the coastal, densely populated historical city of Portsmouth, UK for  three months. There they will acquire skills in vertical activities: preparing the arrival of the client, communicating with the client, supervising the quality and hosting, invoicing , organizing customer's departure, supplies management, sale and serving of food , beverages and drinks. All these tasks will be undertaken in an international environment, in a vibrant European city with high quality standards. The program will provide trainees with experiences that will stigmatize their professional career and constitute them aware of the European identity of the profession they have decided to follow.

This flow will require an Advance Planning Visit (APV)  from a member of  our Foundation's staff in order to facilitate collaboration between the organizations involved and to better prepare mobility activities with quality standards.

BERLINK ETN GMBH was chosen for the short-term mobility of ten trainees in the  fields of “SAFEKEEPING AND SECURITY OF MUSEUMS AND ARCHAEOLOGICAL SITES ” and “SECURITY OF PERSONS AND PROPERTY” and one attendant.  They will pay professional visits and attend seminars in Berlin, Germany for 2 weeks.  During the program they will visit Security Companies and will come into contact with a different culture in the protection of cultural infrastructures. They will visit work environments, see and use modern electronic security systems. They will find out how to deal with emergencies, first aid, hygiene and fire protection. In the seminars, they will learn about the European Legislation for the Protection of Cultural and Natural Heritage, the Rules of Professional Ethics and the Future of the Protection of Persons and Infrastructure.

All participants, in the long run, will increase their professional prospects,will enrich their CVs and experiences, will take more initiatives and consistently take on more responsibilities. They will upgrade their skills and competence , improve their services and the ability to use foreign languages. In addition, contacting professional bodies will also provide opportunities for business relations abroad. 
The institute will enrich its curriculum, improve its educational and advisory services, become more extrovert and accessible to those who wish to study there.
Integrated Services for Active Ageing - jobs and innovative entrepreneurship

Τhe elderly care as an economic field

The care of the aging population of European countries is emerging in an area that is developing economically. The European Union calls this economic growth a Silver Economy.

There is a increase in the activities of small and dynamic businesses, and new jobs are created with fairly good wages. The reasons are many and well known. Among them, we will highlight the fact that older people are not meant to be patients but citizens who want help and care so that, despite their chronic illness, they remain active in social and economic life. This is the importance of active aging.

In order to finance care, they do not resort to their insurance funds, but to their own pensions, which come from earlier periods of economic blossom. The services are not limited only to the medical aspect of the issue but also to its technological aspects. We see smartphone applications, sos buttons, geo-fences,

European policies on active aging

 The EU institutions therefore support active aging so that health problems do not automatically lead to the exclusion of the elderly and its excessive dependence on third parties. (Charter of Fundamental Rights, No 21.1 and 25). They also apply economic policies, especially for elderly people with chronic diseases such as Horizon2020, the InCasa (ICT-PSP) network that has developed an ICT-based system that integrates health and environment monitoring with a focus on the elderly person himself.

Aims 

With the main aim of expanding the professional opportunities of our graduates in this quality field, we ended up submitting this project to the subject of integrated care for the elderly with chronic conditions. Our school is located in western Thessaloniki and its students are stuck in a vicious circle of unemployment because they come from social strata hit by the country's economic crisis.

We aim to increase our professional qualifications to integrated care services for the elderly with chronic conditions. We chose the United Kingdom where health-care is one of the comparative advantages of the country's economy. Vocational training at British Institutions providing health education is recognized as a major asset throughout the world.

Methodology

During the placement phase, the beneficiaries will be taught theoretical subjects at seminars, will be trained in vocational training centers, will be guided in laboratory and professional settings, to companies providing comprehensive care services for people with chronic illnesses. There will be educational visits to universities, vocational schools, state employment services.

During the diffusion phase and as an element
 sustainability we are planning to install a checkpoint, telemetry, health monitoring and monitoring system that supports the prevention of chronic diseases and the management of chronic diseases. In cooperation with the Greek VIDAVO

The project includes two learner flows / actions:

1st Flow "Aged Care Electronics Technicians" [Plymouth- Almond Vocational Link Ltd]

With fifteen (15) initial vocational education students attending the 2nd EPOS of Evosmos in the specialties of the Department of Electrical, Electronic and Automation and Informatics, namely the Technical & Electronic Computing Systems, Installations, Technical Electrical Systems, Installations & Networks, Technician Automation and Network & Telecommunications Engineer

Exercise on the technologies of integrated telemetry, recording and monitoring of biological signals and health parameters to support prevention by improving health indicators that may be responsible for the occurrence of chronic diseases.

2nd Flow "Aged Care Caregivers" [Portsmouth-Training Vision]

With fifteen (15) initial vocational education pupils attending the same school in the specialty of the Health and Welfare Sector and in particular that of the Assistant Nurse.

Being trained in quality care delivery methods to be able to understand and deliver more effective work, always under the guidance and guidance of specialists, and utilizing integrated telemetry systems as health professionals.

The project continues actions performed in 2016-18 in LOGIT – algorithm for better future Erasmus+ project. The second edition is intended to fulfill the idea: professional future, which emphasizes the main aims of the project: increasing vocational qualification, developing professional and personal potential of students. The beneficiaries of the project are students of ICT and Logistics College who are prospective employees of two dynamic, developing areas of social, professional and business life. Our school enables students to gain theoretical knowledge of their professions, however, contemporary labour market demands and appreciates mainly experience, practical training and qualifications. This is the reason why we would like to give our students opportunity of gaining new, attractive skills, knowledge, experience and open wide range of possibilities of their future career. This can be done by organizing abroad internship in companies with huge experience, providing effective training. The vocational curriculum includes obligatory vocational training in a Polish company, and the project will enrich that with international experience. Beneficiaries of the project are students from 3rd grade and teachers who will take care of them on the spot and prepare them for the internship: vocational training teachers, geography teachers, pedagogues, English teachers, form masters. In total 96 students and 12 teachers will take part in 6 vocational trainings organized in the Erasmus+ project. All actions, planned in a schedule, will be organized and coordinated by a manager - person assigned in cooperation with partner institution. After first dissemination actions and recruitment process, the students will be provided with pedagogical, cultural and language support, which is to prepare them for abroad practical training. The internship will take place in Portsmouth and Bournemouth in England, where tutors from receiving organization and foreign company will manage the training program. The sending organization is responsible for providing psychological, language, organizational support to the students, and organization of all stages of the project, evaluation and dissemination of the results. The receiving organization will organize, support and supervise the foreign places of work, accommodation and nutrition, organizational and psychological support on the spot. Effective communication will be supported by varied tools and methods (web page, facebook, google docs, email., skype, face2face meetings). Such solutions will ensure efficient management and high quality of the project. The students will gain the possibility of improving their skills in graphic design, multimedia, network management, data base management, e-trade, sedition, storage, distribution and logistics processes. The foreign partner offers work placements in dynamic, creative teams working in different fields such as: advertisement, promotion, advertising materials production, organization of national and international transport, culture, social service. Gained experiences will increase students’ possibilities and chances on the labour market. Such training will enable students to acknowledge new technologies, software, equipment which are not available at school or even local companies in Poland. 
The goals and results of the project are:
• improving theoretical knowledge
• developing practical skills and professional qualifications
• experiencing foreign company acting in the international market
• accessibility of newest ICT and technological advances, software, equipment
• creating logistic thinking and work planning
• experiencing foreign work standards
• increasing students’ mobility
• developing language competence
• creating open and tolerant attitude towards new culture and customs
• developing skills in dealing with new professional circumstances, addapting to new environment
• improving students’ labour market competence
• longlasting cooperation with foreign companies
• creating and supporting of innovative methods of teaching and learning
• supporting education development
The expected result will influence all participants of the project: the students, the teachers, the partner organizations. Better qualified staff, who perform high standards and knowledge, influence directly and indirectly school development, local environment; well educated students with perfect theoretical knowledge and practical professional skills improve competition, social and economic situation in their region. Experience, knowledge, skills and formal documents confirming internship (Europass, sending and receiving institutions certificates, certificate of preparation to the internship) will be of great advantage in the future, in a long-term way – mobility, openness, willingness to international cooperation, personal development, and institutional development.
Zagraniczne kształcenie, nowoczesna kolej , języki obce - szansą do wejścia na rynek pracy

The project starts on 1stOctober 2018 and ends on 30thSeptember 2020. Itsapplicant is the  Zespół Szkółim. Stanisława Staszica in Malkina Gorna. The project is  titled “Foreign education, modern railway, foreign languages - a chance to enter the labor market”. The project is directed towards the students from our school who study to become a technician of the rail transport. According to the project,a two week apprenticeship in Portsmouth will be organized for 40 students. The learnerswill serve the apprenticeship divided into 2 groups of 20 participants in May 2019 and May 2020. The project is based on the elements of the European Credit System for Vocational Education and Training(ECVET).
The main partner is the Training Vision company, which will ensure the proper proceeding of the project in the United Kingdom. The students will participate in a practical training for the profession of a  technician of the rail transport within 10 working days .
 The main objective is to acquire a professional experience on the European labour market and to gain as well as todevelop the participants’ professional and linguistic competence. This will enable them to apply successfully for attractive posts in Poland or other EU countries. We want  the teenagers to be motivated after the apprenticeship to increase their professional and linguistic education. A further aim is the improvement of creativity, independence and open-mindedness about the world and new experience. We put the emphasis onour students to acquire interpersonal and social skills, whichthey will be able touse not only in their professional lives but also in their private lives.
Moreover, the next aim of the project is to increase the  compatibility between the teaching content and the needs of the employers. Furthermore, we would like to offer our students an interesting, inspiring and full of valuable experience stay abroad, away from family home. Accomplishing the main objectives of the Erasmus+ project, we attach great importance to the development of key competencies of our students - especially to social and IT skills as well to cultural awareness.
Every student will be intensively prepared for the apprenticeship. Our school will offers 50 extra English lessons; participation in skype conference call, with candidates, class tutors, parents and the head master, organized by the Training Vision representatives; 10 lessons on pedagogical preparation, 10 lessons on vocational preparation and 6 lessons on the UK culture and history. Additionally, in the project we use the methods of individual work of the students on the so called project modules. The ECVET system will be used for evaluating  the learners’ performance in the preparation courses and completion of the modules’ tasks.
The apprenticeship workplaces will provide guardians with factual knowledge, who will evaluate the students using the report sheet of  ECVET system. For the participation in the project the learners will receive some European documents such as Europass Mobility, an English certificate from the Training Vision and the confirmation of the students’ participation in the preparatory courses in Poland. 
The project partners will carry out monitoring and evaluation activities during the whole project. The so called “soft” and “hard” results will be published during and after completing the project  i.e.  multimedia presentations, photos, fulfilled module tasks.

The project “Mobility broadens the horizons” is designed for 96 students of economics ,trade, photography, digital graphic processes and hotel management speciality in our school. We created it to meet the students’ needs to develop vocational competences and skills necessary while working for enterprises of high European standards.
The project was created together by the Secondary School of Economics Complex, our partner organisations and foreign employers by whom the work placement will be held. 
Training Vision Company, based in Portsmouth, is responsible for organising and holding work placement in economic companies. Our British partner has vast experience of organising work placement for students from other countries, including Poland.
Celei Company is located in Granada, Spain and has been cooperating successfully with Polish schools in the matter of work placement organisation. 
Institut St Christophe is a vocational school situated in the city of Masseube in the south of France. The school is responsible for vocational training and job placement organised in hotels and other premises of that kind. Those enterprises have experience in hosting foreign and local trainees as well as they cooperate with the Institute St. Christophe.
The Secondary School of Economics Complex has cooperated with the Institute since 2011 and this year is starting to work together with the Training Vision and Celei companies.
The project for the students of hotel management profile will be conducted for the sixth time and  for the students of  the economics profile for the fifth time. However, the students of the other profiles will go for the second time to gain work experience in European labour market. The previous projects appeared to be very successful and our students were highly interested in them. All methods observed during the project will be implemented in the job training in Poland; added value.
The participants of the project  are mostly the youth living in the countryside, usually having more difficult start in vocational career  than those coming from urban areas. The participants come from a poor, ethnically and religiously homogeneous background. Taking part in this project  is a great chance for them to break the stereotypes and gain experience which will make it easier for them to appear and exist in the European job market and encourage them to mobility in order to acquire necessary experience and skills  to become precious employees in the future. It will also create a chance for them to practise their language skills.
The first part of  job placement for 16 students of  the following profiles: graphic design, photography and trade will take place in October 2018. The second group of 16 students of the economics profile will take part in job placement in March 2019. The next job placement is planned in April 2019 for 16 students of the hotel management specialty. In autumn 2019 we want to organise internship in Great Britain for 16 students of economics profile. In spring 2020 we are planning to organise yet another two internships – first for 16 students of trade, graphic design, photography and multimedia profiles in Spain; the latter for 16 students of the hotel management specialty in April in France.
The main aim of the project is to provide the students of the Secondary School of Economics Complex  with a possibility of getting  a vocational knowledge and practical skills in the field of hotel – tourism, trade, photography, digital graphic enterprises activity during 2 - week work placement. The next goal is to make use of the acquired vocational skills within European standards and to learn the Italian, French and English standards of running a business.

Expected results:
- preparing 96 students to start vocational career by entering the European job market and increasing the possibility of being employed after graduation
- learning the ways of functioning of some hotel-tourism enterprises and several trade, photography, digital graphic enterprises
- improving the level of foreign languages for 96 students by enriching the vocabulary and improving speaking skills
- personal development of 96 students in the fields of entrepreneurship, resourcefulness , breaking  barriers and stereotypes about the youth living in rural areas
- transferring the experience and skills acquired  while vocational training in France, Spain and England to the programme of vocational training in Poland and the Polish labour market
- adjusting the educational process to the current requirements of the European labour market
- getting to know the culture of the country or region where the  job training is conducted
- getting the Europass Mobility certificate
- expanding  the cooperation between the partner companies and our school
The employers from the area of Radomsko district also took part in creation of the project. During a number of meetings, local employers assured that the acquired skills will be an additional
Wszystko jest lekcją- staże ZSZiO w Kartuzach w Europie

The main objective of the project is to organize two week long apprenticeships in a foreign country (this specific length of the apprenticeship is justified by the education cycle in our school) for students of  Complex of Vocational and Grammar Schools in Kartuzy in their third year. The immediate beneficiaries of the project are 95 students (5 groups) who will attend the apprenticeship under the care of teachers, while fulfilling the plan created by the school to fit to the core curriculum they attend. The dates of the apprenticeships are selected in a way that will not collide with Easter, school breaks or exams confirming their professional qualifications.
Group A – 28 students – current grade 2 ( 8 students of Technical School of Trade plus 12 students of Technical School of Information   Technology and 8 students of Vocational class) will attend their apprenticeship in Portsmouth, England, under the care of two teachers, in November of 2018. They will be accommodated with families.
Group B – 20 students – current grade 2 (8 students of Technical School of Economy and 12 students of Technical School of Advertisement will attend their apprenticeship in Cork, Ireland, under the care of two teachers, in April of 2019. They will be accommodated with families.
Group C – current grade 1 of Technical School fo Trade will attend their apprenticeship in Bergerac, France. The students will be working together with the French students, just like when they are attending the project in Kartuzy. The language of the project is English, hence we will fulfill another objectives of the project which are: improving lingual competence of the students, cultural openness, obtaining the skill of working in an international team, personal growth. They will be accommodated in a hotel, and the apprenticeship will be attended in shops in Bergerac. They will attend the project in September/October of 2019.
Group D – 20 students – current grade 1 (12 students of  Technical School of Information Technology and 8 students of Vocational class) will attend their apprenticeship in Portsmouth, England, under the care of two teachers, in November of 2019. They will be accommodated with families and work in companies.
Group E – 19 students – currents grade 1 (7 students of Technical School of Economy and 12 students of Technical School of Advertisement  will attend the apprenticeship in Malta, under the care of two teachers. They will be accommodated with families and work in companies.
Each beneficiary will be given a certificate of attendance and an EUROPASS Mobility certificate.  The documents may be helpful in getting a job not only in the local, regional, and national market, but also in European market.
While attending the apprenticeship the participants will create a website which will be a travel guide for Bergerac, Cork, Portsmouth, and Valletta. The fulfillment of the project will help with maintaining the good position of  Complex of Vocational and Grammar Schools in Kartuzy on the local market of education services, continuing the practice of foreign apprenticeships for the students, having the positive aspects of such actions in mind.
IES Al-Ándalus en Europa: Formación en Centros de Trabajo de la UE

Our project arises from the intention to improve the skills of our students of Vocational Training: languages, social skills, professional skills, employability of students, promoting equity and inclusion...
We believe that it is very important training in languages of our students, and our current curriculum of vocational education does not contemplate such a possibility; thus, with our project we aim to solve a clear lack of training.
And with regard to social skills: it is clear that a mobility of 3 months in a foreign country, with some independence and a lot of responsibility, will be very useful for our candidates.
Our previous experience has been a successful program of mobility of students of higher grade. For several years we have been sending students of higher education through the Erasmus program+, with considerable success, and our intention is to extend the program to all levels of vocational training. We have been working since 2006 with programs of this type (European mobility of students to practice in company), and we have very clear benefits.
The project: mobility of our students of FP (Middle Grade) for a traineeship in a company of the United Kingdom or Italy, valuable for their diploma: Technician in Microcomputer Systems and Networks.
We will send 10 students: 5 the first year and 5 the second. One year the students will go to the United Kingdom and another to Italy. The students will have to fulfill certain conditions: to have passed all other modules of the VET studies is mandatory. The candidates can also be recent graduates who wish to complete an internship with no need to be validated for the diploma. Those who can be at risk of social exclusión will take over other candidates, as well as those who show foreign language knowledges.
Students will be required to prepare a large part of the trip on your own: plane tickets, accommodation (although you will have the option to use a residence), insurance, documentation... Learn how to develop a curriculum vitae Europass. Will have to go through several filters: qualifications (all passed), a minimum level of language, positive report of the educational team and the Guidance Department... 
The internships will last 3 months (89 work days and 2 for the trip). The follow-up will be telematic, with the possibility of an optional follow-up visit.
On the way back, students will obtain, in addition to its title of Vocational Training, some extras: a Europass Mobility certificate, a certificate issued by the company and another issued by the Institute.
We intend to meet the objectives of the Project, which are:
1. Recognition of mobility: both educational level and acquired skills.
2. Dissemination and use of project results, both within the school and outside it
3. Improvement in the quality of the procedures used
4. International dimensión
5. Multilingualism and interculturality
6. Equality and inclusion, employability and improving the situation of pupils at risk of exclusión
7. Protection and security of the participants
By last, it is necessary to prepare a report for the direction of our center and for the Department of Computer Science, and give publicity to the results obtained through the means available, such as the web page of the Center, annual Dissemination Workshops that are organized in the center, and other means at our disposal. And finally we will make an assessment of the project as a whole, face to capitalize on the experience gained.
In the long term, we hope this project to be the gateway of new international projects, and that really helps the inclusion of our students in the labor market, which is our most important objective.
