Higher education student and staff mobility project
UNIVERSITY OF PORTSMOUTH HIGHER EDUCATION CORPORATION
This is a higher education student and staff mobility project, please consult the website of the organisation to obtain additional details.
UNIVERSITY OF PORTSMOUTH HIGHER EDUCATION CORPORATION

The 110  mobilities will be carried out in the summer of 2019. The participants will have completed the 4th form of the High School Technical Institute and “Lyceum” of the various courses such as marketing and administration, tourism, foreign languages, figurative arts and graphics, information technology, cultivation technique, building construction and territory.
The mobility will be of 5 weeks; some preparatory activities will be previously done, either in Italy and partially abroad, with full-time work placement, according to the procedures that will allow the validation of this experience as the alternating School-Work. Credits will be issued by the sending schools as well as the Europass mobility document. 
As the participants are under 18 years of age, the presence of an accompanying adult is considered mandatory.
The destinations and the receiving partners in the UK, FR DE, ES, are re-confirmed, which CZ is added to.
The 6 staff mobilities will be implemented as early as  September 2018 in the UK, at the formation institution that has already carried out the previous positive experience. This activity is meant to be continued and developed using the participant's number increase together with the recently formed CLIL inter-schools working group. 
Two weeks of CLIL formation, as well as job shadowing, will be proposed again together with the possibility of getting the TKT-CLIL certification using the specific examination which the previous group has already obtained.
Moreover, in 2018 the leading institution will finance, out of its proper funds, one-week mobility also for the 2017 participants, at the same formation institution so that they can enhance their formation and become knowledge multipliers in their home institutions. 

The internationalisation plans of the schools that aim at increasing  the sense of belonging to the European Community and promote intercultural awareness, mind opening and tolerance, foresee articulated actions into:

1-ENHANCING THE LINGUISTIC FORMATION also finalised for certification. The certifications were 70 in 2017, all self-financed; there has not been any significant increase because none of the partner schools could profit from the FSE-POR funds Move as in the previous years. Besides that, the interest for the linguistic strengthening is significantly high as a surge in the inscriptions to the 2018 exams has been witnessed (270 students). Consequently, self-financed preparation courses have been set out.  Moreover, PON financings have been granted to carry out 130 hours of linguistic strengthening lessons for 20 students of the regular courses and 25 for the evening classes.
Kenney institute is a MIUR school centre for the linguistic formation of the teachers. Therefore, 6 courses for teachers of EFL to get B1 and B2 certifications have started so far.
Mother tongues classes keep going on,  as well as English language activities in collaboration with Caritas with the involvement of asylum seekers.
The one-week self-financed linguistic mini stay will go on, as well as the activities in a foreign language: theatre, film club, professional meetings with experts, workshops, students interpreters of FR and DE at the “feast of the European twinship.”(“Project United in Diversity”). Double French certificate ESABAC for 33 students and double USA certificate Mater Academy for 5 students.

2-IN ADDITION TO ERASMUS+ MOBILITY: about 40, two weeks, self- financed mobilities in AT, ES, FR will be carried out as an alternating School-Work programme as well as 15 mobilities for 4 weeks with PON funds, in the UK. 
Bi-lateral exchanges will involve about 130 students mostly between French and German schools. In addition to this,  5 students inbound and 5 students outbound are foreseen for extended mobility on “Intercultura” or similar programs.
The exchanges foresee job shadowing activities for the accompanying teachers.
The collaboration with Este Lions Club will continue to carry out the experience at Strasbourg Parliament, as usual, every year.

3-REINFORCEMENT AND EXTENSION OF INTERNATIONAL RELATIONSHIPS: with the receiving partners with whom good practices were established, with the enforcement of ECVET procedures and the achievement of the previous projects. The collaboration will go on to build loyal relationships with the hosting companies to involve the company mentors mostly.
The foreign network is enriched with a new partner, the Czech Republic in particular for carrying out work placements for students of the agricultural sector namely the viticulture & oenology ones.

The engagement towards the international opening will proceed together with the engagement to link the school to the local institutions and businesses that are the places where the participants will hand out their technical competences as well as the cross-curricular ones such as the communicative, personal and social skills that they acquired through the experiences abroad.

The SKIP2  Project has a total length of 20 months and is carried out within the framework of the initiatives promoted by EnAIP Piemonte aimed at structuring inclusive and integrated training paths which can increase the level of employability of learners and spread, among the staff (managers, trainers administrative and secretary staff), a higher awareness with regard to the central role of transnational mobility within a wider strategy aimed at ensuring the implementation of a sustainable economic growth, along with a higher social cohesion. 
The project consists of three main activities: two of them are addressed to learners and one to the staff. As for the learners, they are mainly weak individuals risking social marginalisation first, and then professional exclusion: in fact, they are primarily youngsters with few personal, cultural and economic resources - who often lack the tools to reply to the needs of a changing world, of a more and more multi and intercultural society, of an always more selective labour market with a scarce availability of posts – and thus need to be supported in the development of intercultural awareness, in the reinforcement of their language skills and, more in general of their social abilities which will be integrated to the technical competences. 
A first group of 58 learners, who attend initial vocational training courses carried out by EnAIP, in the tourist, leisure, hospitality and catering sector, will take part in mobility flows lasting 14 days in the following training agencies: Training Vision (UK), Malta Vocational Centre (Malta), European Career Evolution (Ireland), Cap Ulysse (France) and AIP Languages (Spain). Thanks to the collaboration that these institutions have with companies of the tourist, hospitality and restauration sectors, learners will be able to be directly in contact with the professional contexts. For this target group, we envisage the participation of a leader. This is required since some of the participants are under-18 youngsters, and this project represents the first significant experience abroad, away from their families, so the presence of an adult contributes to make it more sustainable and substantial for them.   
The second activity is addressed to a group of 30 learners, who have completed their qualification within 12 months or are attending a professional specialisation, for whom an experience in a European context helps reinforce the knowledge and skills acquired during the training course. These learners will take part in mobility flows lasting 28 days and will be welcome by Training Vision (UK), Malta Vocational Centre (Malta) and AIP Languages (Spain), who will organise and manage their internships in companies of the tourism, leisure, hospitality and catering sectors. They will attend online language preparation before departure.
As for the staff, EnAIP commitment is aimed at improving, at an internationalisation level, the skills of the human resources involved, at different levels, in the provision of effective training processes which need to reply to the needs of the companies, which are in return also implied in internationalisation processes (decentralisation, systemic or sectorial network, partnerships, merging, etc.). The internationalisation development thus means for EnAIP the achievement of a higher ability to prepare their operators to sustain the motivations, ambitions and personal and professional projects in a European dimension of youngsters and make them able to reply to the needs of the companies and of the labour market, so to improve their employability and to act as active citizens through labour inclusion. 
70 resources of EnAIP will be involved in updating training sessions abroad on the following topics:
- UK: Cross cultural management – for trainers, guidance experts and VET designers 
- Malta: English language – for VET operators
- Malta: Management of VET initiatives with companies - for tutors and career guidance experts 
- France: Labour services offer – for case managers, career guidance experts, project managers and VET designers
- France: Cooperative learning - for trainers, guidance experts and VET designers 
- Spain: Diversity management – for trainers, career guidance experts, VET managers and VET designers.

The 95 scholarships for learners will take place in the summer 2019, as described in the project, confirming the same countries of destination as the years before: PL, CZ, EE, SE for technological and industrial  professional profiles; UK, DE, ES, and FR for those connected to services to businesses. 
The learners will have finished their fourth year at high school; some accompanying persons will be required as many participants are under age or non-EU citizens.  Two learners with special needs will participate in the project.
The 8 staff people will stay in the UK  for two weeks,  4  in   2018 and  4 in  2019: the CLIL training module will be confirmed as the project  aims at increasing CLIL procedures systematically this is considered an investment for the whole teaching staff by the schools of the consortium
The schools  will introduce new CLIL modules, for about 80 hours, both during the first two years and the third and fourth years. This implementation is carried out through a)  the CLIL team, officially established last year, and whose members are teachers of the Staff mobility of the previous years,  b) school work groups, c) the CLIL network of 5 High Schools located in the area, born as an initiative of the CLIL Team.

The results reached so far have led the schools to  increase the participation of the teachers to international activities, therefore  the schools aim at improving the teachers'  language competence by promoting and organizing English courses  to get the staff  ready for B1 and B2 certifications. 
The international activities of the consortium, for which a good competence in  English is needed, are the following: staff mobility, CLIL teaching, cultural exchanges, school trips with visits to foreign companies, support during study holidays abroad, and Erasmus + mobility, tutoring in international competitions (Robocup Junior), guided tours to the Museum  of textile machinery at IT Marzotto, activities to support groups of foreign students of the mechanical, IT and fashion sectors  during their work-training period in Italy (in case the projects submitted  in the countries of origin CZ, BG, PL will be approved).

The consortium aims at implementing  B1-B2-C1  language certifications of the students too. In 2017 the number of certifications grew by more than 13% thanks both to European Social funds  and to grants given by Pasini institute to 31 students in order to  cover half the cost of the certification exam. 
The schools will increase the number of language courses for the preparation to the exams; 120 students, who will be interested in the Erasmus + project next year, are going to study holidays in the summer 2018 thanks to the project Move 5.0 that has already be financed by Regione Veneto with ESF.
Other actions to reinforce the competence in foreign languages will keep going on,  these actions include lessons with mother tongue teachers (English, French and German), Cineforum, summer study holidays, school trips in foreign countries,  Smarter English (a full week of language lessons held by mother tongue teachers who, during the week, will be hosted by some students' families). 
In order to foster the interest in the French language, studied  by a few students only,  Pasini institute will take part  in a National  Language Competition.
The schools will enhance international relationships even through E-twinning,  that will be implemented by 50%,  schools exchange projects for teachers, and new exchange projects with Chester and Malta. 
They  will also keep promoting Intercultura   exchange programs, although it is quite difficult to monitor the results of this type of mobility.
The schools in Schio will continue exchange programs with Landshut. De Pretto High School will organize the annual exchange professional program for 15 students with Staatliche Fachoberschule. Despite English is the language used in the work place, all the schools aim at improving German learning too as DE is one of the most important trade partner for our local companies, for this reason German courses, addressed to both students and teachers, have already been organized.
The schools will also improve collaboration with local partners by organizing conferences in English held by Federmanager and by a EU official on international issues (Industry 4.0; Brexit and the implications for European Trading), for students of the 4th and 5th year of study, other conferences will be held for students of the third year on work-linked training issues. On “Cities for Life” Day in collaboration with Saint Egidio Community, the schools organize a conference in English to debate on death penalty.
All the projects arise from the shared vision of the importance of multiculturalism and from the wish to enhance the feeling of belonging to Europe which will also lead to the participation of 40 students to the annual competition called EuroMaster organized by the Center for European Relationships and the  city hall of Schio.
PLUS-Mechatronics Ultimate Skills in Europe & SMART Specialisations

The project proposal PLUS-MUSE&SMART falls within the programming framework outlined in the Erasmus+ VET Mobility Charter obtained in 2016. The proposed project is in line with the Internationalization Strategy described in the Charter application, it further develops the experience made in 2017 and fully responds to the most recent labour market needs.  
The project is addressed to 100 participant, having obtained a VET school diploma for no longer than one year and residing in the province of Trentino in Italy. 
Project participants will have gained technical and professional skills during the school curriculum and have a profile that fits with a professional development in the SMART SPECIALIZATIONS fields. In the Province of Trento such fields have been identified with Agrifood, Quality of Life, Energy and Environment, Mechatronics. These sectors require good command of the following technologies: advanced manufacturing systems, biotechnologies, micro-nano technologies, ICT, advanced materials. The project is aimed at exploiting the learning opportunities offered by on-the-job training, in the form of a long-term workexperience. 
With a view to improve the whole local system approach towards on the job training, a mobility to the benefit of 8 members of staff involved in mobility and in dual training will be organised 
As regards the learners, the project will be not only aimed at reinforcing non-formal learning thanks to the opportunity to play an active role in a work context but also at improving their competencies and qualifications for better quality and faster job opportunities. The mobility learning outcomes will be tailored to the single participant and specialization sector in order to obtain a final certification of competence in the relevant sector. The potential companies where the workexperience will take place have already been pre-selected, in order to identify quality environments where the learning outcomes can reasonably be met. Along with the professional competencies, the mobilities will also be expected to improve participants’ linguistic and social competencies.  
Mobilities will take place in Germany, the UK, Ireland, Bulgaria and Spain, for 8 groups of 10/14 participants, with a duration of 12 weeks. 
The contents and the learning outcomes of the internships will be discussed with the companies and the participants. Participation to the PLUS-MUSE&SMART project will be based on a public open call for selections, with an application to be submitted by interested candidates.
Before the internship abroad, a preliminary linguistic, cultural and pedagogical preparation stage of 2 weeks will be carried out in Trento, to be financed with regional resources. The learners will also benefit from using the European OLS platform. The experience abroad will also include a 3-day initial induction and preparation to the workplacment. At the end of the experience abroad, 2 days of programme follow up will be organized in Trento. 
Upon return to Italy, a second workexperience of 8 weeks in Trentino will be available for the most technologically advanced sectors. This final stage will be entirely financed with regional resources. 
The project identifies specific quality tools which will be applied and combined in the tutoring, monitoring, and certification stage, both by the Sending and by Receiving organizations. 
As regards the 8 staff, a mobility of 4 days will be activated in collaboration with a German Partner Organization having the necessary requested experience. The programme will deepen cutting-edge tools, practices, methodologies and procedures, and will combine a theoretical component with practical observation one. The programme will be aimed at improving the competencies of the staff in managing and coordinating VET mobilities, and in enhancing the value of transnational mobility as a training tool.  
The whole PLUS-MUSE&SMART project will be accompanied by promotion, monitoring, evaluation and dissemination actions, to take place at the start, during and at the end of the project.

Riga Style and Fashion Technical School (hereinafter – RSFTS) has the mission to prepare competitive specialists in practice of their professional field for the labour market in Latvia and abroad by highly qualified and creative educators. The main task of RSFTS is both to teach and to lead learner to his pass towards his masterhood. There is no master becoming out of learner without practice and persistently devoted time to develop the competencies of the profession. Labour market requires highly qualified professionals, masters of vocation. Project “Trainee today – the master in future” aim is to help the learner to approach to his status of master by participating in work based learning process. This project is the great tool, which helps RSFTS to give opportunity to learners develop their competences in work based learning environment abroad as trainee.  
During implementation period (October 2018 –June2020) RSFTS will provide each school’s educational program with mobility flow considering the best time for its implementation. It is been taken into account the length of the educational program and the time, when the learner has acquired a practical knowledge in order to enter the practice and to develop the acquired competences. RSMT will implement 25 flows involving 158 participants (learners and teachers) including 8 accompanying persons from 12 educational programs: hairdresser- stylist, hairdresser, visual image stylist, make-up artist, manicure and pedicure specialist, SPA specialist, beautician, clothing style specialist, dressmaker, photo design specialist, photographer, multimedia design specialist. There will be 2 teachers and 4 learners able to participate in each flow. This coverage of all educational programs will give equal possibilities to all learners form all groups to apply.
The growth of participants amount - 3 times (participants in project during 2016-2018 is 42) is step towards implementation of RSFTS internationalisations strategy. During project attention will be given to observance of quality. Therefore there is small number of participants for one partner to host. It will give allow the hosting partner to take more individual approach to participant for to find the best placement, according his professional needs.
RSFTS will continue cooperation with our long term partners in Lithuania, Estonia, Finland and Macedonia, will strengthen relationships with organizations in Sicily and Portugal, and will establish cooperation with partners in Spain, Bulgaria, Slovakia and United Kingdom. There will be 13 partners involved in implementation of the project, among them 6 brand new. The enlarged international partner network will help RSFTS to expand its international recognition and develop its partnership in education, not only as sending, but as well as receiving organization.
There will be two types of activity: for learners – trainee learning practice and for teacher - development of professional competencies. Participation in project will give possibility to learners to strengthen his knowledge, to develop professional and social competencies in hosting organisation under supervision of tutor or mentor. Participants will develop not only their professional competencies and communication in foreign language, but as well time and finance management, and will form his personal development like independence, responsibility, initiative, adapting to multicultural environment.    
As there are mobility flows where under-age persons can be participants, accompanying person will be involved. There will be preparation activities at pre-mobility period, nevertheless the accompany person can be a great help for the less experienced persons to adapt to new environment.
Teachers are professionals in both vocation and in pedagogy. Each master needs lifelong learning for developing constantly in accordance with time and society. In project teachers develop their professional skills by exchange of good practice and work based learning process in educational institutions and in work placements at abroad, as well as by being introduced with new teaching methods and approach to trainees, new and creative ideas for their practical work with learners. Additionally, RSFTS as establisher of modular programs in educational process will advance forming education based in competencies and interdisciplinary collaboration among teachers. Interdisciplinary collaboration can be promoted by involving both teachers of practical learning and teachers of professional subjects in project and deepening their comprehension of necessary competencies of the particular profession.  Therefore it will develop more complete understanding about professions acquired in RSFTS and will form stronger union among teachers and between teachers and learners.  
The lengths of the mobilities are differenced considering the length of each educational program: 19 or 12 days, staff mobility – 6 days, excluding travel days.
ETEO - Uma Escola de Oportunidades Europeias

The project "ETEO - A School of European Opportunities", to be implemented between December 2018 and December 2020, intends to develop actions for trainees and staff, distributed by 4 activities and 10 flows, in a total of 88 mobilities:
- A1 - Vocational Education and Training (VET) placements in EU companies for 44 trainees, with 4 flows. The flows last for 6 weeks each and take place between February and April 2019 in Barcelona and the Netherlands and between February and April 2020 in the United Kingdom and France;
- A2 - 12 long-term placements for graduates, divided into 2 flows, lasting 4 months and to be held in Spain (Barcelona and Bilbao) between July 2019 and November 2020;
- A3 - Visits to prepare the long-term mobilities for graduates to be held in Spain, lasting 3 days each;
- A4 - Training of VET staff for 18 participants from different professional areas, distributed in 4 flows, each lasting 5 days. The 1st flow has 6 staff members and is held in Amsterdam, The Netherlands. The other 3 flows each have 4 staff members and are held in Portsmouth, UK, Perpignan, France, and Bilbao, Spain.
As defined in the VET Mobility Charter, following which this application is submitted, the main objective of the project is to improve the level of competence and professional skills of the participants by their proximity to the EU's social and professional realities, these being essential requirements for an integration and good performance in the labour market and the European area.
In the case of trainees, the placement hours contemplated in this project (196 hours / trainee) are integrated into the total hours foreseen for placements, which are included in the Study Plan of each course, and will allow them a work experience in a professional environment other than Portuguese, an opportunity that will make them more apt to work in any EU country. It is also considered that this experience will increase self-esteem and the taste for lifelong learning, contribute to the formation of more critical, reflective and entrepreneurial citizens, and combat school drop-out.
With regard to graduates, they are expected to deepen and develop specific personal and professional skills, particularly language, cultural competence and job skills, which will enhance their employability in both the National and European labour markets.
As for the staff, the objective is to provide professional and personal development, through contact with new and different working methods / techniques and the perception of the difference between the various education systems and the several realities of the business organisation, thus enabling the possible adoption of some of these methods / techniques and promoting the use of innovative tools in the performance of their profession. All staff training activities will be carried out in Vocational Education Institutions, partners with which it is intended to strengthen the international dimension of education and training through cooperation.
It is expected that the staff mobilities will have an immediate retribution, as professionals can apply the knowledge acquired directly in their classes / activities, enhancing the innovation and motivation of students and the rest of the educational community.
The project includes activities, to be carried out before the mobility by the sending entity, such as the pedagogical and cultural preparation of the participants; the language preparation of trainees will be carried out using the OLS platform, made available by the EU, and complemented at the school with the support of teachers of the respective languages.
All flows, in addition to the placement / vocational training and workshops / seminars, include technical visits to entities / institutions and cultural visits for professional, personal and cultural enrichment.
Considering that a significant number of trainees are underage, that many of them have never moved out of the country and that many have socio-economic needs, requiring increased attention, it is expected that each of the VET flows will have 2 accompanying teachers for seven days, ensuring greater safety of the trainees, greater effectiveness in their integration and an effective learning at various levels, particularly by holding meetings before the placements and during their evaluation, thus optimising the success of the mobilities.
After the mobilities are completed, workshops / seminars will be organised for the whole community, with the intervention of the participants, for the dissemination and sharing of the experience and knowledge acquired.
Inovativní evropské zkušenosti, postupy a technologie 2

The project "Innovative European experience, methods and technologies 2" fully accords with our ESI and is continuation of our successful project with the same name - Call 2016 and of the partner organization cooperation. The project includes 3 activities: 2 of Learners' mobilities - traineeships in VET providers (Activity 1 - A1), long-term mobilities in companies - ErasmusPro (Activity 2 - A2) and 1 of Staff training – shadowing in other VET providers (Activity 3 - A3).
In A1, our school will be cooperating with 2 host organizations: with Strukovna škola Vice Vlatkovića (SŠVV) in Croatia which we have been successfully cooperating in Call 2016 and with Střední průmyslová škola strojní (SPŠS) in Bratislava, our new partner. The project will have 2 runs in each VET organization, during which 10 minor and adult students of the 3rd year will do 2-week traineeships. Students with specific learning disabilities (SLD) and from socially disadvantaged background will also be involved in A1 and A2.
Traineeships of 20 students at SŠVV will take place in April 2019 and 2020 and Mechanic electronics – mechatronics students will be participating in this activity. Participants will spend 7 hours per work day at SŠVV fulfilling the unit of learning outcomes (ULO) and producing a solar powered car, which will be assessed according to specified criteria and recorded in Personal Transcripts.
Traineeships of 20 students at SPŠS will be held in September 2019 and 2020 and will focus on mechanical engineering students. Participants will be fulfilling 3rd day traineeships in SPŠS laboratories, including OSH training and 7-day traineeships together with SPŠS students in partner companies, where at least 7 hours a day trainees will continue fulfilling one of 3 ULOs according to a company and will be continuously evaluated by SPŠS teachers and company instructors.
The aim of the traineeships at SŠVV and SPŠS is to gain knowledge, practical skills and competencies described in the ULO by students, to gain skills with solar systems, programming of microprocessors or in pneumatics, automatization and hydraulics, to improve language competencies in English and to gain basic skills in Croatian, to gain organizational, social and personal skills. Students will have an opportunity to improve the level of key competences as an added value, which will have impact on their competitiveness on the labour market after graduating from our school.
In A2, SŠTE will cooperate with the intermediary organization Language Solution (LS) and will provide 3-month traineeships for 6 students of Business Studies and Information Technology in 2 runs in UK in May - July 2019 and 2020. Host organizations will be the same companies that have trained our students in the previous calls.
The trainees will gradually fulfil 3 ULOs created for this activity. The content of each ULO will be planned for a month cycle, finishing with an evaluation.
We think this type of Learner’s mobility will increase the quality, attractiveness and employability of participants, provide a higher added value, job-specific skills and better communication skills in English, which will maximize their future employability.
Continuously and finally at the end of each traineeship in A1 and A2, the fulfilling of the ULOs will be evaluated according to defined criteria and the results will be recorded in the personal transcripts. To acquire social and intercultural skills we are planning professional excursions and visiting interesting places.
The biggest impact of A1 and A2 we see in relation to the participants, on their professional and personal growth, gaining experience, social and personal skills especially by students with SLD, in their motivation and self-realization. The project will also have an impact on other students and partner organizations.
To ensure Activity 3 SŠTE will be cooperating with the LS, which will provide shadowing of professional subjects and CLIL teaching, exchanging experience, passing down the examples of good practice and know-how. 10 teachers will be taking part in 2-week mobilities in 2 runs in UK in November 2018 and 2019. The aim of A3 is to improve teaching skills, professional skills and knowledge of teachers, their language skills, capturing new trends in CLIL teaching, expanding cooperation and partnerships among VET organizations. A3 will have an impact on enhancing teachers´ knowledge, skills and experience and will lead to transferring knowledge into teaching, improving the quality of education at our school.
We will be using the ECVET principles to improve the quality of mobilities and education, which firstly means signing a Memorandum of Understanding for each activity will set the conditions of partnership and define the roles of organizations in the project. Certification will be ensured by learning agreements, personal transcripts for A1 and A2, Europass Mobility and Certificates of completing traineeship /shadowing for each participant.

The project ‘Employment prospects in Europe’ is directed to the students of Zespół Szkół Drzewnych i Ochrony Środowiska im. Jana Zamoyskiego in Zwierzyniec. The technical school educates in the subjects of environmental protection, wood technology, land surveying and information technology. As for education in the Region of Lublin, there are  some weaknesses in the sphere, such as maladjustment of the offer and the process of education (in vocational sphere) to the challenges and needs of a modern society, low occupational mobility, little involvement of the population in the process of lifelong learning and renewing their qualifications, and finally outdated educational base in vocational education. Young students choosing education in technical schools are interested in undertaking work in modern workplaces in their region, throughout Poland and Europe as well as self-employment and discovering professional development prospects. Thus, the opportunity of gaining knowledge of the European job market is an essential factor to achieve these goals. ZSDiOŚ in Zwierzyniec educates young students coming from rural areas and mostly poor families. Their background increases the danger of falling out of the education system and social exclusion. Thus, there is a need to strengthen the students’ social and professional position. We also see the necessity to strengthen the position of vocational education teachers, so that their professional development meets the needs of modern school and is convergent with the requirements of the European education of the youth.
The strategic objectives of the project are the following:
1. Intensification of international cooperation of the school.
2. The school (meaning the staff and students) development in accordance with the objectives of the European education policy.
3. Creation of the school image on both the regional education market and internationally.
4. Drawing on experience from completed work placements and presenting employment prospects and opportunities in Europe.
Due to the key objectives of the Internationalisation Strategy which should be realised, we have initiated some actions. To intensify our international cooperation and develop our participation in mobility programmes we have been extending cooperation with new foreign partners. It is consistent with the outlined goal of three – stage implementation of mobility. At the first stage our students take part in work placements in Germany, then they have an opportunity to participate in placements in Spain, and finally in England. Such a mobility pattern brings many advantages, e.g. wider knowledge of the European job market, the possibility of a diverse and more complete selection of workplaces for training at different stages, development of learnt at school foreign languages, and gaining the knowledge of cultural and historic diversity of the European countries. The multitude of foreign partners and cooperation with them will allow our students (and future graduates) to possess an objective outlook on the European education and job market. It will influence their future bold approach to mobility and willingness to seek employment anywhere in Europe.
The vocational training teachers who take part in job shadowing are also involved in the process of the mobility. The advantage for the staff is the necessary complement and development of their knowledge on issues related to organisation, technology and activity of European enterprises. This allows the school to adapt new curricula and modernise those used in our vocational training. The experience gained during the internships is shared by our teachers not only with the students, but also it is used in cooperation with partner companies, institutions and schools.
During each mobility the students are accompanied by the school teachers. They provide the students with care and safety, give them support of knowledge and foreign language used during mobility. The teachers’ presence influences also a quality of an implemented project due to its monitoring and assessment; the teachers also develop their professional and linguistic skills.
To sum up, implementation of mobility projects has helped to strengthen the position of our school on the local education market. Due to the location of our town, we are interested in cooperation with a partner from Ukraine. Our experience, social conditions and geographical location enable us to provide Ukrainian, Moldavian and Belarusian students with a full education offer. All these actions consolidate and strengthen our position as a regional school leader of international cooperation. All these actions are transferred into a greater interest in our school and its offer among the future students. They also improve the quality of our educational offer, which undoubtedly may lead to more employment opportunities for our graduates in the local or regional business.
